column23: A peaceful march by the opposition parties (UDPS, UNC, UDEMO, Labour Party) was undertaken to express their rejection of the electoral law.
LRA rebels kidnapped 13 people from Bili total, including 10 women in one attack and 7 men in another, but 4 of the men managed to escape.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Two Mai Mai Simba militia men were killed in clashes with the armed forces of the DRC at Penge, a mining quarry located over 119 km from Mambasa territory. A dozen others were injured.
Protests against the proposed electoral law took place in Bukavu on 19th January 2015.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column8: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column11: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column23: Clashes occur between demonstrators, who threw stones, and the police during protests against the proposed electoral law. The crowd also attacked two MONUSCO peacekeepers, injuring one. Some demonstrators were wounded and others arrested alongside opposition political leaders, including Rubens Mikindo, federal leader of the Union for Social Progress and Democracy [UDPS] in the east; Christian Badose, Ecide party's spokesman; Leon Tembo, Federal Chairman of the Union for the Congolese Nation [UNC] in the east and Jean Baptiste Kasekwa, Ecide party's executive secretary in eastern DRCongo.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Police fired tear gas and live bullets at crowds protesters that gathered in the streets of Kinshasa. Tyres were set on fire, and the crowd threw stones at police. Between 19th and 21st January 2015, Human Rights Watch report that 36 people were killed in these protests in Kinshasa. The government denies this,  estimating 27 killed in total, including 4 in Goma.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: A 22-year-old man was wounded when police tried to break up a demonstration near the parliament building. Eslewhere, Police open fire to disperse a gathering of students near to the university. Two youths reported injured by gunfire.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column8: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) National Intelligence Agency
column22: Committee to Protect Journalists (New York); Agence France Presse
column23: Authorities in the Democratic Republic of Congo shut down internet access and SMS services. The instruction was relayed to internet and mobile phone providers by the National Intellgience Agency, claiming it will help prevent more protests. Internet service restored 22nd January 2015.
Protests against the proposed electoral law reported in Katanga on 20th January 2015.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Police fired tear gas and live bullets at crowds protesters that gathered in the streets of Kinshasa. Tyres were set on fire, and the crowd threw stones at police. Between 19th and 21st January 2015, Human Rights Watch report that 36 people were killed in these protests in Kinshasa. The government denies this,  estimating 27 killed in total, including 4 in Goma.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Near the University of Kinshasa, the road leading to the campus was partially barricaded late in the morning with stones, pieces of wood and other materials to prevent vehicles from proceeding. The police arrived, threw tear gas, and made a number of arrests. One woman killed.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: In Masina, clashes between the police and demonstrators were reported. One man killed.
Hundreds of youths torch a town hall in Ngaba, a southern neighbourhood of the capital, while several prisoners escape from an attached building.
In Ngaliema commune in western Kinshasa, two public transport buses were razed down by protesters. No deaths reported.
Protests against the proposed electoral law reported in North Kivu on 20th January 2015.
Protests against the proposed electoral law reported in South Kivu on 20th January 2015.

column7: Ngbanda Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Lingotebe Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Clashes occurred between the populations of Ngbada and Lingotebe villages in South Ubangi. At least 5 people were killed, and the villagers have since fled fearing reprisals. A mixed national police/FARDC force has been sent to investigate.
At least 3 Chinese nationals were seriously injured and over 50-53 Chinese owned stores were looted by rioters during the protests against the electoral law.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: University students supported by some locals set up barricades on the national road number 2 to protest the adoption of the bill aimed at modifying the country's electoral law by the National Assembly. Demonstrators clashed with policemen who attempted to reopen the road. Karale police station was demolished by demonstrators. 20 demonstrators and certain policemen who robbed locals' properties during the riot were arrested.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Police fired tear gas and live bullets at crowds protesters that gathered in the streets of Kinshasa. Tyres were set on fire, and the crowd threw stones at police. Between 19th and 21st January 2015, Human Rights Watch report that 36 people were killed in these protests in Kinshasa. The government denies this, estimating 27 killed in total, including 4 in Goma.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Gunshots were heard at the University of Kinshasa during a confrontation between police and students who called, "Kabila get out!"

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) Republican Guard
column23: In Kinshasa's General Referral Hospital, a delegation of legislators had visited the victims from the riots. A group of Republican Guard soldiers entered searching for these, who had already left. They randomly shot at people, injuring three, including two women, one of whom suffered a miscarriage.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Students demonstrated against the decision to cut internet access and SMS messaging. They established barricades and set fire to tyres. Police fired live bullets and tear gas to disperse demonstrators. One student reported injured. A butcher was killed by a stray bullet. Elsewhere in Goma police opened fire on protesters in Goma and used tear gas to repel rock-thowing youths. Three deaths reported.

Members of the Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militia used force to evict approximately 750 artisanal miners from their mining site along the river Ulindi in South Kivu. The militiamen claim they are preparing for an offensive against the FARDC.
Demonstrations held in Mbandaka, with government and opposition supporters. No major incidents reported.

The inhabitants of Ndosho district took to the streets in the early morning. They placed barricades on the Ndosho-Sake road while others burned tyres on the road to Masisi. Some sources report two deaths, while others report up to five deaths.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: About 85 Raia Mutombaki Mayi Mayi militiamen voluntarily surrendered to the FARDC Sokola II operation force at Ibanda in Bukavu.

column8: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: About 50 UPDS members gathered at their HQ to protest against President Kabila's rule, but they were quickly dispersed by "seven jeeploads of police".

NDC militia fighters made an incursion into Kasugho. They looted and burned house and injured 4 people. The UNOCHA reported this, saying that the NDC have become more active in the Lubero area around Fatua and Lasugho recently.

column11: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri, Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
column23: At least 52 prisoners were injuring during a riot at the Central Prison of Bunia between two groups of prisoners who clashed and threw stones at each other, one of which is associated with the FRPI and Mayi Mayi Simba Morgan militia. 8 were injured seriously. Police, UN forces and military forces were deployed to calm the riots.
Thousands of people attended a march organized by the Mayor of Lubumbashi in support of President Kabila, including MPs, provincial ministers, and business and civil society leaders.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column11: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column23: The UPDS has accused the police of arbitrarily detaining 40 of its activists, and of torturing them in detention.

column7: Ngbaka Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column11: Ngbandi Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A Ngbandi was beheaded by Ngbaka community members related to a land dispute between the two communities.
1 person was killed and 2 others seriously injured when FNL rebels attacked a mini-bus near Uvira.

column11: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-), MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-), Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: A group of armed men killed 15 people in a nightclub, including an official of MONUSCO of Indian nationality, 2 FARDC soldiers and 1 police officer. Others were injured.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Residents of Mahagi rioted after the arrest of the city manager, his assistant and the sports department head. Police fired shots into the air to disperse the protestors. 2 people were injured and houses were reported burned and broken into related to the riot.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: 4 people were abducted in Rutshuru territory by an unidentified group. They were later released after being ransomed.

An oppositon march was held to protest against the arrest of a Jean-Claude Muyambo, a lawyer held in Kinshasa, and a perceived broader trend of the govenrment trying to silence opponents through the justice system. Another march (they may have been the same) also occurred against the trial of Vital Kamerhe, reportedly drawing thousands of people.
Former militia fighters protested against poor living conditions in the military training centre where they have been cantoned for five months and the slow speed of demobilization.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column23: Armed men killed at least 21 people in Mayangose-Kibidiwe village (in Virunga National Park), 15km northeast of Beni, according to the governor of the province. They were said to have been killed with machetes and the perpetrators are believed to have been members of the ADF.
Around 4,000 supporters of President Kabila rallied in Bukavu.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column23: 6 decapitated bodies were found in Bwanasura, a village 120 km south of Bunia. The ADF are believed to have been responsible for their deaths.
6 armed men believed to be Nyatura Mayi Mayi militia fighters killed a trader, and then shot a soldier who was buying food in a shop nearby. The soldier died later in the Rushuru general hospital.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Youths who claim members of the Hutu community in Kiwanja killed a trader set fire to houses belonging to members of the Hutu community. Police fired shots into the air and tear gas to disperse the crowd. A young woman was hit by a bullet and later died in hospital. At least 2 others were injured. Students were present during the protests.
8 people have been kidnapped by suspected LRA rebels, who have also looted properties and agricultural goods in the localities of Digba and Dizaga in the Ango area.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: FARDC forces have reportedly clashed with ADF fighters while pursuing them in the Virunga National Park after they attacked the village of Mayangose-Kibidiwe ealrier this week.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column23: 4 people have been killed and 1 seriously injured in an atack by the ADF on the Mbau-Kamango road northeast of Beni. They were killed using machetes.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: At least 1 FARDC soldier was killed in an ambush by FRPI fighters in the Ituri area between Feb.4-9.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: At least 2 people have been killed, 7 women raped, several children kidnapped and 300 cows stolen in attacks on 7 villages by the FRPI around the Ituri area between Feb.4-9.
Police officers protested to "denounce the omission of their names on the payroll" and claimed that they are awaiting three months of backpay.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column11: Pygmy Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A pygmy chief and his four companions were killed in an attack by an unidentified group in the Kinsunkulu area of Manono.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: 2 FARDC soldiers and 3 FDLR rebels were killed during ambushes around Nyamitwitwi Kafuzo, near Nyamilima.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: 6 FARDC soldiers and 3 elements of the Mayi Mayi Charles militia were killed in clashes in the Nyamilima area.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes between FARDC and Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militia forces have pushed residents of Itebero to flee. Fighting was reported between Feb.12-13. 1 militiamen was reported killed.

column7: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Pygmy Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Attacks by Pygmy militias against Bantu villages in the Manono area killed at least 27 people between Feb.9-15.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Youth residents of the Bankoko neighbourhood of Bunia lynched and burned alive a FARDC soldier who was allegedly caught robbing a house and killed a young man.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes between FARDC and Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militia forces have pushed residents of Itebero to flee. Fighting was reported between Feb.12-13. 1 militiamen was reported killed.

column7: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Pygmy Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column22: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse -- English
column23: 7 people were killed and 12 others injured in a clash between the Pygmy Sengatchimbu and Bantu communities in the Manono area. 27 total were killed in attacks of this kind between Feb.9-15.

column7: Ngbandi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column11: Ngbaka Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A Ngbaka was beheaded by Ngbandi community members related to a land dispute between the two communities.
The UNHCR reported that at least 25 abductions by the LRA took place during February 2015 near the border between CAR and DR-Congo (8 of which were abducted on Feb.5 in the Digba area).

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column22: Radio Okapi; Réseau des Journalistes de RCA
column23: FARDC forces investigating an LRA attack engaged in a gunfight with the rebels, leading to the death of at least 2 civilians and serious injuries to at least 2 others. 4 LRA fighters were captured during the clashes.
Political opposition parties organized a march in partnership with a Christian group in memory of the "martyrs of democracy" and to demand the reopening of the Sovereign National Conference (SNC).

column11: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Prisoners held in solitary confinement protested their conditions after the death of a sick prisoner. Military forces were called in to assist the guards. 1 soldier and 4 inmates were wounded before order was restored.
Several people were injured in an ambush by LRA rebels on a civilian vehicle in Nangume in Dungu territory.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: 2 rebels and 10 other people were killed by the NDC-R as they attempted "to neutralize any presence of the FDLR in that part of North Kivu" between Feb.16-17. 6 people were also injured.
Stores, markets and schools participated in a "dead day" strike against insecurity in the city.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: Suspected FRPI militiamen killed 2 traders in an attack on a convoy of 3 vehicles in Mussa, near Bunia. The attackers were dressed in FARDC uniforms and opened fire on the convoy, and then robbed it. The 2 traders were killd when they tried to flee into the bush.
4 people were killed and 10 seriously injured by Mayi Mayi militiamen who attacked Ezekere, near Bunia. They also burned more than 20 homes and looted property.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: 2 rebels and 10 other people were killed by the NDC-R as they attempted "to neutralize any presence of the FDLR in that part of North Kivu" between Feb.16-17. 6 people were also injured.
Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militiamen kidnapped the village chief of Nyamilingi in the Walikale area.

column8: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: UDPS activists and students marched in protest against the mayor who they say "muzzles" all their activities. Police fired in the air to disperse the march, and protesters responded by throwing projectiles. Police then allegedly opened fire on the crowd. 2 protesters and 1 police officer were injured.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Angry miners who had been dislodged from the Okapi Wildlife Reserve blocked traffic on Highway 4, at Bandegaido. The protesters were dispersed by the warden assisted by FARDC soldiers, with the soldiers reportedly firing several shots. Some sources claim 3 people died during the incident, while the administrator of the territory said that one person was seriously wounded and there were no deaths.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Gunmen stormed the Bunia Evangelical Medical Centre and stole clothes and money. They also fired on a nurse and injured her.
Residents of the Kakontwe in the Likasi area barricaded the Likasi-Kambove road in protest against the alleged polluting of the Mura and Kyantete rivers.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: Clashes were reported between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Lemera area of Uvira following the official start of military operations against the FDLR in South Kivu. 3 FDLR were reported killed, 2 captured, and 3 women and children recovered.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: A soldier was allegedly shot at and injured by two of his fellows according to a local civil society leader. It is not clear what the motive was. However, the commander of the unit said the soldier shot himself to avoid following an order.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: A police unit was attacked in the Nyamilima area was attacked by FDLR fighters.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: FARDC forces have invaded two encampments of the FDLR in the Mulenge area. Heavy weapons and machine gun firing has been heard between Feb.25-26.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A Catholic prelate was "assassinated" by unidentified armed men. He was shot five times at close range. One person was arrested in connection.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

column23: The FARDC dislodged the FDLR from the villages of Kazaroho and Kirumba, and from Chahi Hill in Rutshuru.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes were reported around the towns of Katale, Kitchanga, Mabenga and Kasali between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Rutshuru area following the beginning of their offensive against the FLDR in North Kivu. At least 2 or 3 FDLR officers were reportedly captured.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes were reported around the towns of Katale, Kitchanga, Mabenga and Kasali between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Rutshuru area following the beginning of their offensive against the FLDR in North Kivu. At least 2 or 3 FDLR officers were reportedly captured.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: FARDC forces have invaded two encampments of the FDLR in the Mulenge area. Firing has been heard between Feb.25-26.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes were reported around the towns of Katale, Kitchanga, Mabenga and Kasali between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Rutshuru area following the beginning of their offensive against the FLDR in North Kivu. At least 2 or 3 FDLR officers were reportedly captured.
Agents of the Airway Authority (RVA) went on strike to demand resolution for their grievances, and burned tires outside the main entrance to Kananga Airport.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FARDC forces have taken back Mugogo hill in the Rusayo area of Virunga National Park from FDLR forces. At least one civilian killed and one injured according to a FARDC source. The civilians were allegedly made to transport equipment for FARDC forces.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes occurred between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Nyiragongo area between Feb.27-Mar.3.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: FARDC soldiers dislodged FDLR rebels from Tongo.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes have continued between the FDLR and FARDC in the Kirumba area. 7 FDLR have been reported killed.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: A surprise attack by FARDC allowed the complete destruction of an FDLR camp in the Karhala Burhinyi chiefdom of northern Mwenga, and allowed them to take back the territory. No casualties were reported.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes have been reported between Feb.28-Mar.1 between FARDC and an Binakwa faction of the Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militia in the villages of Obaye, Abambua, and Lubilinga in the Walikale area, leading to thousands of IDPs. On the 2nd day, Obaye and Abambua were captured by the FARDC.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes occurred between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Nyiragongo area between Feb.27-Mar.3.

column23: FARDC forces have allegedly dislodged all FDLR rebels from Virunga National Park, accoding to a FARDC soldier on the front lines and a UN official nvolved with the Park. On Mar.1 it was reported that 4 FDLR have been reported killed total across North Kivu, particularly in the Rutshuru and Virunga National Park areas, as well as 43 capturedacross both North and South Kivu, 23 of whom were Congolese and 20 of whom are allegedly Rwandan.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: Heavy fighting was reported to have continued in the province of North Kivu between FARDC and FDLR forces.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: The offensive against the FDLR by FARDC has expanded into Katanaga, with clashes leading to at least 6 FDLR captured.

column23: The "general" of the Yakutumba Mayi Mayi militia was killed in clashes with FARDC in the Barak area.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes occurred between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Nyiragongo area between Feb.27-Mar.3.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes continued between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Rutshuru area. The localities of Kadodi, Nyabanira, Katwiguru, Kihito and Buramba Makoka were recovered by FARDC soldiers.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes occurred between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Nyiragongo area between Feb.27-Mar.3.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Around 20 women escaped from Bunia's central prison during which shots were fired by police and military guards but no injuries were reported. 6 police and soldiers have since been arrested on charges of taking bribes to allow the escape.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: 1 chiefdom policeman was killed and 2 governmental officials, including a tax collector, were wounded when fired on by FRPI fighters in the Walendu Binid area of south Irumu.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: An FDLR commander named Jacques was killed by unidentified assailants in the area of southern Lubero.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: Three community leaders of Walendu Bindi in the south Irumu area allegedly had their homes vandalized and one of the wife of one of the leaders was raped by FRPI militiamen.
Workers of the Lembe Olive Kabila Technical School protested to demand back pay.

column8: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column23: UDPS supporters marched to the MONUSCO HQ to demand they lobby for the release of the UDPS provincial chairman who had been arrested by the National Intelligence Agency (ANR).

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FARDC soldiers attacked FDLR positions in the Kitchanga area of Masisi.

column23: Fighters from the RUD faction of the FDLR kidnapped several people.

column10: RUD: Gathering for Unity and Democracy
column23: NDC Cheka fighters attacked village held by the RUD faction of the FDLR early in the morning. 2 NDC Cheka and 1 RUD fighter was killed, while 4 NDC Cheka fighters were seriously injured.
Women marched ahead of International Women's Day to rally for greater participation of women in the government's empowerment policies.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: The FARDC have begun operations against the ADF on the border of North Kivu and Orientale provinces, in parallel with the ongoing "Sokola 1" operations. This offensive will focus on the localities of Makutano, Bangu, Samboko, Zunguluka, Ndalya, Kalalanggwe, Mufuta Bangi and Kawele.
Residents ransacked public buildings and the customs warehouse during protests against Congolese soldiers for attacking a local trader.
Women marched ahead of International Women's Day to call for greater participation in crafting strategies of empowerment.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: A local trader was allegedly beaten by Congolese soldiers after he refused to give them preferential treatment.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Between 10 and 12 people were killed and 1 seriously injured by unidentified armed men wearing military uniforms in Mukungwe in the Walungu area. Most of those killed were artisanal miners shot by the assailants in thier sleep.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: FARDC forces engaged a group of several ADF fighters believed to have ambushed people near Kasindi. They engaged in a gunfight lasting about 1 hour.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: A FARDC spokesman said 37 mitiamen, primarily FDLR, were captured on Mar.8.

column23: FARDC soldiers occupied an area commonly called Ka Lake which had been the site of an FDLR encampment including their dependents. The arrival of FARDC soldiers resulted in the departure of the FDLR deeper into Virunga Park.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column23: 1 person was killed and 2 injured after they were ambushed by suspected ADF rebels in the Kasindi area.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: More than 100 FRPI fighters armed with guns and knives, attacked the Lagabo IDP camp. They reportedly seriously injured 12 people with machetes and raped a woman who refused to help them carry looted goods for them. Soldiers later arrived but the men had already left the area.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FARDC soldiers clashed with FDLR rebels in the Kamatembe area of Virgunu National Park. Heavy weapons fire was heard.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FDLR fighters allegedly killed 5 civilians in Kalevia during looting of the village, leading residents and those in the surrounding areas to escape the area.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: 2 Congolese staff of the NGO Save the Children were kidnapped in the Rutshuru area, but were released 48 hours later after a ransom was paid.
Customs officials began a strike to protect against customs procedures.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: Clashes have been reported between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Itombwe forests, near Uvira.

Truck drivers who use the Kinshasa-Kikwit road have blocked the bridge in protest following an order by the governor of Kasai Occidental demanding that they change their tires after alleging that their trucks have damaged roads in the province.

column7: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column11: Nande Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: 3 Hutu severely beat a Nande youth returning from Luofu market in the Lubero area, causing increased tensions between the Hutu and Nande communities in the area. This followed the death of an FDLR commander who was shot by unknown assailants in the area.
Nurses of the General Hospital Lisala have declared a two-week minimum service strike to demand risk premiums and that a local payroll be established.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: FRPI militiamen allegedly raped 8 women, injuring 2 of them seriously, in the towns of Madibe I and II in the Irumu area. The attacks occurred during a raid of the villages, during which the militiamen fired shots and looted houses.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: A FARDC general says that they have captured more areas of South Kivu from FDLR and faced no resistance during the operation. He also said that 182 rebels have been neutralized (killed/captured) during these operations, while a large amount of weapons were seized.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column22: Xinhua News Agency - French; Radio Okapi
column23: Ex-combatants rioted after one of their colleagues died while receiving lashes as punishment. They took up arms, injured 4 people and looted the military clinic.

column8: PPRDYL: People's Party for Reconstruction and Democracy Youth League
column23: The Youth League of the PPRD protested and burned tires outside the HQ of their federation to demand the ouster of the current federal policy formation committee.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column22: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse; Wal Fadjri (Dakar); Human Rights Watch
column23: Leaders of the "Enough's Enough" movement from Senegal and "Broom" from Burkina Faso, along with a US diplomat and between 26-30 other activists (including both French and Congolese journalists) who had attended a US-funded seminar on youth civic engagement were arrested. The authorities say they were promoting violence. The US diplomat and journalists were released the next day.

column7: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: FARDC and APCLS forces clashed in the Kinyumba area of Masisi.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: The customary chief of Mugbe in the Walendu Bindi area of Ituri was allegedly killed by FRPI militiamen in his home.

column10: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column23: The Charles and Shetani Mayi Mayi militias attacked the MONUSCO intervention brigade in the Kisharo area, which responded. No casualties were reported.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) National Intelligence Agency
column11: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: The leader of the Jomba group, an ANR agent, a FARDC captain, and a police officer were killed while conducting an investigation. The killers are believed to have links to the former M23 rebellion and the Bunagana Leuf political faction.
The Charles and Shetani Mayi Mayi militias attackedthe Kisharo area, killing a civilian.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column11: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) National Intelligence Agency
column22: Agence France Presse; Human Rights Watch
column23: Members of "Fight for Change (Lucha)" NGO protested outside the ANR offices in Goma to demand the release of a fellow member of their organization. The police reportedly attacked the protesters in a "brutal way" while they were engaged in a sit-in, and arrested about a dozen protesters.

column7: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column22: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse -- English
column23: Heavy fighting was reported between FARDC and APCLS forces near Nyabiondo. At least 1 child was killed during the violence.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FDLR rebels have allegedly forbidden Lubero residents from leaving their villages to use them "as human shields to deter the Congolese army to attack them in these localities."
Lucha activists engaged in a sit-in outside the office of the governor of North Kivu in Goma to demand the release of members of their organization arrested on Sunday in Kinshasa.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Between Mar.17-19 houses were looted, burned and people kidnapped by an unidentified group in the localities of Kabumbulu, Kazenga, and Kyapaswe in Malemba Nkulu territory. Many others have been displaced to neighbouring villages. Similar violence was also experienced in the Kampangwe, Mukunda and Mutabaka villages of Pweto.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Between Mar.17-19 houses were looted, burned and people kidnapped by an unidentified group in the localities of Kabumbulu, Kazenga, and Kyapaswe in Malemba Nkulu territory. Many others have been displaced to neighbouring villages. Similar violence was also experienced in the Kampangwe, Mukunda and Mutabaka villages of Pweto.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Mayi Mayi Vuende fighters and police clashed in the village of Kyaka in the Malemba Nkulu area.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Unidentified gunmen killed 2 IDPs and robbed many people during an attack on an IDP camp in Geti.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column23: ADF rebels attacked 3 villages in the Beni area, killing 4 civilians with machetes. The rebels allegedly killed the civilians while attempting to escape an ongoing FARDC offensive.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Militiamen attacked a FARDC vehicle, severely injuring a soldier and damaging the vehicle. Reports conflict about whether they are part of the FRPI or another militia group.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: A police officer was killed when he attempted to arrest a man in the locality of Makulu Mbanji and the man's relatives resisted and scuffled with the officer.

15 Congolese refugees from Zemio camp in CAR and one Congolese national were kidnapped while tending their fields across the border in the DR-Congo, in the Ango area. 13 were later released, but some had been injured and at least one girl had been raped, while 3 boys remained captive.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: 20 FRPI militiamen raided the village of Vututu in the Walendu Bindi area near Bunia. They reportedly fired several shots before looting stores and livestock and raping and kidnapping two women who were released the next day.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: According to MONUSCO, 2 people were abducted in Goma by an unidentified group.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: An unidentified group abducted 6 women and a baby are believed to have been in the Rwassa area of Kiwanja.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: 2 drivers working for a well-known company in Goma were abducted in the Nyamilima area by an unidentified group.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: At least 8 people were abducted over the weekend (Mar.21-22) in the Rutshuru area by an unidentified group.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Yakutumba Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked a military position near a forest in Fizi territory. 1 soldier, 1 police guard, and 1 militiaman were killed in the attack. Military wives were also raped by the attackers during the clashes. The attack was reportedly in response to the killing of the Yakutumba militia's leader a few weeks ago.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column23: An offensive was launched by FARDC against APCLS fighters in the Lukweti area of Masisi, leading to FARDC soldiers retaking the area. No casualties were reported.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: Residents of Nyanzale report the return of the FDLR to the area after the departure of FARDC.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: Residents of Nyanzale locality say that they have been the victims of reprisals by FDLR fighters who have returned to the village following FARDC operations in the area, including looting, kidnapping, rape, extortion and killings (coded as 10).

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: A train carrying Illegal miners who had been arrested to a prison in Lubudi from Lubumbashi was attacked by their relatives in Tenke and 30 miners were released. 1 person was injured in the jail-break as the relatives threw stones at the train, looted it and set it on fire. Police shot into the air to try to maintain order.
Two factions of the NDC militia clashed between Mar.27-28 in the western area of Walikale territory.
5 people accused of witchcraft, including a deacon of a local evangelical church, were beaten to death with stones and sticks and then thrown into the River Uele by a group of youths.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Unidentified militiamen attacked IDPs in Mulangi, near Geti, where they injured at least 8 people and robbed them.
Two factions of the NDC militia clashed between Mar.27-28 in the western area of Walikale territory. NDC-Cheka has reportedly lost control of the Twamakuru territory to NDC-G.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: 2 women were raped by FRPI fighters during an attack on Katirogo village in the Irumu area.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: 1 woman was raped by FRPI fighters during an attack on Talolo village.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A sergeant first class was shot and killed under uncertain circumstances, either by an armed group who had recently raided the mining town of Lugushwa or by other members of the military. Residents believe members of the military committed the crimes and killed the soldier in a dispute over the spoils, but this was denied by the military.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: 3 people were killed by FDLR fighters in the Ikobo group of villages in Walikale territory.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FDLR forces have raped at least 32 people and subjected around 82 other individuals to "torture and other sorts of human rights abuses" during the month of May.

6 people were seriously injured, including the Bishop of Manono, when a Christian group hostile to the Bishop attacked them with sticks, knives and other weapons. Police arrived to disperse the two groups.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Unidentified militiamen allegedly attacked the Geti state IDP camp.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Following an attack by the FDLR on Luhanga, several firefights ensued with FARDC soldiers.
Residents of the Rutshuru territory engaged in a "dead city" strike organized by civil society groups to protest against kidnappings in the area.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: 4 people were killed, including the village chief of Luhanga, by FDLR rebels. At least one other person was injured.
20 people were kidnapped by Mayi Mayi Simba militia fighters, and at least 1 of them have since been killed.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Unidentified gunmen attacked a jeep with a FARDC captain on board. During the gunfight, one of the gunmen was killed and the others escaped.
Civil society groups in Beni have announced a 48-hour "dead city" strike to protest against contradictory decision-making between the government of North Kivu and the Beni municipal government.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Around 420 bodies (allegedly two weeks old) were found in a mass grave in the Fula Fula cemetary of Maluka in the Kinshasa area by residents. MONUSCO has been informed and asked prosecutors to investigat the issue.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: 4 FRPI militiamen were killed and 10 others wounded in a clash with FARDC soldiers, following an FRPI raid of Kamatsi.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A UN aid worker was attacked by a group of unidentified armed men who shot at his vehicle and stole his belongings.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: 2 FARDC soldiers were killed in an ambush by FDLR forces in the Kitshanga locality.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column22: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse; Radio Maendeleo
column23: 9 FARDC officers are killed, and at least 9 other soldiers injured in an FDLR ambush in which at least 3 rockets were fired at their vehicles, 2 of which hit.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FARDC soldiers have reportedly claimed control of thirty-five localities previously occupied by FDLR rebels. 21 are located in South Kivu and 14 in the southern part of Virunga Park in North Kivu. They also say 237 FDLR rebels have been neutralized in total, of which 13 have been killed (fatalities covered in previously coded events).

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FARDC soldiers have reportedly claimed control of thirty-five localities previously occupied by FDLR rebels. 21 are located in South Kivu and 14 in the southern part of Virunga Park in North Kivu. They also say 237 FDLR rebels have been neutralized in total, of which 13 have been killed (fatalities covered in previously coded events).

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FDLR rebels attacked the Kitwiguru police station, kidnapped a police officer, and released him after robbing him of his gun and uniform.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: At least 1 FARDC soldier was killed and 3 others seriously injured, and an injured soldier captured, after an attack by FDLR rebels on a FARDC position in the Busesa locality in Binza group of the Rutshuru territory. The attack was repelled after 2 hours, during which time one FDLR rebel was captured and one killed.
Residents of a village on the outskirts of Lengabo demonstrated outside "the gates of Bunia city with machetes and sticks in hand" to express their discontent over a land dispute with a local MP.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: At least 4 people were arrested following a demonstration by Struggle for Change (Lucha) activists to demand the release of their colleagues.
Teachers from the six territories of Maniema have gathered in Kindu for an event, supported by the Catholic NGO Caritas Congo, to demand wages for March.

column7: Gini Lau Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: West Lau Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Two communities in West Lau area of Yakoma clashed with knives and home-made firearms, resulting in 2 dead and 30 houses burned. The two groups were the Gini Lau and West Laug groups and the fighting was due to a land dispute.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: FRPI militiamen attacked the Ruzinga Mukubwa IDP camp in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom, in the Ituri district. They fired shots into the air, severely wounding a pregnant woman, and stole at least 20 goats.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: Gunmen believed to be FDLR rebels attacked a truck travelling near the village of Fusso Buhuma in the Nyiragongo area, killing 1 and injuring 3 passengers.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: 8 FARDC soldiers out of a patrol of 12 are missing after a clash with LRA rebels in the area near Mangbanga. It was not clear whether they were kidnapped, killed, or had deserted.

column8: UNC: Union for the Congolese Nation
column23: The UNC staged a sit-in to protest against what it sees as false allegatons against its president Vital Kamerhe related to the 2011 parliamentary elections in Kinshasa.
Teachers observed a strike organized by the Teachers' Union of Congo (SYECO) to demand salary arrears.
Public and private school teachers in Masisi and Rutshuru went on strike to demand salary arrears, on the call of the Teachers' Union of Congo (SYECO).
Public and private school teachers in Masisi and Rutshuru went on strike to demand salary arrears, on the call of the Teachers' Union of Congo (SYECO).
Local civil society groups organized a march in support of the appointment of a new chief medical officer for the Monkoto health zone after it created tensions with the old chief physician.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: FRPI militiamen attacked a convoy of the NGO Solidarity. They assaulted a woman and stripped a man, and stole large amounts of property and equipment.

5 people were killed, at least 5 women raped, and others kidnapped during attacks by Mayi Mayi Simba fighters in the Mambasa area since Apr.12. The militiamen also looted villages and used both machetes and guns during their attacks, which were allegedly in response to FARDC operations.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column22: Le Potentiel (Kinshasa); Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service; Agence France Presse -- English; Radio Okapi; Xinhua News Agency - French
column23: ADF rebels killed at least 18 civilians, including as many as two pregnant women, and injured 5 others in attacks in the Matiba and Mbau areas. The 5 people killed in Mbau were beheaded with machetes. 2 people were later arrested in connection and allegedly admitted to being ADF rebels and involved in the killings.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FDLR rebels attacked the town of Ngobera in the Nyiragongo area, killing 2 people and looting cattle.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column22: Xinhua News Agency - French; Radio Okapi
column23: Between 30-40 people were abducted by FDLR rebels in an attack on Rwindi, and demanded a ransom from their relatives.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column22: Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse -- English
column23: FARDC soldiers have allegedly discovered between 4-5 mass graves with at least 47 bodies after taking control of an ADF camp in the Bango area. The identity of the victims is unknown but is currently speculated to either be ADF militants killed in clashes with the military or civilians executed by the rebels.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column22: Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse -- English
column23: FARDC soldiers have allegedly discovered between 4-5 mass graves with at least 47 bodies after taking control of an ADF camp in the Bango area. column23: ADF rebels killed at least 18 civilians, including a pregnant woman, and injured 5 others in attacks in the Matiba and Mbau areas. At least 5 people were beheaded in a machete attack believed to have been perpetrated by ADF rebels. 2 people were later arrested in connection and allegedly admitted to being ADF rebels and involved in the killings.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: FRPI militiamen killed 2 women and raped a young girl in Kagaba.
Residents of Libenge engaged in a "dead city" strike and protest march against the removal of a primary school from a list of construction project due to lack of funding.

column7: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: Nyatura militiamen allegedly killed 7 people with machetes in the Lubambo in the Lukweti area.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: One person was killed in the Lubero territory by FDLR rebels.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: 2 Nyatura militiamen were killed in clashes with FARDC soldiers in Lubambo in the Lukweti area.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column23: FARDC soldiers have taken control of the entire Mayongose area of the Virunga National Park following clashes with ADF rebels around the intersections of the roads Ngite-Vemba and Ngite-Kipeyayo. 2 FARDC soldiers and 4 ADF rebels were reported killed.

column7: Longonya Dive Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Longonya Dive Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A conflict over succession to a local throne led to clashes between 2 groups from Longonya Dive in Lubefu, resulting in 2 deaths and several serious injuries to others.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: 3 FRPI militiamen were killed and 10 others wounded in clashes with FARDC soldiers in the Muhani area of Walendu Bindi in Irumu.
About 100 Rwandan soldiers set up a military position on Musangoti Hill in Virunga National Park.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FDLR forces occupied the villages of Karangara and Rukorwe and fired into the air, causing people to flee the villages.
About 885 graves in the Segama cemetary were destroyed by local youths, allegedly on the orders of the mayor of the city.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Armed men in FARDC uniforms broke into a house and threatened a man's wife, demanding money and "specifications of discount and credit interest" at Lambert Bank, before shooting him. The man injured one of the attackers with a machete before dying.
Teachers of the SYECO union in certain schools in the Shabunda area went on strike to demand payment of their salaries.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Inmates rioted due to lack of food for days, as well as a lack of medical treatment. Police fired into the air to quell the riot.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column22: Radio Okapi; Radio France Internationale; Le Potentiel (Kinshasa)
column23: A DR-Congo government spokesman said that about 300 Rwandan soldiers made an incursion into North Kivu which was repelled by FARDC soldiers, resulting in one FARDC member wounded. The Rwandan soldiers had been encamped at Musangoti Hill in Virunga National Park and retreated across the border after the clash. The Rwandan representative to the UN has denied the events, although park rangers and local residents have confirmed the incursion occurred.

About 200 Ugandan soldiers have reportedly crossed into DR-Congo in the Ruwenzori area and settled into several villages, including Kalehaleha, Kalindera and Mumbiri. They continued to be in the area as recently as Apr.24. The Ugandan government denies its forces have entered the DR-Congo.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column11: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Following 5 murders over 5 days, residents rioted, ransacking and burning the town hall, and looting some Chinese-owned shops. Police and military forces clashed with the rioters before restoring order.

column11: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Rioters  reportedly killed and burned an "official". Police and military forces clashed with the rioters before restoring order.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Armed men in FARDC uniforms broke into a home and robbed it. They killed 2 people during the incident, the son of the owner of the house and his sister.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: The governor of North Kivu has annouced the deployment of FARDC soldiers to the borders with Rwanda and Uganda following incursions into the DR-Congo by their military forces.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: UDPS members engaged in marches in Mbuji-Mayi and Kinshasa to demand an international investigation into the mass grave in Maluku. Both marches ere dispersed peacefully by police. At least 18 UDPS members were arrested.

column23: FARDC soldiers took control of an ADF camp in the Baruku locality of Beni after 3-days of heavy fighting during which a deputy-commander of the ADF was killed.

column23: A van was ambushed near Miala, which is just ouside Bunia, by armed men who fired on it, killing one and injuring another. The survivors say that the attackers were members of FARDC and that they had ambushed other vehicles in the area.

column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: 1 FDLR rebel was killed in a clash with FARDC soldiers in the village of Katwiguru in the Rutshuru area, during which both a military position and a local police station came under attack.

column23: 1 person was injured and 3 others kidnapped by suspected "Hutu Nyatura" militia fighters after they ambushed a vehicle on the Kiwanja-Nyamilima road.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Raia Mutomboki militiamen attacked a FARDC position in the Lulingu area. No casualties were reported.

column8: Nande Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Nande from Nyamilima protested the decapitation with machetes of 5 people in their fields. Nande residents of the city believe members of a Hutu ethnic group were responsible. Nande youths set tires on fire and barricaded roads, and later burned down the house of a local Hutu leader before police intervened to disperse them. Gunfire was heard but no injuries reported.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: 5 residents of Nyamilima were found decapitated with machetes in their fields west of the city.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Mayi Mayi militiamen from the Werrason group killed the commander of the National Police in the town of Teturi in the Mambasa area.

column8: Bantu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A Bantu militia group known as "Elements" burned the Vumiliya IDP camp 1, killing at least 6 people.
Parades of workers took place in Kinshasa and Lubumbashi to mark International Labour Day.
Parades of workers took place in Kinshasa and Lubumbashi to mark International Labour Day.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: A man was allegedly stabbed to death by FARDC soldiers after being unable to pay a toll at a military barrier.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: Pygmy Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A pygmy militia engaged in arson against the Bantu ethnic group in the Kazala locality of Manono.

About 60 armed men looted homes, assaulted men and women, and forced 30 children to help them loot stolen goods. At least 2 people were wounded by gunfire. The group also committed large scale sexual violence involving the rape of as many as 127 women during the attack. At least 5 women were also taken hostage.

column8: Bantu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Pygmy Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: UN and Red Cross sources say many Bantu and Pgymies have died in violence between the two groups between Apr.30 and May 4 in the Nyunzu area, some of which appears to have been clashes and some of which has been violence against pgymy civilians. Estimates ranged from 30-60, but at least 20 bodies were burned by Red Cross workers.

column8: Bantu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column11: Pygmy Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: UN and Red Cross sources say many Bantu and Pgymies have died in violence between the two groups between Apr.30 and May 4 in the Nyunzu area, some of which appears to have been clashes and some of which has been violence against pgymy civilians. Estimates ranged from 30-60, but at least 20 bodies were burned by Red Cross workers.

column7: Luba Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column11: Batwa Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A group of Luba attacked an area where Batwa (pygmy) people were taking refuge in Nyunzu, injuring 2 people.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column22: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse; Tanzania Daily News
column23: Military sources claim that as many as 16 ADF rebels and 4 soldiers were killed, as well as 4 rebels and 2 soldiers injured, in clashes with FARDC at Parikingi in the Bango area and Kokola. Some sources disagreed about the number of soldiers killed/wounded.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda

column23: Military sources claim that as many as 16 ADF rebels and 4 soldiers were killed, as well as 4 rebels and 2 soldiers injured, in clashes with FARDC at Parikingi in the Bango area and Kokola. Some sources disagreed about the number of soldiers killed/wounded.

column7: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Residents say they heard gunshots on Sunday and later found a well-known prisoner dead in Nizi prison. The prisoner was allegedly shot by the police.

column7: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: 1 Hutu and 3 Nande were injured in a clash between the two communities in the Nyamilima area.

column7: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column10: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A MONUSCO helicopter was fired at by unidentified gunmen from a field near Oicha. No casualties were reported, but bullet holes were observed on the helicopter.
Members of the Transportation Congo (TRANSCO) union have engaged in a 5 hour strike to demand better working conditions.

Some residents of Bekeni Kondolole in the Bafwasende area have prevented the newly promoted Head of Sector from entering his office and demanded the provincial authority include a social dialogue in the chosing of an interim Head of Sector.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column11: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: 2 police stations were set on fire by residents following the alleged murder of a prisoner in Nizi prison. 1 soldier was killed and 4 civilians seriously injured during the events.

column8: Bantu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Pygmy Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: 8 people of the Bantu community were killed (fatalities among the pgymy are uncertain) and more than 30 injured in at least 2 clashes that occurred between a pygmy militia and the Bantu "Elements" militia, one of which was in the Manono area and the other in the Mukobo area.

column7: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column10: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column22: Associated Press International; Agence France Presse; Radio France Internationale
column23: 2 Tanzanian MONUSCO peacekeepers were killed and 13 others injured in an ambush by ADF rebels near the Mavivi-Mayimoya intersection in the Oicha area near where a helicopter was attacked the day before. 4 peacekeepers who went missing during the attack were later found.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: The residents of Bukumbirwa, Kasiki, Luhanga and Buleusa in the Lubero area have said they have been the victims of abuses by FDLR rebels, including killings, looting, arbitrary arrests and others.

column23: The residents of Bukumbirwa, Kasiki, Luhanga and Buleusa in the Lubero area have said they have been the victims of abuses by FDLR rebels, including killings, looting, arbitrary arrests and others.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: 10 traders, mostly women, who were kidnapped from the town of Burasi in the Irumu area in late April were killed by their captors.
Residents of Kamituka have engaged in a "dead city" protest involving strikes of social and economic activities to demand greater security on national road number 2.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column22: Agence France Presse -- English; Radio Okapi
column23: 7 bodies have been found hacked to death by machetes and axes in the Matembo area which is a few kilometres outside of Beni.
The Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militia has engaged in multiple raids in Kikamba in the Begala area of South Kivu, involving violence against civilians, kidnappings and systematic looting.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: 19 ADF rebels have been killed in clashes with FARDC soldiers in the "mountainous area northeast of Beni", including the use of helicopter airstrikes. 4 FARDC soldiers were also killed in the fighting.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: FARDC soldiers clashed with ADF rebels after an attack on Mavivi.

column22: Radio Okapi; Xinhua News Agency - French
column23: Civil society organizations organized a "dead city unlimited" strike in Beni, including strikes in schools, markets, public transit and shops, to protest against massacres in the Beni area and demand the government do more. They say the strike will end when government puts a stop to massacres in the area.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column22: Xinhua News Agency - French; Radio Okapi
column23: 6 people were killed by ADF rebels during the night in the Mavivi area.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: 19 ADF rebels have been killed in clashes with FARDC soldiers in the "mountainous area northeast of Beni", including the use of helicopter airstrikes. 4 FARDC soldiers were also killed in the fighting.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column11: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: "Peace demonstrations" were held involving hundreds of people, including students, young people and bikers who burned tires and blocked streets following a recent massacre in Mavivi. An army vehicle was also stoned by protesters. Police fired warning shots into the air to disperse protesters, but at least 1 student was injured by a stray bullet.
Nurses in Gemena have gone on strike following the suicide of a nurse demanding her benefits, including risk premiums.
A "dead city" strike has been started in the Mbau area following a massacre.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column23: As many as 37 people were killed by armed men wielding axes and machetes in two villages, Sabu and Mapiki, in the Mbau area. Thousands of people have fled following the violence. The attack is attributed to the ADF.
Truck drivers blocked the Goma-Masisi road to protest against poor driving conditions and demanded the removal of a toll on the road.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: FARDC soldiers launched an offensive against several FRPI positions in the Walendu Bindi area of Irumu that has been ongoing since May 13. 2 militiamen have been killed and at least 1 FARDC soldier injured since then.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militiamen clashed with FARDC soldiers in the Tshonka area for 2 hours. No casualties were reported.
"Dead city" strikes related to recent massacres in the Beni area have allegedly expanded beyond Beni to more cities in the area, including Oicha and Butembo.

column8: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: FARDC soldiers protested and fired their guns into the air in the evening to demand pay, after about 50 soldiers were allegedly left off payroll lists. One soldier was killed and another injured in accidents during the firing.
"Dead city" strikes related to recent massacres in the Beni area have allegedly expanded beyond Beni to more cities in the area, including Oicha and Butembo.
Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militiamen kidnapped 17 people, including some students, from Lukala, a town near Tshonka in the Shabunda territory. The abductions followed clashes with FARDC soldiers.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: The FDLR have allegedly committed crimes and human rights violations against civilians in several localities of the Lubero territory, such as a number of towns in the Bamate group and other areas near the Walikale territory.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: The FDLR have allegedly committed crimes and human rights violations against civilians in several localities of the Lubero territory, such as a number of towns in the Bamate group and other areas near the Walikale territory. This violence has included the beheading of the chief of the Batangi area on May 15 and the burying alive of at least one other person (date unspecified), both in the Miriki area.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: FARDC soldiers launched an offensive against several FRPI positions in the Walendu Bindi area of Irumu that has been ongoing since May 13. 2 militiamen have been killed and at least 1 FARDC soldier injured since then.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militiamen and FARDC soldiers clashed in the Baliga area of the Shabunda territory. Several wounded were reported.
The Raia Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militia has taken over an area along the Lugulu river.

Different localities in the Shabunda area, including Milenda, Kaligila, Mitonko and Mumbano, 4km south of the FARDC position in Tchonka Bamuguba North group, were taken over by Raia  Mutomboki Mayi Mayi militiamen.
Civil society oganizations in Beni have announced that local populations are suspending paying taxes until ongoing massacres in the area are ended.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: 2 FARDC soldiers, including a senior officer, and a woman were killed and between 3-14 soldiers kidnapped when unidentified armed men attacked a military position in Kairenge.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: About 300 FRPI militiamen led by Mbadu Adirodu surrendered in Bukiringi, a town to the south of Bunia.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Young people allegedly intercepted a Kingdom Hall of Jehovah's Witnesses truck carrying machetes and axes they say were used to commit crimes. The angry youths got into a dispute with those unloading the truck and attempted to set fire to the group's building but were prevented by the police.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: On the same night that unidentified gunmen attacked a military position in Kairenge in Kalehe territory, unidentified armed men also attacked the village of Munanira in the Kalehe area, injuring 2 people and looting houses.

column7: Bogbonga Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Bogbonga Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: 2 people, including the Bogbonga group leader and a local village chief, were seriously wounded and over 50 huts burned during clashes between two segements of the Bogbonga community over fishing rights on the Momboto river. The group leader later died of his wounds.

column11: Former Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-); Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Military and civilian prisoners of the Kisangani Central Prison clashed after a prisoner who was a FARDC captain refused to end a phone call to return to his cell. Civilian prisoners attacked him, leading to a fight involving thrown bricks. At least 42 people were injured, including 33 soldier-prisoners. 9 people also escaped during the violence, with 7 later caught.
Officials of the National Forestry Fund (FFN) protested around their offices against expanding contract positions with the organization.
NDC-Cheka and Gedeon militiamen have clashed in the Ihana area of the Walikale territory for control of mines near the town of Misusu, causing many people to flee the area.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: A rebel leader of the Gedeon militia along with 11 other militiamen surrendered to FARDC soldiers in Mitwaba.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: 4 people were killed and 1 other is missing after unidentified armed men opened fire on a vehicle, which then drove into a lake with all its passengers aboard except one who had been killed attempting to flee.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column11: UNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Party
column23: Gunmen attacked the house of a UNAFEC MPP, injuring him and 3 other members of his  family seriously.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

column23: 2 people were killed and 3 wounded during an attack on a vehicle traveling about 50 km north of Beni by ADF rebels.

column23: 3 local community leaders were kidnapped by suspected FDLR rebels.
