column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: After a police officer allegedly caused a motorcycle-taxi driver to fall of his bike, causing him serious injuries, a crowd believing the driver to be dead beat up the policemen responsible, putting at least one of them in the hospital. They then pursued other police, and forced them off the streets for 48 hours.

column8: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column23: National staff of MONUSCO staged a 72-hour sit-in at MONUSCO's various headquarters across the DR-Congo's provinces.

column8: Bantu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column11: Pygmy Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: 4 people were killed in an attack by the Bantu "Elements" militia on indigenous Pygmy's in Kitutwa village in the Manono area, allegedly in retaliation for attacks on Bantu villages in the Bakongolo area.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: FDLR rebels clashed with FARDC soldiers near a military position in Rusayo in the Nyiragongo area before looting a nearby village.
Oil companies began a 2 day strike to protest falling oil prices and customs clearance fees for their goods crossing the DR-Congo's borders.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FDLR rebels looted property and lifestock in the Mukondo area of Nyiragongo. Gunshots were also heard in the area. They kidnapped one villager to assist them in carrying the loot, who has not been found.
Residents of Beni observed a "dead city" strike to protest against insecurity in the area.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: FRPI militiamen allegedly burned an FARDC camp in the village of Nyongo in the Aveba area.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) Republican Guard
column22: Associated Press International; Agence France Presse -- English; Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Between 5-8 people were killed, including 1-4 FARDC soldiers (anonymous source in the Republican Guard claims 4 according to AFP) and 4 assailants, and several wounded, during an attack by heavily armed suspected UPC gunmen on Goma airport. 3 gunmen were also arrested. The attackers were believed to be attepting to rob supply depots at the airport, as well as potentially an arms depot, while another source claimed the gunmen were associated with an unidentified rebel movement created by Mbusa Nyamwhisi (later sources point to UPC involvement as well). At least one of those killed was a member of the Republican Guard. The assailants were then chased into Goma town by the FARDC soldiers.

4 civilians and 5 militiamen were killed in a clash between NDC-C and Kifuafua Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Nsindo Waloa Uroba group in Walikale territory. 10 others were wounded, while thousands have been displaced.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column8: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column10: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column22: Radio Okapi; UN News Service; Agence France Presse -- English
column23: FARDC soldiers engaged in an offensive against all FRPI positions in Aveba, successfully dislodging them and capturing the area, reportedly causing heavy casualties. MONUSCO helicopters and peacekeepers patrolled during the operation to ensure the safety of civilians.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: One soldier was killed, one wounded, and one was kidnapped after an attack by Simba Mayi Mayi militiamen on a FARDC position near Badengaido in the Ituri area (lat/longs not available, coded at district capital at Geoprecision 2).

column8: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column23: A nursing strike that began in Gemena following the self-immolation of a nurse has spread to the Karawa health zone in North Ubangi and across the Tshuapa district.

column23: National staff of MONUSCO began a second series of sit-ins in front of some UN mission sites in the DR-Congo, including Kinshasa, Kisangani, Bunia, Goma, and Bukavu.

4 thieves were killed by local residents armed with knives, who also burned their vehicles, after the thieves were caught allegedly trying to rob a store in the area.
Mayi Mayi NDC Cheka and Handlebar militiamen clashed over the weekend around some hills in the Ihana area. 14 militiamen were killed, primarily Cheka, while 8 were wounded on both sides.

column23: Nearly 40 university professors who have not been paid for a month or who have not been paid according to their grade protested in front of the Prime Minister's offices. They were "brutally dispersed" by police using batons, with some injuries reported.

column10: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: 5 FDLR rebels were killed in clashes around Kalembe in Walikale, and in towns between Walikale and Masisi. A FARDC spokesman said that they captured FDLR strongholds and pushed them out of many towns around Kalembe and between Masisi and Walikale.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

Civil servants working for the public administration in Kasai-Oriental went on strike to demand payment of their wages.

A clash was reported between the NDC-C and Raia Mutomboki Ngowa faction on one side and the NDC-G and Kifuafua Mayi Myai militia on the other. At least 5 civilians were killed during the fighting and social infrastructure destroyed while many people have been displaced.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

A group of traders were attacked and robbed by suspected LRA fighters.
3 people accused of being witches were beaten by young people in Idiofa.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: A soldier was attacked by the local residents, and 3 civilians were beaten in retaliation by the local military authorities. It was not clear what led to these events, but they are related to ongoing insecurity in the area.
Civil society leaders organized a complete strike in the city following a clash between local residents and soldiers recently.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Clashes occurred between a dozen police officers and local people armed with knives who had been protesting a land deal between the owner of a park and the surrounding inhabitants. About a dozen protesters were arrested but they were released by their colleagues, who destroyed the office's of the company involved, the police facilities, and released the prisoners.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: FRPI militiamen allegedly plundered the property of the residents of Mbise and Nyasona in Walendu Bindi. The militiamen also tortured some people before retreating.
1 person was killed and another injured at Niangara by LRA fighters, while 5 people were kidnapped.
Renewed clashes were reported between NDC-C and NDC-G militias, along with their allies the Ngowa Raia Mutomboki faction and the Kifuafua Mayi Mayi militia.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor

A clash broke out between passengers of an aircraft which ended up being oversold and the companies agents.

column8: Police Guards of Virunga National Park

Civil society groups organized a protest march against government measures which have blocked broadcast of a film about Dr. Mukwege, who works to help women affected by sexual assault/rape.

Local residents say that Mayi Mayi Lafontaine militiamen are in control of the Mbwavinywa region.
Former agents of the Urban Transport Company Congo (STUCCO) organized a sit-in to demand salary arrears going back years.

column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: FARDC and FRPI forces clashed in the Zitono area of Ituri, leading to 3 militiamen and 1 soldier killed.

column7: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column23: FDLR rebels raided the town of Kamade, "molesting" many of the residents of the town and kidnapping at least 4 to help them transport looted goods before releasing them.

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Following allegedly arbitrary arrests by police to protect a woman accused of witchcraft, clashes broke out between the police and youths who wanted to lynch the woman. Dozens of homes were burned during the violence.

column7: Luba Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column10: Pygmy Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: Luba and Pygmy communities in the Nyemba Mukebo area have agreed to end the ongoing conflict between them, following the installation of a conflict resolution committee composed of local authorities last week.

column7: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column10: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: FARDC soldiers attacked an unidentified armed group which had taken some people traveling by car between Bunia-Kaseny hostage, freeing the hostages after opening fire on the unidentified gunmen.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: An unidentified armed group took the passengers of several cars traveling on the Bunia-Kaseny road hostage during an ambush on their vehicles.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: A Raia Mutomboki-Sisawa militia leader surrendered along with 20 of his men in Shabunda.

Lucha (Fight for change) activists protested outside the MONUSCO offices to demand an end to human rights abuses by FDLR. They also protested against any potential collaboration between the DR-Congo and Rwanda's armies.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Another Raia Mutomboki-Sisawa militia leader, self-proclaimed Gen. Kabe Sanga, surrendered along with 28 of his men in Shabunda. They also brought with them various pieces of military hardware, including machine guns and rocket launchers.
"A militia group under the command of a certain Dominique has been reported to be in control of a large number of villages in Walikale Territory"

column10: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Residents of Muti-Kavumu raised barricades to protest alleged roberries carried out by police and military members in their area. A clash broke out when the police attempted to dismantle the barricades, including gunfire. A dozen demonstrators were arrested by police and arrested a few hours later.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: The ADF target FARD positions in Tenambo, Tungudu, Matondo, and Makoko villages in the Oicha area. During these attacks the ADF also perposefully target civilians resulting in 8 fatalities.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column23: At least 8 civilians were killed and at least 1 injured during three simultaneous attacks by the ADF on FARDC positions in Tenambo, Tungudu, Matondo, and Makoko villages in the Oicha area.

column11: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
column23: A clash was reported between NDC-C fighters and a coalition of Lafontaine Mayi Mayi militiamen and FDLR rude allies in Lubero territory, resulting in 3 Lafontaine militiamen killed, 35 houses torched, and 4 civilians suspected of collaboration with the FDLR captured.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column23: Dozens of civilians (coded as 12) were found killed in Mamiki village in the Beni area.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A dozen unidentified armed men broke into the home of a RCDN leader, terrorized her family, and looted the place before leaving a message to not make trouble before leaving.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: 4 people were killed during an ADF attack on FARDC positions in Oicha, allegedly to loot ammunition and food. At least 2 soldiers were injured.

column7: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column23: Militiamen of the FRPI robbed and assaulted four members of MSF.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column10: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
column23: Fighting between ADF rebels and FARDC soldiers continued in the Oicha area. A military spokesman said that the rebels had taken losses and confirmed civilian casualties but did quote specific fatality numbers (coded as 10).
Students and teachers of Gbadolite Presidential College staged a peaceful march yesterday against arrests and alleged mistreatment by Congolese national police.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A group of unidentified armed men intercepted a mini-bus in the Kahunga area. They killed a young man, and kidnapped 3 others.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column23: A group of unidentified armed men intercepted a vehicle of the Kanyabayonga Catholic parish, killing 2 people and kidnapping others.

column7: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column23: 3 bodies were found in Kamakombu, and they are believed to have been killed by machetes. ADF rebels are suspected.
The LRA engaged in attacks in the Niangara area.
Ex-combatants from armed groups at the transit center in the Kamina military base protested against poor living conditions and accommodations after having spent 2 years at the transit center.
The regime in Djibouti organized protests in support of the head of state's fourth term bid

There were protests in Djibouti led by the opposition Union for National Salvation party against a third term bid for the head of state. Police shot one of the protesters and later on arrested around 20 people.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: FRUD: Front of the Restoration of Unity and Democracy
column23: FRUD militants burnt down three vehicles belonging to a road construction company near the town of Tadjura. 20 people have been arrested in connection tp this attack, including people suspected of being close to the group

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Young members of the Union for National Salvation (USN) and the Opposition Youth Movement (MJO), as well as two USN leaders, were arbitrarily detained in Gabode prison following a first instance trial after having been arrested on 18 September for having participated in a demonstration. they were released on 11 October

column22: Agence France Presse -- English; Radio France Internationale
column23: Seven people have been arrested over suspected links to the rebel Front for the Restoration of Unity and Democracy (FRUD). In total, 15 people have been put behind bars for their alledged link to FRUD. they have alledgedly been systematically tortured since their arrest

A man was arrested, and spent ten days in the State Security building. He was interrogated daily, and was subjected to torture. Officers beat him inside a police van while on the way to Al-Salam police station.

22 lawyers were accused of assaulting a senior judge at a Matay court in Minya governorate after chanting against him and preventing him from entering the court. The incident was reported to have taken place in March 2013. Eyewitnesses claimed that the lawyers were "angry at the judge for giving harsh sentences to their clients in cases of illegal constructions on agricultural land".
In January 2014, a government employee also reportedly died as a result of violations by security members of the Matariya police station.

column22: Daily News Egypt; The Cairo Post
column23: A young Coptic woman was murdered amidst clashes between police and Muslim Brotherhood rioters . She was  reportedly dragged by a crowd and beaten to death. However, the state's version, which was based on a report by the Forensic Medicine Authority, said she was shot in the chest.

On 31 March 2014, several Security Forces officers raided a student's home in Al Mahallah Al Kubra. After violently assaulting him, they forcibly took him to the State Security facility in Al Mahallah where he was secretly detained for three days and reported having been beaten. He was detained for his affiliation with the Muslim Brotherhood.
A number of students were arrested on 16 April 2014 in front of Mansoura University's Al-Galaa gate on charges of illegal assembly and blocking roads.

A man died in a police station in Cairo's Matariya district. He was suspected to have been beaten by police as he had blood on his lips, bruising on his face and head and his lungs were swollen and had hemorrhaged.

A 20-year old student was transferred to Wadi El Natrun prison on 16 July 2014 where he was beaten up by officers on several occasions. During his detention he had his hands handcuffed behind his back and repeatedly beaten by three officers on his entire body and face until he started to bleed heavily; he was also sexually harassed by two other detainees under the officers' orders.
A policeman sexually assaulted a 16-year-old girl with intellectual disabilities in Cairo's Imbaba police station where the girl had been detained.
A peaceful demonstration was held in the port of Damietta, 200km north of Cairo.
Several police officers beat an Egyptian citizen in reprisal for his participation in a demonstration in Damietta and his opposition to the government.
An Egyptian citizen was was transferred to Gamasa prison, where he was tortured by the Head of the prison and his deputy.
Police forces were accused of torturing an economics professor and his brother for four days in a National Security building in Sheikh Zaid city, southwest of Cairo.
In December 2014, two policemen sexually assaulted a girl after stopping the car she was riding in. The policemen were later tried at Cairo Criminal Court.
In December, the death of a Cairo University teaching assistant was reported at Al-Azouly prison due to injuries sustained from torture.

On 31 December, the Egyptian Coordination of Rights and Freedoms reported that a 16-year-old boy accused of robbery died due to torture during detention whilst being held at Khanka police station in Qaliubiya.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column10: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-) Border Guards
column23: Sappers dismantled a makeshift bomb that was found outside a police traffic unit in the Giza district of Agouza on Thursday [1 January].
Unidentified assailants attacked a security checkpoint with an RPG west of Rafah in North Sinai. No casualties were reported.
Security forces dispersed a march in Ain Shams neighbourhood of Cairo on Friday.
In Matariya district in eastern Cairo, security forces dispersed pro-Morsi protest marches, leaving an army sergeant dead.
Pro-Morsi protests took place in Menufiya, Kafr Al-Sheikh, and Minya.
Three demonstrations were reported in Egypt's Sharqeya governorate in protest of the recent death sentences handed out to Brotherhood detainees.

A militant group named "Popular Resistance" released a video claiming responsibility for setting a police van on fire on the Ring Road in Cairo. The van was reported to have been burnt by "unknown assailants" during Friday clashes between anti-government protesters and police personnel.
Pro-Morsi protests took place in Menufiya, Kafr Al-Sheikh, and Minya.
Security forces dispersed at least three marches in Ain Shams, Helwan, and 6th October neighbourhoods on Friday. Three were arrested in Helwan and four in 6th October City.
Pro-Morsi protests took place in Menufiya, Kafr Al-Sheikh, and Minya.
Security forces shot at a car which refused to stop at a checkpoint in North Sinai's al-Arish on Friday, killing one passenger and injuring the other.
Security forces dispersed a pro-Morsi march in Helwan neighbourhood of Cairo on Friday. Three were arrested and one protester was reportedly killed.

column10: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-) Border Guards
column23: Egyptian border guards firing from across the border shot dead an unarmed Palestinian man in the Gaza frontier town of Rafah on Friday.
Troops deployed at a checkpoint in Al-Arish shot dead a militant driver who attempted to escape.
One militant was killed in an exchange of fire with the army in Al- Shaykh Zuwayid city, in North Sinai.
Two mortar shells fell behind the religious institute in Al-Sidud area in South Sinai, no casualties were reported.

Two policemen were injured in a shooting on Sunday with militants in the Mohandessin district of Giza. The Popular Resistance militant group claimed responsibility, saying that a policeman was killed. Aswat Masriya reported that one of the assailants was killed in an exchange of fire that broke out when policemen approached the site of an explosion near the police station.
A military soldier was killed on Sunday while dismantling explosive devices (IED) in North Sinai's Sheikh Zuweid. Two other officers and a soldier were also injured.
Two Egyptian policemen were injured by a mortar attack in Al-Arish on Monday.
Following the attack of two policemen outside a church in Minya, dozens of policemen gathered at the vicinity of the Minya University Hospital in protest of the murder their colleagues.
Two policemen were shot dead by gunmen in a pre-dawn attack while they were on patrol in the southern city of Minya.
An explosive charge went off at dawn Tuesday [6 January] beside a police station in Abu-al-Matamir Township in Buhayrah governorate [north of Cairo] leaving one guard injured.

An Egyptian police officer was killed Tuesday while trying to defuse a bomb outside a petrol station in Cairo. Three employees were also wounded. Ajnad Misr (Soldiers of Egypt) claimed responsibility for planting the bomb.
An improvised explosive device exploded near a police station in Fayoum on Wednesday night and injured a policeman.
A non-commissioned police officer was killed on Thursday [8 January] after he was shot by unknown gunmen in Fayyum governorate.
Two protesters were killed in Al-Haram street in Giza in clashes between the Muslim Brotherhood and police forces.
One protester died in clashes between Muslim Brotherhood protesters and police forces in Cairo's Matariya district.
A 19-year-old civilian suffered a gunshot wound on Friday in North Sinai's town of al-Arish by unidentified assailants.
A 22-year-old conscript was shot in the back Saturday evening after unidentified assailants shot him in North Sinai's town of al-Arish.
Unidentified assailants planted an explosive device on Beheira railroad. The explosion temporarily halted traffic but caused no casualties.
Two headless bodies were found in Sheikh Zuweid village in Egypt's North Sinai region on Saturday.

column7: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-) Border Guards
column23: One militant was killed and an officer was injured during a border guard chase of two cars attempting to escape in the Wahat area.
Unknown gunmen attacked a checkpoint in Giza, injuring three policemen.

Unidentified assailants bombed a building on the outskirts of North Sinai's Rafah which security forces use to monitor the militant group Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis. The building was empty when the gunmen bombed it.
A group of Egyptian journalists protested in front of the Press Syndicate in Downtown Cairo in objection to the attack on French satire newspaper Charlie Hebdo.
State of Sinai militants (formerly Ansar Beit-al Maqdis) kidnapped an off-duty police officer on his way home in North Sinai's Rafah. He was found dead in el-Muqatta village on Tuesday 13th January.
A total of seven civilian dead bodies were discovered with gunshot wounds in different parts of Sheikh Zuweyid and Rafah on Monday.
A total of seven civilian dead bodies were discovered with gunshot wounds in different parts of Sheikh Zuweyid and Rafah on Monday.
A civilian was injured by a gunshot in Sheikh Zuweid on Monday evening.The circumstances surrounding the incident were not clear.

column22: Aswat Masriya; Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Army forces and police forces raided areas hiding militants in North Sinai's al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid. The raids left 10 militants killed. Xinhua reported that the militants belonged to 'State of Sinai'.

column22: Aswat Masriya; Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Army forces and police forces raided areas hiding militants in North Sinai's al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid. The raids left 10 militants killed. Xinhua reported that the militants belonged to 'State of Sinai'.

column22: Aswat Masriya; Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Army forces and police forces raided areas hiding militants in North Sinai's al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid. The raids left 10 militants killed. Xinhua reported that the militants belonged to 'State of Sinai'.
A school teacher was shot dead in North Sinai's town of Sheikh Zuweid. Police sources suggest that the State of Sinai militant group were responsible.
Security forces killed seven militants on Wednesday in North Sinai, including five who were complicit in the abduction and murder of an officer.
Three people were killed and a girl was injured when unidentified gunmen opened fire toward them in Rafah.

Late Wednesday, bodies of four civilians, three of them beheaded, were found in the southern Sheikh Zuweid city. Three of the bodies had been tortured and severely burned, while the fourth one was shot dead.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Explosives' experts dismantled a bomb planted at a train station east of Alexandria, an official at the railway authority in West Delta said.
A police officer was injured early Thursday in a blast outside a police station in Alexandria.
An Egyptian soldier was killed trying to defuse a roadside bomb in Sheikh Zuweid in the Sinai Peninsula on Thursday.
State of Sinai claimed Monday to have bombed a pipeline in the Sinai that carries gas to Jordan, saying it was targeted over Amman's role in the US-led war on the Islamic State group.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: A public transportation bus was set on fire in Alexandria on Friday by unidentified persons, damaging the bus but leaving no casualties behind.
A car bomb went off outside a police station in Egypt's second city, Alexandria, on Friday, leaving no deaths or casualties behind.
A woman was killed after a shell from an unknown origin fell over her house in North Sinai's Rafah.
Protests in Cairo's Matariya district.
Security forces allegedly killed an 18-year-old university student during clashes with protesters in the Giza governorate's Hawamdeya neighbourhood on Friday.
An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) went off on the Suez-Ismailia railroad early Saturday, leaving no injuries behind.
A group of students in Alexandria University, Engineering Faculty, organized a march on Saturday [17 Jan] to denounce the abuse of Islam's Prophet Muhammad by the French Charlie Hebdo weekly.
Security forces killed two Islamist militia members, arrested 14 suspects, destroyed 23 terrorist hideouts and seized six motorcycles in Arish on Sunday.
A suspect in the attack on security personnel guarding a church in the Upper Egypt governorate of Minya was killed in a police shootout.

A roadside bomb exploded Sunday evening in the area around Al-Tawil village, west of Sheikh Zuweid, leaving one army officer and three conscripts injured. Members of the State of Sinai were accussed of planting the bomb.
A total of four alleged militants were killed and 27 people were arrested in military operations over the last two days in the Sinai Peninsula.
A child was injured when a homemade bomb went off in eastern Alexandria on Monday [19 January].
Family members of 20 Egyptians kidnapped in Libya held a protest outside the United Nations office in Cairo on Monday, calling for the involvement of the international community.
A total of four alleged militants were killed and 27 people were arrested in military operations over the last two days in the Sinai Peninsula.
An officer and two conscripts were injured Tuesday after an explosive device detonated south of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai. State of Sinai claimed responsibility.
A total of four militants were killed in a shootout with military troops in Shaykh Zuwayid and Al-Arish cities in North Sinai, the army spokesman said Wednesday [21 January].
A total of four militants were killed in a shootout with military troops in Shaykh Zuwayid and Al-Arish cities in North Sinai, the army spokesman said Wednesday [21 January].

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: An anti-tank mine was defused in Naj Shabana area in Rafah as part of a campaign of raids on militant hideouts.
Security forces dispersed Wednesday evening a march organised by Muslim Brotherhood supporters in downtown Cairo.

Two people, including a police officer were injured when a small bomb exploded outside the presidential palace in Cairo. An unknown assailant on a motorbike threw the bomb in front of the main entrance of the Al-Qubba palace before fleeing.

A bomb exploded in Helwan damaging the house of the judge presiding over the "prison break" trial in which ousted president Mohamed Mursi is a defendant. The incident was denied by the Cairo Security Directorate.

Dozens of members of the Ahrar youth group held a protest in Downtown Cairo. Security forces dispersed the rally, arresting sixteen. Daily News Egypt reported the protesters using molotov cocktails and bricks in clashes with police.

On the night of 22 January 2015, several members of the Homeland Security - Egypt's main domestic security services - and of the General Investigations Department - the Criminal Investigations Department - broke into the home of a freelance journalist in 6th of October City, 30km west of Cairo. Without showing any warrant, they searched the rooms and confiscated his computer, mobile phones and identification papers before arresting him. Brought to the Security Forces camp of Sheikh Zayed, he was detained incommunicado and tortured for two consecutive days to force him to confess to crimes.

column22: MENA news agency; Daily News Egypt
column23: Three militants were killed in a military campaign in Sinai between 21 January and 26 January. 23 hotbeds were destroyed, two RPGs, as well as two suicide belts and a sticky bomb were also seized.
Four homemade bombs went off beneath an electricity pole in Giza's Marryutiyah district on Friday 23 January. No casualties reported.
A bomb in Alf Maskan district of Cairo wounded four policemen and a civilian Friday. Ajnad Misr claimed responsibility.
An IED exploded in front of a police station in Shubra Al Kheima, Cairo, while another one planted at the same police station was dismantled. No causalities reported.
Protests in support of Mohamed Morsi erupted in Cairo and other provinces including Port Said, Minya, Minufiya, Sharqiya and Qalioubiya and 15 more were arrested.
Protests in support of Mohamed Morsi erupted in Cairo and other provinces including Port Said, Minya, Minufiya, Sharqiya and Qalioubiya and 15 more were arrested.

Security forces dispersed a protest in Giza's Faisal neighbourhood on Friday.

Protests in support of Mohamed Morsi erupted in Cairo and other provinces including Port Said, Minya, Minufiya, Sharqiya and Qalioubiya and 15 more were arrested.

column22: Aswat Masriya; Agence France Presse; MENA news agency
column23: A young woman was shot dead and another was injured on Friday amid clashes between Muslim Brotherhood supporters and residents in east Alexandria. Security forces opened fire to disperse the demonstrators.
The Egyptian navy shot and injured a Palestinian fisherman and arrested another on Friday as they allegedly entered Egyptian waters, just off the coast of Sheikh Zuweid.

The son of Mohamed El Beltagy, Secretary General of the Freedom and Justice Party - the political wing of the Muslim Brotherhood was brought to Nasr City Police Department, where he was tortured for two consecutive days by means of beatings and electrocution, and eventually charged by the Public Prosecutor, on 25 January 2015, with "participation to illegal demonstrations".
Two explosions in Boulad village, in Beheira led to the collapse of an electricity tower and a power outage.
An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded on the railroad in Zagazig, Sharqiya, injuring one and halting traffic.
Security bodies in Al-Gharbiyah [north of Cairo] arrested 10 elements of the Muslim Brotherhood group during protests in Al-Mahallah.
North Sinai’s al-Arish residents found on Saturday morning six unidentified bodies shot dead in the head and body.
A female demonstrator was killed by birdshot wounds in clashes with Egyptian police during a rare leftwing protest in central Cairo.
A group called 'The Death Cell' opened fire against the police forces that were guarding El-Labban Police Station leaving several conscripts injured.
A movement called the Popular Resistance claimed responsibly for an attack on the Central Security barracks in Kafr al-Dawar city,  in Beheira province, north of Cairo.
A group called the 'Death Cell' opened fire against police forces that were guarding Khorshid Police Station, affiliated with Montazah Police Station.

The Revolutionary Punishment Movement claimed responsibility for an attack on Mutubas checkpoint in Kafr al-Shaykh province [north of Cairo]. The group claimed casualties among the checkpoint personnel.

A group called 'The Death Cell' opened fire against a logistical vehicle of Sidi Gaber Police Station leaving a corporal dead. The group also set fire to the Factories Police Station, affiliated with Sidi Gaber Police Station.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: A homemade bomb was found in an Al-Mansurah city [north of Cairo]. Explosives experts defused the bomb and combed the scene, but no other bombs were found.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: A group called 'The Death Cell' planted several explosive charges in public squares and streets in Alexandria; several of them were defused by bomb experts.

Explosions targeted a main gas pipeline, two buses and five 'electric transformers' located in residential neighbourhoods in the 10th of Ramadan City in Sharqeya on Sunday with no reported casualties.
One man was killed when planting explosive devices near a power plant in Damietta province.
Two high-pressure electricity towers in Quwisna and Kafr al-Zayyat were subjected to sabotage acts at 0400am (0200gmt) on Sunday.

column22: Agence France Presse; Tunis Afrique Presse (Tunis); Aswat Masriya (Cairo)
column23: Two police officers were injured by shrapnel when a roadside bomb exploded in Alf Maskan district in eastern Cairo. Ajnad Misr claimed responsibility.
A locally-made bomb exploded Sunday morning in Qarun square in Al-Fayyum province. No casualties were reported.
Two high-pressure electricity towers in Quwisna and Kafr al-Zayyat were subjected to sabotage acts at 0400am (0200gmt) on Sunday.
A home-made bomb went off near a railway in Al-Minufiyah governorate. No casualties were reported.
A Muslim Brotherhood-linked group called 'Revolutionary Punishment Movement in Suez' claimed responsibility for detonating two sound bombs near police stations in Suez governorate. No casualties.
A Muslim Brotherhood rally took place in Ain Shams district of Cairo. One man was killed after being shot in the head by live rounds during clashes.
A protest was staged by Kifayah movement and revolutionary forces at Sawaqi Square in the Fayyum governorate.

One police officer was injured in a protest in Giza, where around 200 reported Brotherhood members gathered. The protesters fired bullets and birdshot at security forces and set fire to the Haram district building using Molotov cocktails.

column22: Agence France Presse; Aswat Masriya (Cairo); Tunis Afrique Presse (Tunis); MENA news agency
column23: At least 17 people were killed on Sunday in clashes between police and protesters in Cairo's eastern Matariyah district.
Protests were reported in the city of Menufiya, "repeating anti-army and -police chants, which provoked the locals to clash with them".
A pro-Mohamed Mursi protester was killed when security forces dispersed a Muslim Brotherhood rally in Muntazah district of Alexandria. The protester was armed and shooting at residents.
The Students Against the Coup movement (SAC) posted a picture of an overturned police truck on the side of the road in the city of Balteem.
Skirmishes between supporters of al-Sisi and people injured during the 2011 uprisings were reported outside the press syndicate in Cairo. Security forces fired teargas to disperse them.

Security forces dispersed two rallies staged by several members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in Kafr al-Shaykh. Security forces used tear gas to disperse the protesters who set fire to wood and car tires.
Injuries were reported in Minya governorate during protests on 25th January.
A number of members of the Muslim Brotherhood threw fireworks on the central security camp in Al-Zaqaziq in Al-Sharqiyah province, north of Cairo, but no casualties were reported.
An Alexandrian citizen was killed in Muntazah district on Sunday when Muslim Brotherhood protesters shot randomly at residents during a protest commemorating the January 2011 uprising.
Four photojournalists and one reporter were injured as a result of birdshots, in addition to three who were assaulted and beaten whilst covering protests in Cairo.
State of Sinai members were accused of kidnapping a young man in North Sinai who belongs to one of the tribes south of Sheikh Zuweid.
A reporter for the daily Al-Fagr was assaulted by pro-government demonstrators near Tahrir Square.
A conscript was wounded in a shootout between gunmen and police forces at Shaykh Zuwayid police station.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor

A home-made explosive charge went off in a toilet at Aswan court complex on Monday. Civil defense forces and bomb-disposal experts rushed to the scene to look for more bombs.

Three explosive charges went off in a sanitary drainage line and transformers in Minya al-Qamh and Al-Zaqaziq cities, in Al-Shaqiyah. No casualties reported. Disposal experts and defense forces rushed to the scene to search for more bombs and put out the fire in the transformers.

Student protesters carried out "surprise morning marches" early Monday morning in Cairo's Alf Maskan and Ain Shams neighbourhoods
Protests erupted Monday in Alexandria, Damietta, Fayoum, Beni Suef, Kafr Al-Sheikh and North Sinai.
Protests erupted Monday in Alexandria, Damietta, Fayoum, Beni Suef, Kafr Al-Sheikh and North Sinai.
Clashes between Muslim Brotherhood protesters and security forces in Matariya, Cairo renewed Monday night. One reportedly killed.
A city tram was set on fire in Alexandria by unidentified people. The tram was burned after a number of Molotov cocktails were thrown at it. Nobody is reported to have been injured in the blaze.
Protests erupted Monday in Alexandria, Damietta, Fayoum, Beni Suef, Kafr Al-Sheikh and North Sinai.
Protesters set ablaze the road leading to the Zohour police station in the Port Said governorate.
Protesters in Assiut escalated their demonstrations and blocked the Assiut-Cairo highway.

Protesters created a number of road blockades in Cairo and other governorates.
Protests erupted Monday in Alexandria, Damietta, Fayoum, Beni Suef, Kafr Al-Sheikh and North Sinai.
One person was reported killed and at least two people were injured in acts of violence during protests in Hilwan [southern Cairo] Monday night [26 January].
Protests erupted Monday in Alexandria, Damietta, Fayoum, Beni Suef, Kafr Al-Sheikh and North Sinai.
"Revolutionaries" set fire to the highway in front of Mall of Arabia in 6th October city.
Student protesters carried out "surprise morning marches" early Monday morning in Cairo's Alf Maskan and Ain Shams neighbourhoods.

A fire erupted in a store of Mobinil, the country's second-largest mobile services provider, in Shubra al-Khaymah in Al-Qalyubiyah [north of Cairo] on Monday. Someone threw a Molotov cocktail at the store. One of the attackers was reported dead of severe burns he got during the attack.
Security forces found three bodies with gunshots in a desert area in eastern Arish.
A train carriage was set ablaze in Shebin al-Kom station in Menufia, leaving at least 25 injured. Unknown men threw molotov cocktails inside.
Eight people were injured at a police checkpoint when unknown assailants threw a bomb in Shubra al-Khaymah in Al-Qalyubiyah.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: An unidentified person threw a bomb against the Abu Za'bal police station in Kankha in Qalyubia province. No injuries reported.

column23: Two bombs were defused in Al-Wifaq area in Rafah and Al-Barahmah area in Al-Shaykh Zuwayid

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Unidentified assailants targeted railway stations in Aswan with two bombs. Bomb-disposal experts difused them.

column23: Bomb-disposal experts and civil defence forces managed on Tuesday [27 January] to defuse several bombs planted by unidentified persons in the governorate of Kafr al-Shaykh.

column23: Bomb-disposal experts and civil defence forces managed on Tuesday [27 January] to defuse several bombs planted by unidentified persons in the governorate of Al-Minufiyah.

column22: MENA news agency; Daily News Egypt
column23: A bomb went off in Fayoum close to a police station leaving one minor injury. Bomb-disposal experts and civil defence forces managed to defuse other bombs planted by unidentified persons.

A car carrying an explosive device exploded in the vicinity of a police station in Montazah district of of Alexandria, killing one of the Muslim Brotherhood passengers and injuring two other passengers.
Security forces evacuated a building at the Heliopolis Court on Tuesday after finding two explosive devices in its vicinity. One of the bombs detonated upon inspection.
A bomb went off Tuesday morning in Port Said near the temporary headquarters of the Workers' Union Federation. No casualties were reported.
The Muslim Brotherhood's political wing, the Freedom and Justice Party (FJP), said that protesters marched in Fayoum.

Unidentified men Tuesday [27 January] set fire to a police station in Hannoville district in western Alexandria governorate. The fire broke out after those unknown persons hurled Molotov cocktails at the police station.
The pro-Morsi group Students Against the Coup (SAC) reported protests in Daqahleya governorate.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: In Cairo's downtown, bomb experts dismantled an explosive device, which was found at a bus stop in Abdel Moneim Riyadh Square on Wednesday morning.
An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded inside the Kom Ombo court in the southern Egyptian city of Aswan on Wednesday. No casualties were reported.
A sound bomb was detonated in Qena, while another was dismantled by security forces close to a checkpoint on Wednesday.
Security forces in Al-Qalubiyah province, north of Cairo, broke up a rally that was staged by supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood on Wednesday [28 January].
A number of Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested as they attempted to block the Cairo-Alexandria road in Damanhur.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Unidentified assailants set fire to a train in Shibin Qanatir- Marj on Wednesday [28 January]. No casualties reported.
State of Sinai attacked a number of army checkpoints, police HQ's and military bases in North Sinai's Al-Arish, killing at least 30 people.
A policeman sustained gunshot wounds to his head after four unknown assailants opened fire at him in upper Egypt's Minya governorate.
A police officer was killed when militants threw a bomb at him in the canal city of Suez.
An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded on the Fayoum-Wasty railroad. No casualties were reported.
An officer was killed when a rocket struck an army checkpoint in the town of Rafah.

Dozens of women protested Thursday against Egypt's police in the central Cairo square where a female demonstrator was shot dead on the eve of the anniversary of the 2011 uprising. A rival demonstration was held across the road.
A decapitated body was found in North Sinai's Sheikh Zuweid city.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Two people were arrested Thursday while trying to plant bombs in the Al-Warraq neighbourhood in Giza. Police forces shot at them, and one of them was injured and transferred to Agouza hospital to receive medical treatment.
Egypt's army clashed with militants responsible for killing over 26 security officers the day before in North Sinai, leaving two children dead.
One person was injured when an improvised explosive device targeting security forces exploded in Alexandria.
On Friday, police arrested tens of pro-Morsi protesters affiliated with the Brotherhood in the provinces Alexandria, Fayoum, Qena, Sharqiya and Gharbiya.

An Egyptian interior ministry employee was killed in North Sinai. He was shot in the head in his home in the regional capital of El-Arish.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a security patrol in Suez governorate on Saturday [31 January]. Security forces exchanged fire with the gunmen and chased them. No injuries were reported.
Two sound bombs went off near one of the electricity towers in Tukh on Saturday [31 January 2015]. No injuries reported.
Armed forces killed three militants during an exchange of fire in North Sinai's Rafah on Saturday evening. Six military personnel were injured.
In Fayoum, a member of the now banned Muslim Brotherhood was arrested on charges of firing flares near the Fayoum police station.
The Ministry of Interior announced Saturday night that it arrested three suspects after they attempted to burn the Giza police station using birdshot and flares.
In the neighbourhood of Matariya in eastern Cairo, two people were arrested for torching a public transportation bus and attacking security forces.
Local residents and relatives of a man who died in police custody, demonstrated in front of Rod Al-Farag police station, claiming he was tortured to death.

column22: Agence France Presse; Daily News Egypt
column23: An Egyptian policeman shot dead a Muslim Brotherhood member detained in a Cairo hospital with injuries from his arrest.
A detainee in Rod Al-Farag police station, a northern Cairo neighbourhood, died Saturday while in police custody. It is claimed he was tortured.

In Menufiya governorate, a police sergeant killed a citizen during a fight. The victim was involved in an altercation with the sergeant's brother and when the sergeant arrived he shot the victim dead.
'State of Sinai' claimed in a statement Sunday an attack on a military vehicle in northern Al-Al-Arish, but did not mention casualties.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Explosive experts dismantled a bomb beside the Borg Al-Arab post office in Alexandria Sunday.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: A militant cell was arrested while attempting to torch a power transformer in Zagazig.
A stun bomb went off in Arish on Sunday with no casualties reported.
In Cairo's Imbaba district, a civilian was shot dead by police after he failed to produce a proper license.
Unidentified gunmen shot at an army conscript in North Sinai's al-Arish city on Monday, causing his injury.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces raided an educational center in Alexandria and arrested 29 people, mostly students and members of the Muslim Brotherhood, for allegedly planning protests.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: On Monday evening, a bomb was dismantled in Qaliubya planted by unidentified men.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: An Egyptian court on Monday sentenced 183 people to death over the ransacking of a police station and the killing of 15 policemen after the 2013 ouster of President Mohammed Morsi.
The gas pipeline in Al-Arish exploded for the 28th time Monday night, while a bomb was successfully diffused near the south of the city.
A child was killed and two people were injured in mortar attacks on two houses near North Sinai's Rafah city.
Six members of the Muslim Brotherhood used shotguns, stones and petrol bombs to attack a bank and restaurant branches in Giza on 2 February.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces thwarted on Tuesday [3 February] an attempt to detonate the main water pipeline in Tukh city of Al-Qalyubiyah Governorate [north of Cairo]. People affiliated to the Muslim Brotherhood were arrested and the bomb was defused.

column22: Aswat Masriya (Cairo); Associated Press International; MENA news agency; Daily News Egypt
column23: Three people were killed in an IED explosion in Agami district of Alexandria on Tuesday. Another bomb went off close to a gas station but with no injuries reported.

column22: Aswat Masriya (Cairo); Xinhua General News Service
column23: An Improvised Explosive Device went off in the vicinity of Talaat Harb Square in downtown Cairo early Tuesday, leaving four people injured.
An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded Tuesday near a branch of the defence ministry in Nasr City. No casualties reported.
An explosive device went off after the passage of a military convoy in North Sinai's Rafah on Tuesday, leaving no casualties or losses.
A militant group called 'Popular Resistance in Giza' released a two-minute video showing masked gunmen setting fire to an Emirates National Bank branch in Haram Street in Giza with molotov cocktails.
A number of people belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood set the Alexandria tram in Al-Wardian area ablaze by throwing molotov cocktails at the carriage, but no casualties were reported.

Some two dozen demonstrators gathered at the Doctors' Association in the Egyptian capital on Tuesday, demanding that the army release information about a promised cure for AIDS and hepatitis it has delayed since last year.
The Ministry of Religious Endowments organised a demonstration Tuesday, in front of Abbasiya's Al-Noor Mosque, in solidarity with the armed forces and the police.
One person was killed when unknown militants on a motorcycle threw flammable materials and shot at a Kentucky Fried Chicken restaurant in Birket al Saba, Quweisna city, Menoufia province.
One conscript was killed and another was injured in a drive-by shooting by unidentified assailants outside a hotel in North Sinai's al-Arish.
A girl was killed and four men were injured when a homemade bomb exploded on Friday [6 Feb] in eastern Alexandria.
Two home-made bombs went off on Friday [6 February] near 6th of October police station. No injuries were reported.
A bomb exploded Friday night near a police facility stationed around the Saqqara area, after "unknown assailants planted the device".
Twenty-five State of Sinai militants were killed and at least 20 others were injured on Friday in a military aerial bombardment over North Sinai's town of Sheikh Zuweid.
State media reported that pro-army demonstrations took place in the cities of Mahallah and Hurghada. No reports mentioned that the protests were dispersed by the police.

Fierce clashes erupted Friday [6 February] between security forces and members of the Muslim Brotherhood group in Cairo's densely populated neighbourhood of Matariya [East of Cairo]. The Brotherhood members attacked police and citizens with fireworks.
A number of citizens gathered in Cairo's downtown Square of Abd-al-Mun'im Riyadh to support the army and police in their fight against terrorism.

column22: MENA news agency; Daily News Egypt
column23: A number of rallies were staged nationwide to condemn terrorism and to support the army and police. The rallies were launched in Tanta, Damietta and Marsa Matruh. State media mentioned that some police personnel participated in the protest in Marsa Matruh.

Security forces shot dead a civilian at a security checkpoint in North Sinai's Sheikh Zuweid late Friday.
Three policemen were shot dead and two others injured when they came under fire near the southern city of Minya. The policemen were conducting a raid against assailants in Damshou Hashem.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor

Two people were injured, and five shops were shattered in separate bomb explosions across Helwan on Sunday.
A bomb exploded in front of the Sheikh Zayed youth centre in 6th of October City.

"State of Sinai", formally known as Ansar Beit Al-Maqdis, claimed responsibility on Sunday for an IED explosion that resulted in "the burning and destruction" of a military vehicle in Rafah. Although a number of deaths reportedly occurred in the incident, an official statement was not released regarding the explosion.

Students at Al-Azhar University kicked off the new semester with short protests on campus. Security forces entered Al-Azhar University shortly after female students joined for a protest in front of the cafeteria.
More than 50 Syrian and Palestinian refugees detained in an Alexandria jail announced a hunger strike to protest "inhumane treatment".
Following the violent dispersal of fans by police forces in Cairo, numbers of them rallied outside the stadium and set a police car ablaze in protest of the violence against them.
Students at Cairo University and Al-Azhar University protested on campus.

At least 26 fans arrested following a deadly stampede at a Cairo football stadium last week were tortured in Abu Nomros police station in Giza. Detainees were subject to electrocution and beatings with weapons at the hands of police in the station.

column22: Xinhua General News Service; Daily News Egypt
column23: At least 22 Egyptian soccer fans were killed and some 20 others injured on Sunday night in the capital Cairo. The fans were killed due to suffocation and stampede after police forces used teargas to disperse them.
A video released by State of Sinai militants showed the assassination of two Egyptian soldiers by masked militants in Arish.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Eight hideouts were destroyed on Monday during security campaigns in the North Sinai city of Sheikh Zuweid.
The army killed 15 Islamist militants in an air raid late on Monday in three villages of Sheikh Zuweid city. The raids targeted houses of members of State of Sinai.

At the Faculty of Engineering of Alexandria University, students organized a march in protest against the incidents that took place Sunday night when scores of fans were killed and wounded in a stampede during the Zamalek-Enppi soccer match in Cairo.
Unidentified assailants shot dead a North Sinai resident they had earlier kidnapped under the pretext that he was "cooperating with security apparatuses".

column22: Xinhua General News Service; Daily News Egypt
column23: On Monday, State of Sinai released a video purporting to show the beheading of 6 Bedouin men, over allegations of providing the Egyptian army with information about their bases.
A child received a gunshot wound to the head during clashes between security forces and "extremists" in North Sinai's Rafah and was rushed to hospital.
Seven militants were killed and eight others arrested in clashes with the armed forces in Sheikh Zuweid city on Tuesday.
A conscript was injured in North Sinai's town of Sheikh Zuweid on Tuesday after unidentified gunmen shot at him.

column22: Xinhua General News Service; Agence France Presse
column23: At least nine civilians were wounded on Tuesday when a bomb went off at a police station in Egypt's coastal city of Alexandria
Two bombs exploded in Smouha (Sidi Gabir) in Alexandria causing no casualties.
A bomb exploded outside a police station in Raml wounding one civilian.

column22: Xinhua General News Service; Agence France Presse
column23: A bomb,  planted outside a police station in the Sidi Beshir part of Alexandria exploded, causing no casualties.

4 militants were killed in land raids during security operations in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
13 militants were killed in an airstrike during security raids in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai.
A soldier was killed on Thursday [12 February] when unknown gunmen opened fire at him in the district of Al-Hassana, central Sinai.

Over the past week, five bombs exploded on railways from Cairo to Alexandria, Cairo to Aswan, and Giza, while two exploded on the Cairo-Tanta and Gharbeya railways. The explosions delayed up to seven trips per day in both directions, and damaged the rails for a distance of up to 80km.

Between 8 and 18 suspected militants were killed on Friday in military air strikes over North Sinai's border town of Rafah. One of the suspected militants belonged to the Sinai-based militant group Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis (State of Sinai).
Families of the 20 Coptic Egyptians kidnapped in Libya demonstrated outside the journalists' syndicate in downtown Cairo on Friday demanding their release.
In Alf Maskan district, protests were forcibly dispersed by police.
A soldier was injured after armed assailants shot him in the head. The 24-year-old soldier was attacked while standing at a security site in central Sinai.

column22: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International
column23: Two suicide car bombs from Islamic militants wounded six people on Saturday when officers fired on the vehicles as they approached a police station in Sheikh Zuweid, in the Sinai Peninsula.
A conscript was killed and three others injured in an armed attack on a security checkpoint in the Kafr al-Jazzar area of Banha, in the governorate of Qalyubia to the north of Cairo.

A bomb exploded and damaged parts of the railway in the Tanta neighbourhood of Kafr Dima Shoubra, and no injuries were reported.
Unidentified gunmen attacked a security checkpoint in North Sinai's al-Arish on Monday night, injuring a conscript and two civilians.
At a protest gathering outside the union of journalists in Cairo, relatives of detained Egyptian men in Libya appealed to the Egyptian authorities to help secure their release.

Dozens of Egyptian Muslims and Christians organized a march outside Saint Mark Coptic Orthodox Cathedral in Cairo in protest of the beheading of 21 kidnapped Egyptian Copts by Da'ish militants in Libya.
Following a funeral for the 21 Egyptians killed in Libya, a large protest was staged in the village of Al-Our in Minya to condemn the beheadings.
A conscript with the Central Security Forces was injured in an attack by unidentified assailants while on duty in Rafah.
Three militants were killed in ground raids by the Egyptian military near Sheikh Zuweid.

Six militants were killed in air raids by the Egyptian army near North Sinai's Sheikh Zuweid.

A civilian was killed in an explosion in the vicinity of the October 6 Police Station in Giza.

A policeman was killed on Saturday after unidentified assailants driving a car hit him near North Sinai's Sheikh Zuweid city.

A bomb attached to railway tracks at Kafr al-Zayyat station blew up. Sappers also found another explosive device but they managed to defuse it.

A lawyer died on 22 February inside Matariya police station. His death occured after "being tortured by electric shocks and being tied from the ceiling for eight hours, which caused an internal hemorrhage".

Around 100 farmers from Sadat in the Delta governorate of Menufiya gathered outside the Press Syndicate in Downtown Cairo Monday to protest against the government ignoring their demands over land sales.

Animal rights enthusiasts held a demonstration outside Cairo Opera House condemning the killing of a dog and calling on President Abdel Fattah Al-Sisi to issue a stricter animal rights law.
Two people were killed and seven others, including a police conscript, were injured in a blast outside a police station in Upper Egypt's city of Aswan.
Approximately 150 members of Cairo's lawyers syndicate demonstrated against the death of a colleague, who is believed to have died at the hands of police officers at Matariya police station .

Outside Samalout bishopric, dozens of Copts from the village of al-Galaa' gathered to protest their suffering at the hands of Islamists in their village.
An improvised explosive device went off near Maadi's fire station, causing no injuries.
An explosive device went off in front of a police station in Al-Nozha, causing no injuries.

An improvised explosive device exploded in front of the main gate of the High Court in central Cairo, killing 2 civilians and injuring 11. Seven of the injured are security personnel, believed to be the intended target. A group named "Revolutionary punishment" claimed responsibility.
Minor clashes erupted in Assiut between student protesters and administrative security officials at Al-Azhar University. The clashes left the university's gate burning.

A policeman was injured in a drive by shooting in Fayoum on Friday.

Individuals belonging to the Revolutionary Punishment group admitted to placing a bomb under an officer's car in Nasr City. Two cars were bombed around 8 March in the embassy district of Nasr City.
A bomb exploded Monday morning in front of a bank in Alexandria, leaving no injuries.

An improvised explosive device went off in the coastal Alexandria city's Semouha neighbourhood early Monday, leaving no injuries. The blast  damaged a large part of one of the telecommunication branches.

Three military conscripts were killed and three injured in an explosion when gunmen remotely detonated a roadside bomb when a military vehicle drove by, near a security checkpoint in Sheikh Zuweid city in North Sinai on Monday.
Tens of Ultras White Knights students protested in Cairo's Helwan university.
In Al-Fayum, a policeman was wounded when gunmen riding a bike opened fire at him.

A blast outside a central security forces camp in North Sinai's al-Arish city killed two people, including a an electrical worker and the suicide bomber and left 30 injured on Tuesday. Security personnel responded by firing at the car. Ansar Beit al-Maqdis (Partisans of Jerusalem), said on Twitter it carried out the assault on the police base.

column22: MENA news agency; Aswat Masriya (Cairo); Nile News TV
column23: Militants set up a fake security checkpoint on a road, south of al-Arish city. When an armoured security vehicle moved toward the fake checkpoint, an improvised explosive device detonated. Two officers were killed and three conscripts injured.
Two people were killed in the early hours of Tuesday when an improvised explosive device they were carrying exploded in Fayoum to the southwest of Cairo.

Security forces of North Sinai Security Directorate launched Wednesday [11 March] a security campaign in southern Al-Arish and Al-Shaykh Zuwayid. A total of 45 militants were killed in the second week of March  in gunfire exchange, air raids and targeting of headquarters in North Sinai.
A military officer was killed in North Sinai's Rafah city during an attack on a security checkpoint on Wednesday.

Security forces of North Sinai Security Directorate launched Wednesday [11 March] a security campaign in southern Al-Arish and Al-Shaykh Zuwayid. A total of 45 militants were killed in the second week of March  in gunfire exchange, air raids and targeting of headquarters in North Sinai.
Four bombs went off in the 10th of Ramadan City of Al-Sharqiyah governorate, north of Cairo. They caused no damage. Security forces dismantled four other bombs placed under two electricity pylons.
Three policemen were injured Wednesday [11 March] when a bomb planted under a police vehicle went off near a police station in Al-Mansurah [district of Al-Dakahliyah province, north of Cairo].

column22: News Bites - Middle East & North Africa: Egypt
column23: 500 workers in a Suez Cement factory protested a proposed profit share distribution.
A home-made bomb went off near a mobile company store in Al-Manyal district [Giza province] early Thursday with no casualties reported.
A sound bomb exploded near Luxor court complex on 12th March. No injuries were reported. Sappers defused another bomb in the precincts of the complex.
A makeshift bomb exploded outside the Commercial International Bank [CIB] in Sadat City in Al-Munufiyah [north of Cairo] on Thursday but no casualties or damage were reported.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Egyptian army troops stationed on the border with Gaza opened fire on posts of the Palestinian national security forces on the evening of 13 March. Al-Risalah correspondent reported that a volley of heavy gunfire was opened at security posts in the Egyptian-Palestinian border area. No injuries were reported.
Three small bombs went off in an upscale Cairo neighbourhood popular with expatriates. No casualties were reported.
Three soldiers were wounded in a rocket attack in Sinai, north of Sharm El-Sheikh.

The Egyptian army conducted a wide-scale security campaign in North Sinai, security sources said Saturday [14 March]. A total of 45 militants were killed in the second week of March  in gunfire exchange, air raids and targeting of headquarters in North Sinai.

The Egyptian army conducted a wide-scale security campaign in North Sinai, security sources said Saturday [14 March]. A total of 45 militants were killed in the second week of March  in gunfire exchange, air raids and targeting of headquarters in North Sinai.
A small bomb killed a street cleaner in the Egyptian capital Cairo.
A blast was also reported at the Kom al-Dekka district in central Alexandria, leaving no injuries yet destroying a number of vehicles, shops and buildings nearby.
A bomb exploded next to a bank in the Sidi Beshr neighbourhood of Alexandria, wounding four people.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces arrested six members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group who planted homemade bombs in a number of districts in Tanta city, Gharbiyah [governorate, north of Cairo]. Bomb disposal experts defused the bombs.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Militants planted a fake bomb at Al-Badrashin train station in Giza governorate. Bomb disposal teams dismantled the fake bomb.

An internal scuffle erupted on the evening of Sunday 15 March in Wadi al-Rayan in Fayoum and escalated into a fight with knives that led to two monks being moved to hospital suffering various injuries.
Students from the German University in Cairo (GUC) took part in a sit-in after a student died after being run over by a university bus.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Egyptian courts in Giza condemned to death Muslim Brotherhood leader Mohamed Badie and 21 other members of the banned movement in two separate cases over incitement to violence.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Sappers managed to defuse six explosive charges that were planted at a crossroad and under a bridge in Bahr Muwas district between Al-Zaqaziq and Mit Ghamr [north of Cairo].

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces arrested 153 members of the Muslim Brotherhood as part of the interior ministry's efforts to arrest those who committed violence in the country.
Security troops stormed a number of hotbeds of militants in the North Sinai cities, sources said Wednesday [18 March].
A police officer died late Tuesday due to wounds sustained in a drive-by shooting in the border governorate of Marsa Matrouh.
Security troops stormed a number of hotbeds of militants in the North Sinai cities, sources said Wednesday [18 March].
Security troops stormed a number of militant hotbeds in the North Sinai cities. An Islamist element was killed and 14 suspects arrested.

column23: 68 militant elements were arrested in a security campaigns carried out nationwide. Members of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in a large-scale campaign in Cairo, Al-Minufiyah, Al-Daqahliyah and Al-Buhayrah.

column23: 68 militant elements were arrested in a security campaigns carried out nationwide. Members of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in a large-scale campaign in Cairo, Al-Minufiyah, Al-Daqahliyah and Al-Buhayrah.

column23: 68 militant elements were arrested in a security campaigns carried out nationwide. Members of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in a large-scale campaign in Cairo, Al-Minufiyah, Al-Daqahliyah and Al-Buhayrah.

Five people were injured when an explosive device, planted by unidentified people, exploded Wednesday [18 March] near the headquarters of the Holding Company for Drinking Water and Waste Water (HCWW) in Fayyum governorate.

A crude bomb went off near a television transmission station in Bani Suwayf [south of Cairo] on Wednesday [18 March]. Bomb squads managed to defuse four other bombs in the site. No casualties were reported in the blast.
A civilian was shot dead and another injured south of al-Arish city. Elsewhere in Arish a number of unidentified gunmen opened fire at a citizen who was rushed to hospital with wounds to the chest.
A security campaign targeting militant hotbeds in North Sinai on Thursday left a total of 28 suspected militants killed.
A security campaign targeting militant hotbeds in North Sinai on Thursday left a total of 28 suspected militants killed.
A security campaign targeting militant hotbeds in North Sinai on Thursday left a total of 28 suspected militants killed.

Two people were killed in an attack on a youth centre in the neighbourhood of Kerdasa in Giza early Thursday.  Unidentified assailants attacked it with Molotov cocktails. The centre was burnt to the ground.
Six suspected members of Sinai-based militant group State of Sinai were killed in a ground operation, south of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai on Friday.
Two suspected members of Sinai-based militant group State of Sinai were killed in an aerial raid south of al-Arish city in North Sinai on Friday.
Security forces killed 10 suspected militants in an aerial raid on a deserted house in North Sinai's Sheikh Zuweid region.

A sit-in was started by students of Fayoum University, protesting the security crackdown and the arrest of their colleagues. The sit-in started on 21 March, and ended with "success" as the detained students from the Faculties of Engineering and Science were released.
Security forces killed seven Islamist militants and arrested eight suspects during a security operation in Arish city.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: 11 militant cells, belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood group, were seized over charges of exploding a number of electricity stations and towers in the governorates of Al-Gharbiyah [north of Cairo], Al-Minya and Al-Fayyum [south of Cairo].
