Gunmen in a car shot dead a policeman in the city of El-Arish in the north of the Sinai peninsula.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Five suspects were arrested in a security campaign in Sheikh Zuweid and a bomb squad safely detonated a bomb planted to target the troops.

column22: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International
column23: A roadside bomb killed two Egyptian soldiers and wounded six in an armoured vehicle. The explosion took place as army forces patrolled an area near the village of el-Kharouba near Sheikh Zuweid.

Two conscripts securing an embassy in Giza were injured in a drive-by shooting on the embassy. Two assailants driving a motorbike shot at the forces securing the embassy in Giza's Mohandeseen neighbourhood.
A 10-year-old girl was killed on Wednesday when an explosive device detonated outside her school in the Al-Hawatim area  of Fayoum city, south of Cairo.
An official at a Suez police station was shot dead early Thursday during a chase with masked men which also left one of the assailants killed.

Scores of hardline Muslims of al-Our village waged demonstrations that marched through the village in protest against the building of a new church. The demonstrators pelted the house of a Coptic family with stones. The police restored calm.
Scores of mostly young Muslims demonstrated in front of a church in Samalout, Minya.
The Church of the Virgin Mary in Samalout near to Minya was attacked by assailants using Molotov Cocktails and stones. In the attack, seven people were injured and one car was left burning.
A security campaign carried out in North Sinai on Saturday left a total of three suspected militants dead across Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
A security campaign carried out in North Sinai on Saturday left a total of three suspected militants dead across Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
A security campaign carried out in North Sinai on Saturday left a total of three suspected militants dead across Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
A bomb wounded four civilians and four policemen outside Cairo University on Saturday, in an attack claimed by Ajnad Misr.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: A civil guard squad deactivated a bomb and said it was a primitive one connected to an electric circuit.
Security agents stormed the home of a journalist in Cairo, confiscated his cell phone and laptop, blindfolded him and escorted him to an unknown location in an enforced disappearance.
Two Muslim Brotherhood members were arrested and charged with staging an 'illegal' protest on 29 March. The location was not specified.
Six suspected militants were killed in clashes with security forces south of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai.
Two policemen were injured on Monday while dismantling two explosive devices in the Egyptian coastal city of Alexandria.

On Tuesday 31 March Muslims in the village of Nassriya in Beni-Mazar, Minya held demonstrations against Christians and Christianity and pelted the Copts' homes with stones, knocking threateningly on their doors and windows. The elders of the village Muslims intervened and calmed the situation, and security forces descended on the village to work at controlling the situation.
A policeman in the Homeland Security branch was shot dead by unknown assailants in Menoufia to the north of the Egyptian capital.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Alexandria security forces dismantled on Wednesday [1 April] a home-made bomb found near the Al-anfushi Children Hospital, western the governorate.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Three people were killed in a blast in the governorate of Sharqiya while manufacturing an explosive device inside their home.

column22: Aswat Masriya (Cairo); Algeria Press Service; Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Seventeen security personnel and two civilians were killed in attacks by State of Sinai on five security checkpoints in Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai. The main target was Kharouba checkpoint. Security personnel were quick to respond to the attacks, killing 15 militants.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: In Sharqiya province, the security forces managed to defuse two explosive devices targeting a power transmission tower.
A mortar shell fell on a house east of El-Arish, wounding three civilians.
A blast went off at a mall on a highway in Qalioubiya province without casualties.

column22: Aswat Masriya; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Thirty-five suspected State of Sinai militants were killed in military aerial raids on North Sinai late Thursday, hours after security personnel were killed in clashes with militants. Hideouts at Al-Hadaida and Al-Fitat towns southern Sheikh Zuweid were targeted.

State of Sinai released a video showing a soldier being shot in the head by a masked militant after another unidentified captive is beheaded. They were captured after an ambush on an army outpost in North Sinai on April 2.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: On 2 April, two bombs were dismantled in Beheira governorate.
Demonstrations by Muslim groups continued in the village of Nassriya in Beni-Mazar, Minya against Coptic Christians.
A policeman was shot dead on Friday by unknown assailants on the Fayoum-Cairo road. Three masked men opened fire at two policemen, killing one while the other survived.
Security forces launched an extensive campaign in North Sinai on Friday, killing a total of 15 suspected militants.
Security forces launched an extensive campaign in North Sinai on Friday, killing a total of 15 suspected militants.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Police arrested 44 members of the Muslim Brotherhood and its affiliated groups across the nation. The arrest is part of the interior ministry's pre-emptive campaign that is targeting middle-ranked leaders of the Brotherhood.

Security forces, led by Minya's chief of police for the north region, raided a building affiliated to the Maghagha archbishopric in Minya. During the raid, security forces seized belongings and assaulted youth inside the church house.

Demonstrations by Muslim groups continued in the village of Nassriya in Beni-Mazar, Minya and grew more violent following the Muslim Friday noon prayers. A Coptic-owned photo studio, pharmacy and several homes were damaged.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Police raided a radio station and detained a rights advocate for broadcasting without a license in Cairo.
A homemade bomb went off outside Ahmad Urabi Primary School in Giza [south of Cairo] Saturday [4 April]. No casualties reported.

The Armed Forces on Saturday [4 April] killed 35 militants and injured several others during raids against groups who were involved in Thursday's attacks on security points in Al-Arish and Al-Shaykh Zuyawid, North Sinai.

Some 11 men, a majority of whom were Coptic Christians, were injured during an assault by a group of fanatic Muslim villagers against Coptic Christians on Saturday 4 April in the village of al-Galaa' in Samalout, Minya.
A policeman and four civilians were injured in an attack Sunday evening that targeted a security station in the vicinity of a church in Agami area in Alexandria. No one claimed responsibility.
A total of 13 Islamist militants were killed in a wide-scale security campaign launched in south Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities in North Sinai governorate.
The founder of the militant group Ajnad Misr was killed in an exchange of fire with security forces in an apartment in Giza's Haram district.
A total of 13 Islamist militants were killed in a wide-scale security campaign launched in south Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities in North Sinai governorate.
A total of 13 Islamist militants were killed in a wide-scale security campaign launched in south Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities in North Sinai governorate.

An explosive device went off at a bridge running over the uptown island of Zamalek in Cairo on Sunday, leaving one policeman dead and three people injured. Ajnad Misr (Soldiers of Egypt) claimed responsibility.

The Egypt Natural Gas Holding Company (EGAS) workers held a protest on 5 April at the company headquarters to demonstrate for their demands. The protest turned into a sit-in in the company's branches across the country.
Police forces stormed the girls branch of Al Azhar university on 5 April, to break up a demonstration of the movement 'Students against the Coup'.
A total of seven Islamist militants were killed in a security campaign in North Sinai's Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
A total of seven Islamist militants were killed in a security campaign in North Sinai's Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
Unidentified gunmen fired RPG shells at Al-Shaykh Zuwayid police station in North Sinai whilst riding a car and then fled the scene. No injuries reported.
Three people were wounded in a bomb blast near a camp of the central security forces in Al-Aqqad area south of Aswan on Monday [6 April].
Five militants were killed on Wednesday during clashes with security forces in North Sinai as part of the security raids on militants' hideouts in the peninsula.

column22: Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service
column23: At least two policemen were killed and three recruits injured on Wednesday night as their armored vehicle was hit by a blast in Arish city in Egypt's North Sinai province. State of Sinai militant group were blamed.
A mortar landed Wednesday on a residential area south of Sheik Zuweid, a town in northern Sinai, hitting a house and killing nine of its residents.
A missile landed on a house in a village near Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai, killing two civilians.
Security forces dispersed a protest in the Cairo neighbourhood of Mattariya and arrested a photojournalist.
Security forces dispersed a protest in Cairo's Al-Waraq neighbourhood on Friday.
State of Sinai claimed responsibility for the killings of two people on Saturday, including a conscript and another individual, in footage that was released Friday.

On 10 April, a 63-year old lawyer was assaulted and arrested in the Mataria neighborhood where a demonstration was taking place against the government. He was detained in Mataria police station where he was allegedly subjected to torture, including a severe beating to his head. He later died in hospital on 22 April.

An explosive charge went off near Itay al-Barud police station in the Delta province of Al-Buhayrah [north of Cairo] Saturday [11 April]. No casualties reported. Police also cordoned off the area as sappers combed the vicinity of the police station in search for more bombs.
A resident of Manial, said an officer from the Old Cairo Police Station arrested his father and took him to the station where he died of low blood circulation. His body showed signs of torture.

column22: Agence France Presse; Aswat Masriya; Al-Masry Al-Youm
column23: A suicide car bomb targeting a police station in North Sinai's provincial capital of El-Arish killed eight people and wounded 45 others.  The attack was claimed by State of Sinai militants. The head of the investigation unit later died of injuries sustained.
An army captain and two soldiers were wounded in an attack on a checkpoint near the town of Rafah that borders the Palestinian Gaza Strip. State of Sinai said one of its snipers shot at them.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: 22 members of Brotherhood group were arrested as part of a security campaign targeting middle-ranking leaders of the group implicated in hostilities and acts of violence across Egypt.

column22: Xinhua General News Service; Daily News Egypt
column23: A booby-trapped car exploded near a Coptic Church in Zagazig city, north of the capital Cairo. No injuries or damages were reported. Another bomb at the same location was dismantled by bomb squads before it detonated.
A roadside bomb attack on an army vehicle killed six soldiers and wounded two near the North Sinai town of Sheikh Zuweid. The attack was claimed by State of Sinai militants.
Police forces dispersed Sunday night a minor protest by the anti-government group Ultras Nahdawy in the vicinity of Tahrir Square, Cairo. No arrests or injuries were reported.
A spokesman for the victims of the 25 January Revolution,  was found dead in Giza with torture traces on his body.

column22: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International
column23: Gunmen shot dead a soldier at a checkpoint near the village of Abu Shinnar in the Rafah area. Another soldier was wounded at another checkpoint. There was no immediate claim of responsibility.
A bomb exploded in front of the Helwan district building Monday morning, reportedly leaving two security guards injured.

Six improvised bombs went off at electricity pylons in 6 October city, west of Giza province, near the media city located on the outside of the capital. Security forces defused two other devices. Revolutionary Punishment (Al-'iqab Al-Thawri), an anti-government Islamist militant group, claimed responsibility for the attack.
A top-ranking policeman at Al-Arish Police Station in North Sinai was injured after he was shot by a sniper on Tuesday.

column22: Associated Press International; Aswat Masriya; Al-Ahram Weekly
column23: Gunmen on a motorcycle shot dead a policeman manning a checkpoint in Shibeen al-Qanatar, Qalyubia. Two policemen were wounded in the shooting.
A bomb exploded in 6 October city, west of Giza province, near the media city as Prime Minister Ibrahim Mehleb visited the site of blasts targeting the area the day before.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Twenty-one leaders and elements of Jund Ansar Allah were arrested in manhunt campaigns in Alexandria and Al-Sharqiyah [north of Cairo], the Interior Ministry said Wednesday [15 April].

column22: Agence France Presse; Daily News Egypt
column23: Two Egyptian military cadets were killed in a bombing in the Nile Valley city of Kafr al-Sheikh that also wounded 10 other people. One more military cadet died of injuries sustained from a bombing later in the week.
1,700 workers at the Construction Company and the Beheira Joint Company for Land Reclamation entered an open sit-in in April over unpaid salaries.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Twenty-one leaders and elements of Jund Ansar Allah were arrested in manhunt campaigns in Alexandria and Al-Sharqiyah [north of Cairo], the Interior Ministry said Wednesday [15 April].
An armored military vehicle struck a roadside bomb during a raid on militant hideouts in Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai Peninsula and the explosion killed one officer and wounded another.

column22: Aswat Masriya; Egypt State Information Service
column23: Security forces using a helicopter killed three suspected militants they accused of complicity in an explosion in Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai earlier on Thursday.
North Sinai police launched Friday [17 April] a security campaign in southern Arish and Shaykh Zuwiyd. A total of 10 Islamist militants were killed.
North Sinai police launched Friday [17 April] a security campaign in southern Arish and Shaykh Zuwiyd. A total of 10 Islamist militants were killed.

Egyptian demonstrators took to the streets and formed human chains in the capital, Cairo, as well as other cities, including Alexandria, Giza, the Nile Delta provinces of Sharqiya, Dakahlia, Beheira and Kafr el-Sheikh as well as the Upper Egypt provinces of Fayoum, Bani-Suef and Minya, calling for the reinstatement of former president, Mohammed Morsi.

Four people were detained in the neighborhood of Matariya in Cairo after police tried to break up a protest rally organised by the Muslim Brotherhood.

In the city of Alexandria, security guards stormed a mosque in the Raml neighborhood, arresting at least a dozen people who were to join an anti-government protest rally organised by the Anti-Coup Alliance which is led by the Muslim Brotherhood movement.

Security forces dispersed a peaceful protest held by the Muslim Brotherhood in the Nasser neighborhood of Bani-Suef, south of Cairo, taking several participants into custody.

Egyptian riot police attacked Muslim Brotherhood demonstrators in Alexandria’s el-Safira neighborhood, firing bird shots and tear gas. A number of people were wounded and some others arrested in the incident.

At least 13 militants were killed by the Egyptian armed forces on Saturday during their raids on militants' cells south of Sheikh Zuweid and Arish cities in North Sinai province. The militants are believed to belong to the State of Sinai group.

At least 13 militants were killed by the Egyptian armed forces on Saturday during their raids on militants' cells south of Sheikh Zuweid and Arish cities in North Sinai province. The militants are believed to belong to the State of Sinai group.

Two persons were killed and one injured on Sunday in Daqahliya province, in a shootout on the international road near Gamasa city. Three attackers opened fire at a security point near to Delta University, when the police shot back. The attackers tried to escape, but the police manage to shoot two of them, injuring the third. No policemen were injured.
13 Islamist militants were killed and nine suspects arrested in a crackdown in Al-Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah cities, North Sinai. Three bombs were remotely exploded.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Two bombs were defused near Ramses Square on 19th April.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Two bombs were reportedly defused near the Al-Shorouk suburb of Cairo on 19th April.
Two army conscripts and four civilians were injured on Sunday in a bomb blast in the Matariya district of Cairo.

Clashes broke out between Cairo University students and administrative security guards (Falcon security guards) leaving many injured and one student dead.  Central Security Forces occupied the campus following the clashes. Un-uniformed men with weapons, including electric batons and knives were fighting alongside the campus security, severely beating students.

Security forces stormed the campus of Al-Azhar University in Cairo (COB) on 19 April, to break up a demonstration of the movement "Students against the coup", who were demonstrating against students being detained.
The militant group State of Sinai claimed the killing of an army officer at a security checkpoint Monday following a bomb attack earlier in the day.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: An Egyptian court confirmed death sentences against 22 supporters of ousted Islamist president Mohamed Morsi on Monday over an attack on a police station in which one officer was killed.
Mortar rounds struck a residential area south of the town of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai late on Monday, killing two five-year old boys.

A roadside bomb struck an armoured military vehicle on the Egyptian side of the city of Rafah on the Gaza border, killing an army officer and two soldiers. State of Sinai, an affiliate of the Islamic State group, said they carried out the bomb attack.
Egyptian police used tear gas to disperse a demonstration, allegedly organized by members of the Muslim Brotherhood, in Juhaina Square in the 6th of October City on Monday.
The Cairo-Alexandria Agricultural Road was blocked by angry Menoufiya residents over the kidnapping of two students.
Five police officers from the Salam Police Station reportedly beat and electrified a 16-year old girl who claimed to have been kidnapped by a thug, claiming she had fabricated the story.
Security forces clashed with suspected militants during a raid in Sheikh Zuweid, killing four and arresting nine suspects.
Security raids in Rafah city left four militants killed during a combing operation.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: An Egyptian court sentenced ousted Islamist president Mohamed Morsi to 20 years in prison Tuesday for abuses against protesters but acquitted him of charges carrying a possible death penalty.
The Electricity and Energy Ministry on Tuesday [21 April] said a new sabotage act targeted an electricity pole in Al-Buhayrah Governorate [north of Cairo].

column22: Reuters; Daily News Egypt; Aswat Masriya
column23: The Homeland Security Colonel and a police conscript were killed after being shot by unidentified gunmen in Helmeyet al-Zaytoun, Cairo. They were on their way to work. After an attack on two policemen, assailants threw a homemade bomb as a distraction and ran away. The minor explosion injured one women and a child.
At Aim Shams University, students from the the "Students against the Coup" group set fire to tyres and cut off the road leading to Ramses.
A detained 63-year-old lawyer died in Matariya hospital amid conflicting reports between police torture and residents' assaults for "suspicion of Muslim Brotherhood ties". Coded as police torture.
Clashes on Wednesday night between security forces and purported members of the Sinai State left six of the suspected militants dead. The clashes occurred south of Sheikh Zuweid.
Security bodies in North Sinai launched an intensive security campaign in North Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah. A total of six Islamist militants were killed and nine arrested.
Security bodies in North Sinai launched an intensive security campaign in North Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah. A total of six Islamist militants were killed and nine arrested.
Security bodies in North Sinai launched an intensive security campaign in North Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah. A total of six Islamist militants were killed and nine arrested.

A rocket-propelled grenade landed on a residential home in Sheikh Zuweid, killing one person and injuring at least four more on Thursday. It is unclear whether the shelling was attributed to the armed forces or North Sinai's militants.

On 23 April, a man died in the Shubra Al-Khaimah police station. A police officer and two of his aides were detained, pending investigations into torture allegations that led to the death of a suspect in their custody.

A veterinarian and his son, who were affiliated with the Muslim Brotherhood, both disappeared after their unlawful arrest by the Egyptian Security Forces on 23 April 2015 in Qotour, 100km north of Cairo. The security forces took some money, phones and computers before forcibly dragging the two men outside without clothing.

Four Islamists were killed in an accidental explosion while preparing bombs in the province of Beni Suef. Another later died in June. Police said the suspected militants were members of the blacklisted Muslim Brotherhood movement. Conflicting report: The pro-Morsi Coup Alliance and families of the dead claimed the police tried to arrest the men but failed and therefore threw explosives at them.
In the Beheira governorate, three explosions targeting gas pipelines occurred on Friday.

column22: MENA news agency; Daily News Egypt
column23: Two bombs exploded above Hilmeyt al-Zaytun bridge. One person, allegedly a Muslim Brotherhood member, later died from their injuries. Sappers managed to defuse another bomb in the area.
A bomb exploded near a person driving a motorcycle in Al-Matriya district of Cairo, leaving him with severe injuries.

A group of journalists took part in a demonstration in front of the Press Syndicate building in downtown Cairo Saturday afternoon. The demonstration took place in solidarity with the five journalists who were referred to investigations Monday.
Suspected militants were shot and killed by army forces in Rafah while allegedly attempting to assault security forces in the area.

Farmers from the village of Srso in Daqhaleya, protested on farm land, where they clashed with relatives of businessman Farid El-Masry, who also claims ownership to the land. The Egyptian Center for Economic and Social Rights (ECESR) said that the family of El-Masry hired thugs to attack the farmers using firearms and threats. During and after the clashes, police forces launched an arrest campaign, leading to the detention of 24 farmers, along with two members of the Socialist Popular Alliance party (SPAP).
A member of the Al-Tarabeen tribe was killed by gunshots from State of Sinai militants. The tribe reportedly aims to retaliate his death, in cooperation with the Egyptian army and other tribes.
Yemeni protesters gathered Sunday in front of the Yemeni embassy in Dokki district of Cairo chanting against the ambassador, amid a heavy presence of riot police.
Two police officers and three conscripts were injured during an exchange of fire with wanted assailants

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Unidentified assailants placed bombs to target electricity pylons in Upper Egypt.
Two bombs exploded and another was dismantled Monday morning in Beheira governorate resulting in six injuries. The bombs targeted electricity pylons.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: On Tuesday 28 April, unknown assailants hurled two Molotov bombs at the home of Coptic Christian in the village of Al-Our. One bomb caused damages to the door and windows; the other fell inside the house but did not detonate and therefore caused no casualties or damages.

After the Al-Tarabeen tribe handed over four militants allegedly affiliated with the "State of Sinai" militant group to the Egyptian armed forces in North Sinai,  the State of Sinai bombed a house belonging to an Al-Tarabeen tribe leader Ibrahim Al-Argani for being an "army informant". The tribal leader was involved in signing the statement announcing the retaliatory attacks against "State of Sinai".
Journalists staged a march outside the Syndicate of Journalists, accusing former interior minister Muhammad Ibrahim of killing a female reporter.
A five-year old child was killed on Thursday when an explosion occurred outside his home in a city in Sharqiya, north of Cairo.
Security bodies in northern Arish, Shaykh Zuwayd and Rafah launched wide scale security campaigns in which a total of six Islamist militants were killed and 13 suspects arrested.
Security bodies in northern Arish, Shaykh Zuwayd and Rafah launched wide scale security campaigns in which a total of six Islamist militants were killed and 13 suspects arrested.
Security bodies in northern Arish, Shaykh Zuwayd and Rafah launched wide scale security campaigns in which a total of six Islamist militants were killed and 13 suspects arrested.

The 'Revolutionary Alternative' group organised a protest that was moved from Talaat Harb Square to outside the Press Syndicate in Cairo demonstrating against what they described as "the military capitalist regime". Five youth members of the group were arrested in Talaat Harb square.
Al-Masry football club fans marched in Port Said Friday, protesting 11 death sentences handed to fans of the club in the "Port Said Massacre" trial.
Assailants attacked an Al-Ahram Foundation bus and injured at least six people on the road to 6th of October City.
A man was arrested in a security raid on 1 May in the Beheira governorate and died in custody. Police officers are accused of torturing the victim.

Following the death of a civilian in custody, a dozen local residents gathered in front of the police station in the Beheira governorate, accusing the police of torturing him to death. They were dispersed by force, and there were at least eight injuries reported.
Clashes broke out between student protesters and security forces Saturday night in 6th of October City.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Seventy middle-ranking leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in the past 24 hours across Egypt, including in the governorates of Qalubiyah, Minufiyah, Kafr al-Shaykh and Suez.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Seventy middle-ranking leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in the past 24 hours across Egypt, including in the governorates of Qalubiyah, Minufiyah, Kafr al-Shaykh and Suez.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Seventy middle-ranking leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in the past 24 hours across Egypt, including in the governorates of Qalubiyah, Minufiyah, Kafr al-Shaykh and Suez.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Seventy middle-ranking leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood group were arrested in the past 24 hours across Egypt, including in the governorates of Qalubiyah, Minufiyah, Kafr al-Shaykh and Suez.
Unidentified men destroyed an electricity tower using explosives between Fayyum [south west of Cairo] and Bani Suwayf [south of Cairo] governorates on Sunday [3 May].

column22: Associated Press International; MENA news agency; Daily News Egypt
column23: The Sinai-based militant group "State of Sinai" remotely detonated a bomb Sunday in the Sinai Peninsula in the city of el-Arish, killing an army conscript and wounding two soldiers and a policeman.
Scores of Yemeni nationals gathered outside the ministry's headquarters in Dokki district on 3rd May, demanding the Egyptian authorities help facilitate their return to Yemen.
The Revolutionary Punishment group claimed responsibility for detonating an explosive device outside the royal palace of Princess Fawzia in Fayoum, used by the governor and visiting officials.

North Sinai security forces killed as many as twelve Islamist militants in South Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah. As many as nine shacks were destroyed, a jeep vehicle and seven unlicensed motorbikes were seized during the campaigns.

North Sinai security forces killed as many as twelve Islamist militants in South Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah. As many as nine shacks were destroyed, a jeep vehicle and seven unlicensed motorbikes were seized during the campaigns.

North Sinai security forces killed as many as twelve Islamist militants in South Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah. As many as nine shacks were destroyed, a jeep vehicle and seven unlicensed motorbikes were seized during the campaigns.

column22: Associated Press International; Daily News Egypt
column23: Suspected Islamic militants attacked a security forces' base in northern Sinai. Explosions rocked the Central Security base in the border town of Rafah around noon on Monday after attackers fired mortars targeting the camp. According to Daily News Egypt, State of Sinai claimed that 14 security personnel were injured.
20 militants launched an attack on the Egyptian army by firing mortar shells in a security zone in Sheikh Zuweid. The exchange of fire left three militants injured.
An improvised explosive device (IED) went off in an apartment rented by three Al-Azhar students in the Nasr City neighbourhood, injuring two. Police detained the third pending investigations.

A dozen local residents gathered in front of the police building in the Beheira governorate where policemen were accused of torturing a victim to death. They were dispersed by force, and there were at least eight injuries reported.

column22: Agence France Presse; Daily News Egypt
column23: Clashes erupted on 5th May when police arrested a group of Morsi supporters, including 13 women, who were demonstrating in a nightime rally in Al-Basratah village in Damietta. One policeman was killed and a total of 22 people were wounded in the clashes.
A man was arrested by a security force from his workplace in Rashid (Rosetta) and severely beaten as he was taken to the Rashid police station. He later died on the 5 May.
The Egyptian military Wednesday shot dead three Palestinian gunmen who infiltrated through a smuggling tunnel in the Sinai town of Rafah on the border with Gaza.

column22: Aswat Masriya; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Aerial bombardment of two locations near North Sinai's Rafah city on Wednesday left 21 State of Sinai militants dead. An attack helicopter hit the southern Matalla town, killing six militants and exploding a warehouse for ammunition and explosives.

column22: Aswat Masriya; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Aerial bombardment of two locations near North Sinai's Rafah city on Wednesday left 21 State of Sinai militants dead. An Apache attacked a farm at Sahel al-Bahr area in Rafah, killing 15 militants.
An Egyptian lawyer was assaulted by a police officer at Nasr City police station and injured in the leg.
Gunmen attacked an Egyptian police camp in Rafah in the Sinai Peninsula, killing two officers. Egypt's border security forces chased and killed three suspected militants.
Suspected State of Sinai militants opened fire on a group of policemen in the city of El-Arish late on Friday, killing two and wounding a third.
Five suspected State of Sinai militants were killed and three others were injured in an army operation east of Arish.

A second operation by Egypt's military killed 11 more suspected State of Sinai militants and saw three others arrested. The militants fired three mortar shells on a security focal point in Karm al-Qawadis area South of Sheikh Zuweid, but the mortars missed their target. One conscript suffered shrapnel wounds in the attack.
A gunfire exchange left a security watchman for the police and three Muslim Brotherhood members dead on Saturday in Egypt's northern governorate of Damietta.
Unidentified gunmen gunned down a policeman outside a school in Al-Arish town in North Sinai.
A retired police officer is killed in El-Arish marketplace by unidentified gunmen.
On 9 May, a Muslim Brotherhood sympathiser disappeared from Cairo. Although suspected of being held at a police station in Southern Cairo, officers denied holding him.
Three suspected militants believed to belong to the State of Sinai militant group were killed in a security campaign in North Sinai.

column22: Agence France Presse; Daily News Egypt
column23: Suspected militants set off three small bombs outside the home of an Egyptian judge in Helwan who sentenced Islamists to death, wounding four people and damaging the building. Building security caught one of the militants who planted the bombs.
A woman was injured when unidentified assailants fired at her in central Sinai.

A police officer stopped a driver at a checkpoint in the north-eastern Cairo district of Hadayek Al-Qubba, and started to inspect him. This led to a quarrel, in which the officer hit the driver, causing severe injury. The police officer was arrested.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Two bombs were found near a power tower in the Delta city of Kafr al-Dawwar [northern Egypt] Tuesday [12 May]. Three more bombs were found near another power tower in the same city and were defused.
Four suspected militants were killed and 23 people were arrested in a campaign in the North Sinai cities of al-Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah.
Four suspected militants were killed and 23 people were arrested in a campaign in the North Sinai cities of al-Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah.
Four suspected militants were killed and 23 people were arrested in a campaign in the North Sinai cities of al-Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah.
A bomb exploded in a house belonging to four police officers in North Sinai on Wednesday morning who were evacuated prior the explosion.
Two officers and two soldiers were killed in a bomb blast during a search operation in Rafah.

column22: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International; Aswat Masriya
column23: A roadside bomb, believed to be planted by State of Sinai, killed four Bedouin tribesmen (civilians) south of Rafah in North Sinai. The source added that the device was planted with the purpose of targeting military vehicles, but it exploded when the private car hit it.
A journalist imprisoned in Tora Prison on charges relating to his conversion to Christianity over seven years ago was severely physically beaten and subject to verbal abuse.
Eight State of Sinai militants were killed in confrontations with security forces in North Sinai's city of al-Arish on Thursday. Two more were injured.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: The Ministry of Interior announced that it had arrested 94 "middle ranking" Muslim Brotherhood leaders across Cairo, Daqahleya, Beheira and Fayoum.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: The Ministry of Interior announced that it had arrested 94 "middle ranking" Muslim Brotherhood leaders across Cairo, Daqahleya, Beheira and Fayoum.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: The Ministry of Interior announced that it had arrested 94 "middle ranking" Muslim Brotherhood leaders across Cairo, Daqahleya, Beheira and Fayoum.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: The Ministry of Interior announced that it had arrested 94 "middle ranking" Muslim Brotherhood leaders across Cairo, Daqahleya, Beheira and Fayoum.
Four bombs went off targeting two power pylons in the city of Al-Dilingat in Al-Buhayrah province on Tuesday [14 May]. Sappers managed to defuse two other bombs in the area.
Eight explosive devices, planted by unidentified people, exploded beneath two electricity towers in Qina governorate [south of Cairo].
A civilian was shot dead south of al-Arish by armed assailants.
Three people were gunned down by armed assailants in North Sinai, leaving two killed and a third person injured.
16 cases of forced disappearence were reported in the governorate of Giza since April. The recent cases of forced disappearance have reportedly been linked to rising mobilisation in the streets.
60 cases of forced disappearence were reported in the governorate of Cairo since April. The recent cases of forced disappearance have reportedly been linked to rising mobilisation in the streets.

31 cases of forced disappearence were reported in the governorate of Kafr El-Sheikh since April. The recent cases of forced disappearance have reportedly been linked to rising mobilisation in the streets.
Six masked gunmen on three motorbikes shot and killed a policeman exiting a security facility in Giza's town of Kerdasa.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column22: Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
column23: The Cairo Criminal court on Saturday sentenced deposed Islamist president Mohamed Morsi and more than 100 other people to death for their role in a mass jailbreak during the 2011 uprising.
A bomb targeted the main courthouse in the southern city of Assiut late Saturday, seriously injuring a policeman.

Gunmen killed two Egyptian judges and a prosecutor Saturday in Al-Arish in North Sinai. The shooting also killed the officials' driver and wounded another prosecutor. Police sources said the attack was carried out by militants belonging to the State of Sinai.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: An Egyptian court banned militant football fan groups or ultras as "terrorist" organisations in a bid to break the backbone of anti-government protests.

Fayoum city witnessed protests Saturday night, following the death sentences handed down to former president Mohamed Morsi and scores of Muslim Brotherhood members and leaders. Clashes were reported between riot police and anti-government protesters, where the demonstrators blocked the Cairo-Fayoum road using tires.

In Matariya, protesters staged a flash protest in Matariya Square, where they chanted against the police and the army, clashing with some residents after Mohamed Morsi was sentenced to death. Some female protesters were arrested but later released.
In Menufiya, alleged members of the Muslim Brotherhood group set fire to the Sadat Court Saturday night. The protesters threw Molotov cocktails at the court house.
A security patrol exchanged fire with unknown assailants Sunday in Fayoum, with no reported casualties on either side.
Early Sunday, a bomb wounded a young girl near a courthouse in the Mediterranean city of Port Said.

The neighbourhoods of Matariya and Ain Shams in Cairo witnessed angry demonstrations by anti government protesters in response to the execution of six people by the Egyptian state who were accused of involvement in the "Arab Sharkas" clashes.

The neighbourhoods of Matariya and Ain Shams in Cairo witnessed angry demonstrations by anti government protesters in response to the execution of six people by the Egyptian state who were accused of involvement in the "Arab Sharkas" clashes.

A small group of demonstrators gathered outside the Press Syndicate in Downtown Cairo Sunday afternoon to mark the launch of their campaign against what they call mass unfair dismissals from Egypt's media outlets
A police sergeant was injured after unidentified persons opened fire on him in Al-Fayyum [south-west of Cairo].

column22: Agence France Presse; MENA news agency
column23: Gunmen on a motorbike shot dead a policeman near a court in Belbeis, a town around 60 kilometres (about 38 miles) northeast of Cairo. Another policeman was injured.

Police killed two men suspected of involvement in a failed bomb attack that targeted a judge in Cairo last week. They were shot dead in a firefight in a Cairo suburb when police went to arrest them, the ministry said without specifying when they were killed.
One conscript was wounded in an attack targeting a security checkpoint on Al-Islami'iliyah-Suez desert road. Security forces launched a manhunt for the attackers.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Bomb disposal squads dismantled four highly-explosive bombs that were installed at an electricity pylon in Al-Buhayrah on Monday. The four bombs were planted at the base of the transmission tower.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: On Monday, 35 students were arrested by security forces from their place of residence in Nasr City, with no clear charges mentioned.

Unidentified persons detonated two high-voltage power towers in Damanhur, north of Cairo. Eight explosive charges were planted under the towers, destroying their bases and causing the towers to collapse in the villages of Balba and Zarqun on Al-Mahmudiyah-Damanhur road.

Unidentified persons bombed an electricity tower at the entrance to Faris village on Aswan-Cairo desert road [in southern Egypt]. Three makeshift bombs went off causing a blackout in a number of areas in Kalabshah city in Aswan. The blast caused damage to the tower. Sappers were able to detect a fourth bomb and are acting to defuse it.

Unidentified persons detonated two high-voltage power towers in Damanhur, north of Cairo. Eight explosive charges were planted under the towers, destroying their bases and causing the towers to collapse in the villages of Balba and Zarqun on Al-Mahmudiyah-Damanhur road.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces arrested 88 medium-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in the past 24 hours. 43 members of quality operations committees affiliated to the group were also arrested in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah, Beheira and Assiut. 22 militants were also arrested nationwide.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces arrested 88 medium-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in the past 24 hours. 43 members of quality operations committees affiliated to the group were also arrested in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah, Beheira and Assiut. 22 militants were also arrested nationwide.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces arrested 88 medium-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in the past 24 hours. 43 members of quality operations committees affiliated to the group were also arrested in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah, Beheira and Assiut. 22 militants were also arrested nationwide.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces arrested 88 medium-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in the past 24 hours. 43 members of quality operations committees affiliated to the group were also arrested in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah, Beheira and Assiut. 22 militants were also arrested nationwide.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces arrested 88 medium-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) group in the past 24 hours. 43 members of quality operations committees affiliated to the group were also arrested in Cairo, Alexandria, Sharqiyah, Beheira and Assiut. 22 militants were also arrested nationwide.
A lawyer's arm was broken after being attacked by a police officer in Sohag.
Clashes broke out between State of Sinai militants and security forces in North Sinai's al-Arish City late Wednesday, leaving eight suspected militants killed and three more injured.
Security forces killed one of two suspects in a shooting incident which left two policemen killed last month. The raid took place on 20 May on the outskirts of Cairo.

A student was found dead on a desert road near the Fifth Settlement district Wednesday morning after security forces purportedly took him from the Ain Shams University campus the day before. Contradictory report: the Ministry of Interior however stated that the student was killed after clashes and a chase by security forces. The ministry also accused the student of killing a police officer.

A police conscript was killed and another was injured on Thursday during fire exchange with militants in the Nile Delta governorate of Sharqiya. One of the militants was also killed. Armed men opened fire at security forces during the campaign in the town of Abu Hammad, leaving the conscript dead another sergeant wounded.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: A Brotherhood affiliate was arrested early Thursday [21 May] when three explosive devices mistakenly went off while manufacturing them in Matariyah district.
The Students Against the Coup movement reported a series of protests inside various university campuses on Thursday following the death of a student.

column22: Xinhua General News Service; Aswat Masriya
column23: Seven militants were killed in clashes between armed forces and a "militant cell" in Rafah on Friday.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces dismantled 19 explosive devices found in Sheikh Zuweid, two of them were planted near a natural gas station.
A bomb exploded near a court in Assiut. No injuries were reported in the attack in Upper Egypt.

On Friday, security forces shelled an area south of Rafah in North Sinai, killing 10 suspected militants and injuring 5 others, military sources said. The militants are believed to belong to State of Sinai.
Two soldiers were injured after a bomb targeted their armoured vehicle during a security campaign in North Sinai's Al-Shaykh Zuwayid city.
Two Egyptian women were killed when a shell bombarded their house in Sheikh Zuweid village of Qaber Omair. There are no details of the source of the shell.
Members of the Muslim Brotherhood torched tires and blocked the international road in Arish, in protest for the death sentence against Morsi.

Muslim Brotherhood reported on its official website that 15 protests were flocked into streets in seven provinces including the capital. During the security dispersal of Morsi loyalists on Friday evening, at least 13 Brotherhood members, most of whom were wanted in violence cases, were arrested.
State of Sinai militants abducted an injured Egyptian soldier Friday from an ambulance and then killed him in an ambush south of the town of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai.
The Revolutionary Punishment group claimed responsibility for killing a low-ranking police officer in Beni Suef on Friday for “being involved in arresting and torturing many people in his town.”

The Revolutionary Punishment group claimed responsibility for the killings of two police officers on their way to Biyahmu in Fayoum on 22 May, as part of an operation of "cleansing the country of murderers and criminals… [who] assault unarmed Egyptians in the streets and squares, torture detainees in police stations and cellars of the National Security apparatus, and kidnaps students from the exam rooms to murder them".
A bomb went off near Al-Dilingat Court in the Delta province of Al-Buhayrah [north of Cairo] early Saturday [23 May]. Another explosive charge was also detonated near the city's post office.

A high-voltage electricity tower in East-Saqr Quraysh line [southern Cairo] came under an act of sabotage on Saturday [23 May]. Four bombs were found around the electricity tower and three of the bombs went off.
Six alleged militants were killed and six others were arrested in clashes with security forces early on Sunday in the North Sinai governorate.
12 suspected State of Sinai militants were killed late Sunday in an operation launched by security forces in North Sinai.
An explosive device detonated inside a tunnel in Abu Hamad city, killing the vehicle's two occupants Sunday morning. One of the bodies identified was a lawyer.

A number of radical Muslim youth waged an attack against the homes of Copts in the village of Kafr Darwish, in Fashn, Beni Sweif Sunday evening. They hurled stones and Molotov explosives at Coptic-owned homes; more than 10 houses were torched and damaged. A car owned by a Copt was smashed. A number of Muslim youth helped the Copts defend their homes against the assailants, and the police moved to swiftly contain the matter.

On 24 May, 50 masked security men raided a retired army officer son's apartment, seizing him and also taking his brother and father in a case of "forced disappearance". He was blindfolded and detained. Both men were reportedly subject to physical assault, from beating with sticks and electrocution.
Residents detain, beat and hospitalise a police officer who attmpted to stop a gunfight between two Christian families in which a woman was killed in the cross fire.

Security forces killed 12 suspected militants during raids on North Sinai's cities of al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid late Monday. 8 of these fatalities recorded in events in Sheikh Zuweyid and Rafah on 25th May.
State of Sinai militants killed a conscript and wounded an officer in clashes near the town of Sheikh Zuweyid.

Security forces killed 12 suspected militants during raids on North Sinai's cities of al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid late Monday. 8 of these fatalities recorded in events in Al Arish and Rafah on 25th May.

Security forces killed 12 suspected militants during raids on North Sinai's cities of al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid late Monday. 8 of these fatalities recorded in events in Al Arish and Sheikh Zuweyid on 25th May.
Unidentified shelling in the North Sinai town of Rafah on Monday evening left a nurse dead and her daughter injured.

Attacks against Coptic Christian property continued in Kafr Darwish, in Fashn, Beni Sweif. Coptic houses were set on fire and fields belonging to the senior Tawfiq were damaged and the crops uprooted.
A 44-year-old employee of the US Embassy, has been missing after government security forces visited his house on 25 May. It is believed to part of the forced disappearences by security forces.

Scores of Fayoum Central Security Forces (CSF) troops protested late on Tuesday over mistreatment by the leadership of their security camp. The conscripts in Al-Azab village blocked the Fayoum-Beni Suef road.

A cleric accused of inciting against the government in his writings, was taken from his home on May 26, along with his two brothers. The cleric resurfaced four days later when he was taken to the prosecutor's office, but only after he had been subjected to electrical shocks.
Two improvised explosive devices detonated on a railroad track in the North of Egypt on Wednesday, halting train movement in the governorate of Gharbia.
An Egyptian policeman was killed and eight wounded in three roadside bombings on Wednesday in Al Arish in the Sinai Peninsula.

An explosive device went off at a level crossing in Al-Sharqiyah Governorate [north of Cairo] on Thursday [28 May], cutting off part of the rail tracks and disrupting train traffic on Zaqaziq/Kafr Saqr and Zaqaziq/Al-Salhiyah lines. No casualties reported.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: A political activist was "kidnapped" on May 28 by security forces, only to surface days later at Cairo's Tora prison.
Two Islamist militants were killed while 13 suspects were arrested during a campaign targeting in North Sinai, security sources said Friday [29 May].
Police forces dispersed a pro-Muslim Brotherhood rally in Talbiyah in Giza on Friday and arrested a number of alleged supporters.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Police arrested 16 members of the Muslim Brotherhood, 5 members of the operations room run by the Brotherhood and 12 militants wanted in cases in a security campaign.
Suspected Islamic militants blew up up a natural gas pipeline outside el-Arish, the provincial capital of North Sinai. Unidentified assailants placed an explosive device beneath the pipeline.

At least two students, from Students Against the Coup (SAC) and 6 April Movement were forcibly disappeared after being arrested by security forces on 31 May. The April 6 member was taken in an "arrest campaign" in Alexandria and the SAC member was taken from Cairo.

At least two students, from Students Against the Coup (SAC) and 6 April Movement were forcibly disappeared after being arrested by security forces on 31 May. The April 6 member was taken in an "arrest campaign" in Alexandria and the SAC member was taken from Cairo.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column22: Associated Press International; Aswat Masriya; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Two Muslim Brotherhood leaders were arrested on 1 June in Giza province's 6th of October district. The members were the Brotherhood's top religious cleric and its former spokeman.

A protest at the Press Syndicate held Monday denounced the imprisonment of journalists. Dozens gathered at the stairs of the Press Syndicate in Cairo holding banners calling for the freeing of journalists and activists. The protest witnessed quarrels with civilians, who threw stones at the protesters driving them to step back inside the syndicate headquarters.

Two freelance photojournalist were announced missing Tuesday after disappearing since Monday near the Maadi Nile Corniche, in south Cairo, in more arrests and forced disappearances across Egypt. Approximately 150 people were arrested in the Maadi proximity that night.
At the beginning of June, a group called the "Black Bloc" claimed to block the Qaroun-Fayoum road, resulting in clashes with riot police, who later dispersed the protesters and reopened the road.
A 23-year old freelance photojournalist was reported by her family to have been snatched on June 1 by security forces from a street in downtown Cairo, along with two male friends.
A Sinai-based activist died on 2 June after being detained for several hours by the military in a case of forced disappearance.

column22: Aswat Masriya; MENA news agency; Daily News Egypt
column23: Unidentified gunmen killed a worker at a cement factory and injured three more in an attack in central Sinai on Tuesday. Conflicting reports: Workers claim the military opened fire on the workers after protesting in front of the administrations office; the military claims militants opened fire on them.
Gunmen on a motorbike killed two Egyptian policemen who worked as guards at the Giza pyramids in Cairo.
Clashes erupted between armed men and security forces south of Rafah, leaving 12 suspected militants killed. Those killed are believed to belong to the State of Sinai militant group.
On Wednesday, a soldier was shot dead by a sniper while manning a checkpoint in Sheik Zuweyid.
On Wednesday, a police officer at the Farscur police station in Damietta beat and humiliated a lawyer.
Three students were 'disappeared' after dining at a Cairo restaurant. After two weeks they appeared in different prisons.
Security forces killed eight suspected militants in the city of Rafah in North Sinai on Friday, including a leading member of the State of Sinai militant group.
A bomb explosion on Friday in the city of Mahalla injured one person who is believed to have planted the bomb. The homemade explosive device went off close to Mahalla's first district police station.
A policeman was killed in a blast inside a warehouse while trying to defuse an explosive device in a farm in Gharbiya, north of Cairo on Saturday.
Protesters and family members of a man who died whilst in police custody chanted anti-government slogans at the funeral in Banha.
A detainee died inside a Central Security Forces (CSF) camp in Banha after allegedly being tortured, four days after his forced disappearance.
Two journalists were forcibly disappeared by homeland security from their prison cell in Tora Prison.

Two suspected militants were killed after clashes with security forces near North Sinai's Sheikh Zuweid city on Monday. The suspected militants are believed to have been members of the Sinai-based militant group State of Sinai.
Attackers detonated an IED as an armored vehicle passed, wounding four soldiers near the city of Rafah.
On Monday, fighters ambushed a military checkpoint near the town of Sheikh Zuweyid, firing several mortar shells that killed one conscript and wounded a soldier.
Three teachers were injured Monday after a roadside bomb exploded near a bus in the North Sinai town of Sheikh Zuweid.
The State of Sinai militant group released a video showing the killing of a man in North Sinai after accusing him of being a police "spy".
A militant was killed by security forces whilst attempting to plant an explosive device east of al-Arish.
Security forces killed four militants in the Sheikh Zuweid region of North Sinai. A child was killed and three people injured when a rocket hit a house during the clashes.

Security personnel detonated two vehicles in North Sinai, killing at least six suspected militants. The men in the vehicles were attempting to attack the peacekeepers' camp with mortar shells. Those killed belonged to the State of Sinai militant group.
State of Sinai militants fired rockets in the direction of multinational peacekeepers at Al-Goura airport in North Sinai. No casualties were reported.
A video by militant group "State of Sinai" claimed the killing of a man under the accusation he was an informant for the security forces. The video does not show the date of the incident.

column22: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International; MENA news agency
column23: A suicide bomber blew himself up at the ancient Egyptian temple of Karnak in Luxor. Another Islamist attacker was killed and another wounded in the resulting shootout with security forces. Two civilians and two policemen were injured, but no tourists were hurt. The 12-strong militant cell received its instructions from the State of Sinai group.
Dozens of journalists organised a demonstration at the press syndicate in Cairo, calling for freedoms, fair wages and syndicate protection.
On 11 June, a police officer was injured outside Al-Hamouly police station in Fayoum by fire from unknown assailants.

column22: Egypt State Information Service; MENA news agency
column23: A firefight erupted between security forces and a number of militants in Sinai, causing a landmine in the area to explode. No casualties were reported.
An Egyptian National Security officer was killed in a shoot-out with unidentified assailants in Sharqiya.
Seven members of the same family were injured Friday night by a bomb in the North Sinai town Al-Arish, which was planted near a police officer's house.
A group of plainclothes police detained an April 6 activist in Alexandria. She was detained off official records in continued forced disappearances and secret detentions.
One militant was killed and two others were injured in an attack on a checkpoint in Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai. The attack resulted in no casualties amongst military forces.
On 14 June, unknown assailants attacked an off-duty police officer on his way home from work in Fayoum, leaving him injured.
On 14 June, an off-duty police corporal who worked at the Tamia police station was shot dead by unknown assailants after he left his house.
Policemen shot dead a man who was allegedly carrying Molotov cocktails in Old Cairo on Monday, after he stabbed a policeman, leaving him injured.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: In Gharbeya governorate, 28 Muslim Brotherhood members accused of planting homemade bombs in different populated areas were arrested.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces arrested a man on Tuesday in the Daqahleya governorate, claiming he was the leader of a local "Islamic State" (IS) cell consisting of six members.
Unidentified assailants bombed the home of a police officer and set two others ablaze in Al-Arish on Tuesday. No casualties reported.
A police officer was shot Wednesday morning by unknown assailants in a drive-by shooting in front of the Abshoway police station in the city of Fayoum.
Security forces carried out a "preemptive strike" which left seven militants killed and two weapons warehouses destroyed.

column22: Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
column23: A roadside bomb killed an Egyptian policeman on Wednesday in the North Sinai provincial capital of El-Arish. Four police were also wounded by the bomb, which was detonated remotely as their armoured vehicle passed. State of Sinai are believed to be responsible.

Security forces seize a journalist from his house in Toukh, Qaliubiya governorate, seizing his laptop and mobile phone. The continuation of his detention and the unknown location of his detention is considered a forced disappearance.
A 35-year-old policeman was injured on Thursday when a blast hit his house in North Sinai's city of Arish. Two gunmen on a motorbike threw a bomb at the security personnel's house.
Security forces shelled an area in North Sinai's Sheikh Zuweid late Friday, killing 15 suspected State of Sinai militants and injuring 20.
On Friday, violent clashes occurred between protesters and riot police in the district of Matariya in Cairo.

Tens of Muslim Brotherhood supporters organised a rally and chanted against state institutions in Sharqiya governorate. They were dispersed by police forces after approaching the Diyarb Najm police station.
A 23-year-old student was killed on Friday during a protest in Diyarb Najm in Sharqiya governorate. The student, who was a passer-by, was shot by anonymous assailants.
Two militants were killed and 100 kilograms of explosive materials were seized during security campaigns launched by army officers in North Sinai.
An explosion severely damaged an electricity pylon and damaged part of the Fayoum stadium's wall. There were no injuries reported.
Police forces dispersed a minor protest by the anti-government group Ultras Nahdawy at Abdel Moneim Riad Square. No arrests or injuries were reported.
A protest was held at the Press Syndicate's Cairo HQ calling for the release of a journalist from Akhbar Al-Youm newspaper.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces arrested 15 middle-ranking members of the Muslim Brotherhood as well as three members of quality operations committees affiliated with the group. 17 'militants' were also arrested in security campaigns nationwide.

Dozens of women held a vigil outside Egypt's presidential palace, challenging a law that restricts protests and calling for the release of thousands of prisoners detained for violating the protest law.

column22: Aswat Masriya; Xinhua General News Service
column23: 16 suspected State of Sinai militants were killed in a military operation in Sheikh Zuweid. Army forces shot and shelled the militants using Apache helicopters.
Two houses belonging to policemen were bombed in North Sinai's Al-Arish city leaving 8 injured (five civilians and three policemen).

column22: Aswat Masriya; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Security forces shelled a car carrying four State of Sinai militants as they made their way to the Karam al-Qawadis checkpoint in Sheik Zuweid. All four were killed. Simultaneously two suspected State of Sinai militants were shelled and killed as they drove to a Sheikh Zuweid checkpoint, riding motorcycles.
An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded on the outskirts of Al-Arish in the North Sinai governorate Tuesday. No injuries reported.
Anti-government groups in Cairo held flash protests in main streets in the 6th of October district.
In Mohandessin, a protest was organised in Al-Sudan Street, with the protesters blocking the road and clashing with local residents.
A police van that was stationed in Nasr City was reported to have been burnt by "unknown assailants" during clashes between anti-government protesters and police personnel.
Workers protested in front of the Misr-Iran factory in Suez, refusing the management's decision to temporarily suspend 2,000 workers.
Clashes occurred between security forces and armed men near the Rafah border crossing, leaving one killed and two more injured. The men are believed to belong to the State of Sinai militant group.

Security forces shelled an area east of al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai, killing a total of 9 people believed to belong to the State of Sinai militant group. 4 fatalities recorded in Sheikh Zuweyid.
A sound bomb went off Friday outside of the Egyptian Media Production City (EMPC) in 6th of October City.

Security forces shelled an area east of al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai, killing a total of 9 people believed to belong to the State of Sinai militant group. 5 fatalities recorded in al-Arish.
An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded, halting trains between Cairo and Alexandria. The precise location of the bomb was not given. No injuries were caused.

Security forces dispersed rallies by anti-government protesters in Matariya. The protesters used fireworks to confront the forces, who were stationed in the district's main square and around mosques that are known to be meeting points of protesters.
In Gharbeya governorate, three alleged members of the Muslim Brotherhood were arrested, on charges of possessing anti-government flyers and protesting without a permit.

Nine alleged members of the militant Revolutionary Punishment group were arrested by the police on charges of killing a man and filming his execution. The video showed an alleged Helwan resident confessing to helping the police to point out protesters and activists. The exact date was not reported.

A total of 11 militants, believed to be State of Sinai militants, were killed and four suspects were arrested on Saturday during security raids on their hideouts south in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid cities of Egypt's North Sinai province. 5 fatalities recorded in Sheikh Zuweyid.

A total of 11 militants, believed to be State of Sinai militants, were killed and four suspects were arrested on Saturday during security raids on their hideouts south in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid cities of Egypt's North Sinai province. 6 fatalities recorded in Rafah.
A bomb explosion occurred in front of a church in Assiut on Saturday, damaging three cars and the fronts of two houses.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: A bomb exploded in a bus station in Damanhour, in the Beheira governorate, leaving two dead and damaging a bus parked at the station. The bomb is believed to have exploded on the motorcycle that the two attackers were riding, killing them and damaging the vehicle.
A traffic office in Talbiya, Giza was torched Saturday night after assailants attacked it with Molotov cocktails.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Three bombs were defused and 18 suspects arrested on 28th June in Sheikh Zuweid.

Two bombs detonated while a third planted beneath a pylon in Mansha'it al Fayyum village was defused by sappers on Sunday [28 June]. The explosion did not leave any casualties or material damage except for the base of the pylon.
A protest was staged at the Press Syndicate in Cairo to support a number of photojournalists that are being detained.
An attack on a police vehicle in a village near Beni Suef Monday night left a police officer dead and four conscripts injured.

column22: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International; Daily News Egypt; MENA news agency
column23: Egypt's state prosecutor was killed in a remote-controlled bombing that hit his convoy on Monday in Heliopolis, in Cairo. 10 others were injured. An unknown militant group, calling itself 'Tahrir Brigades', claimed responsibility for the assassination. The post is the first on the group's newly established YouTube channel. There are no earlier activities or statements known from 'Tahrir Brigades'. The authenticity of the post and claim has not been confirmed.

A bomb exploded in a village between Al-Arish and Sheikh Zuweid, killing three engineers and injuring nine others riding in a bus. The militants who triggered the bomb apparently thought the bus was carrying soldiers.
Four civilians were injured Monday night in an attack by unknown assailants on a microbus in a village near Qena.
Gunmen shot dead a policeman outside the Helwan Wax Museum in a south Cairo suburb. A museum worker was wounded.

On Tuesday, at least three militants were killed and ten others arrested during security raids in Arish and Sheikh Zuweid cities of Egypt's North Sinai. The militants are believed to be loyalists of the Sinai-based, Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis (ABM) militant group, which has changed its name to "Sinai State" and vowed loyalty to the regional Islamic State (IS) militant group. 1 fatality recorded in Sheikh Zuweyid.

On Tuesday, at least three militants were killed and ten others arrested during security raids in Arish and Sheikh Zuweid cities of Egypt's North Sinai. The militants are believed to be loyalists of the Sinai-based, Ansar Bayt al-Maqdis (ABM) militant group, which has changed its name to "Sinai State" and vowed loyalty to the regional Islamic State (IS) militant group. 2 fatalities recorded in Al-Arish.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Three suspected militants were killed in a car explosion in the 6th of October suburb of the Egyptian capital. The incident occurred when explosives the militants were carrying went off accidentally.
A mortar shell of an unknown source hit a house near a security base in North Sinai's Sheikh Zuweid on Tuesday, killing two children and injuring three others.
In Cairo, hundreds of people protested against "terrorism" at a state prosecutor's funeral after he was killed in a car bomb attack.
One man was shot dead in Al-Arish by unknown assailants on Tuesday morning.
The bodies of two children and an adult were found in Sheikh Zuweid. The bodies contained signs of gunshot wounds, yet the causes of their death remain unknown.
Egyptian security forces killed 9 suspected Islamist militants, as well as a senior Muslim Brotherhood member named Nasser al-Houfi, during a gunfight in the October 6 district of Giza.

column22: Xinhua General News Service; Aswat Masriya
column23: Egyptian military raids backed by the Egyptian Air Force have killed 100 suspected Islamist militants in North Sinai following a wave of attacks in the Sheikh Zuweiyid, while many militants were said to have been wounded and 20 of their vehicles destroyed, according to a statement aired by the military on state television. At least 38 militants out of the total were killed during clashes at Sheikh Zuweiyid. Fatalities disaggregated across locations.
At least 205 suspected State of Sinai militants have been killed by security forces between Jul.1-3, following the coordinated attacks the group carried out on Jul.1 (144 coded in other events).

column22: Agence France Presse; Associated Press News Briefs; Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service; Jamahiriya News Agency (JANA); Daily News Egypt; BBC Monitoring Middle East - Political; Aswat Masriya
column23: More than 70 State of Sinai militants on Wednesday carried out numerous simultaneous attacks on military positions, checkpoints and a police station, including at least 3 suicide bombings (included in fatality count). The Eygptian military's official casualty figures were set at 17 soldiers killed, including 4 officers, and 13 injured, but a variety of higher figures were given by both media and unofficial security sources (coded as 17). One car bomb alone was responsible for at least 15 military fatalities. The majority of the attacks took place in Sheikh Zuweiyid with the State of Sinai claiming it "gained full control over several locations", while al-Arish was also reported targeted by some of the attacks. The militants also took soldiers captive, seized several armored vehicles, mined the roads leading to the main police station to prevent military reinforcements, and were reported to be using Kornet anti-tank missiles, mortars and other heavy weapons. The Egyptian military claimed it killed 38 militants during clashes following the attack around Sheikh Zuweiyid, while at least 10 civilian casualties were also reported during the clashes. Fatalities disaggregated across locations.

column22: Agence France Presse; Associated Press News Briefs; Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service; Jamahiriya News Agency (JANA); Daily News Egypt; BBC Monitoring Middle East - Political; Aswat Masriya; Agence France Presse -- English
column23: More than 70 State of Sinai militants on Wednesday carried out numerous simultaneous attacks on military positions, checkpoints and a police station, including at least 3 suicide bombings (included in fatality count). The Eygptian military's official casualty figures were set at 17 soldiers killed, including 4 officers, and 13 injured, but a variety of higher figures were given by both media and unofficial security sources (coded as 17). One car bomb alone was responsible for at least 15 military fatalities. The majority of the attacks took place in Sheikh Zuweiyid with the State of Sinai claiming it "gained full control over several locations", while al-Arish was also reported targeted by some of the attacks. The militants also took soldiers captive, seized several armored vehicles, mined the roads leading to the main police station to prevent military reinforcements, and were reported to be using Kornet anti-tank missiles, mortars and other heavy weapons. The Egyptian military claimed it killed 38 militants during clashes following the attack around Sheikh Zuweiyid, while at least 10 civilian casualties were also reported during the clashes. Fatalities disaggregated across locations.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: The Interior Ministry has reported that in the last 24 hours security forces have arrested at least 56 "members and loyalists" of the Muslim Brotherhood, "who are charged with violence and terror activities".

A 22-year old student who was one of five students that faced trial in the Al Jazeera retrial (called the "Marriot Cell" trial) was forcibly disappeared on 1st July 2015. During the time of his forced disappearance he was hung by his wrists for three full days and electrocuted all over his body in Tora Prison.
Two unidentified gunmen on a motorbike shot dead an Egyptian traffic police officer in Fayoum.

column22: Aswat Masriya; Associated Press International; Agence France Presse -- English
column23: At least 22 militants who were involved in the Jul.1 attacks on security forces were killed by Egyptian air strikes carried out by 2 Apache helicopters in Rafah early on Thursday. Soldiers also raided a house in Rafah, killing 6 suspected State of Sinai militants wearing military uniforms. At least 1 civilian was also killed when a stray rocket hit his home during the clashes.

35 suspected State of Sinai militants total were killed and a number of others injured in the Sheikh Zuweiyid and Rafah areas in North Sinai on Thursday according to security sources (28 coded in another event in Rafah).

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: The State of Sinai claimed the firing of between 2-3 rockets into Israeli territory which caused no casualties or material damage.

Pro- and anti-Morsi protests, including Muslim Brotherhood members, took place after Friday prayers. The pro-Morsi demonstrators demanded his reinstatement, while the anti-Morsi protesters demanded "the execution of every Brotherhood member in Egypt".

Students Against the Coup (SAC) organized a protest in Maadi to mark the anniversary of his removal from power. Police dispersed protesters with tear gas after clashes broke out. A student protester was allegedly killed by the police, the second alongside a student allegedly killed in Menoufia.

Protests took place after Friday prayers by Morsi supporters and Muslim Brotherhood members in Cairo, where security forces used tear gas to diserpse protesters who shot at police with fireworks. Other protests also occurred in Giza and Alexandria, and towns around Cairo.

Two marches took place in Giza in Kerdasa town and the Imbaba neighbourhood in support of Morsi on the anniversary of his removal, and were dispersed by police. The protest in Kerdasa town was dispersed after clashes between protesters and residents.

A protester and a conscript were injured during clashes between student demonstrators and police in the Menoufia area to mark the anniversary of Morsi's removal from power. The demonstrations were called by the Students Against the Coup (SAC) organization. Protesters attempted to block at least one road and were dispersed with tear gas. A student protester was also allegedly killed after being shot by police.
10 suspected Islamist militants were killed and others wounded during a military operation in Sheikh Zuweiyid. Vehicles and hideouts were also destroyed.
An IED planted by suspected Islamist militants exploded at the Aswan railway station, causing no injuries or damage.
An IED planted by suspected Islamist militants exploded at a power station in Fayoum, causing some damage to the station.
A child was killed and 4 others wounded when an IED detonated near a checkpoint in Rafah.

column22: Aswat Masriya; Agence France Presse -- English
column23: 5 civilians were killed and 2 seriously injured in separate incidents of stray rockets and mortars fired by unidentified armed groups hitting houses in Sheikh Zuweiyid.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: The Egyptian armed forces found and destroyed five explosive devices in Al-Arish on Saturday.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Security forces arrested 52 "medium-ranking" Muslim Brotherhood members Saturday evening.
A bomb exploded outside the home of a Police Secretary in the North Sinai town of Al-Arish on Saturday evening. No injuries or fatalities were reported .
A total of 241 State of Sinai militants were killed from July 1-5 by the Egyptian army. The other 215 fatalities are recorded in events in North Sinai from 1-4 July.

An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded early Sunday outside the branch of a telecommunications company in Fayoum. The explosion caused damage to the Etisalat branch's exterior, and also damaged another neighbouring store.
A police officer was shot while guarding a checkpoint in Sharqeya. The police said that the officer was attacked by birdshot bullets by two assailants riding a motorcycle.
A bomb exploded Monday night near the Al-Qaren Police Station in Sharqeya, leaving no injuries.
