column23: Demonstrations were staged in several Libyan towns on [2 January] to denounce aerial bombardments carried out by Khalifah Haftar's forces. Towns included Tripoli, Misratah, Gharyan, Sabha and Zlitin.
Demonstrations were staged in several Libyan towns on [2 January] to denounce aerial bombardments carried out by Khalifah Haftar's forces. Towns included Tripoli, Misratah, Gharyan, Sabha and Zlitin.
Heavy fighting was reported near Watiyah airbase, south of Zawia [Al-Zawiyah] between Zintani units loyal to the Libyan National Army (LNA) and Zawia forces part of Libya Dawn.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: In Benghazi, six of Gen. Haftar's soldiers were killed in Al-Sabri area in clashes with fighters of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council [an umbrella group of Islamist militias].
The Libya Dawn coalition suffered five fatalities and 50 of its fighters were wounded in fighting against pro-Haftar forces near Al-Sidrah oil terminal in the centre of the country.

Petroleum Facilities Guards (PFG) claimed that 77 members of Libya Dawn's Operation Sunrise were killed in fighting at Wadi Ikhila, east of Bin-Jawad. The main Sunrise forces were forced to pull back into central Bin-Jawad.
General Haftar's warplanes bombarded residential districts in Bin Jawad region. The air strikes caused extensive damage to residential buildings but no casualties among civilians.
Libya National Army [LNA] planes attacked Misrata causing no damage.

column22: Aswat Masriya (Cairo); Deutsche Welle (Bonn); Daily News Egypt
column23: Thirteen Coptic Egyptian workers were kidnapped in the Libyan city of Sirte. Daily News Egypt reported that the Islamic State in Tripoli released photos of the captured Egyptians. Their deaths were later confirmed by the Libyan parliament.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: The Al-Laythi area of Benghazi witnessed fierce clashes between the Benghazi revolutionaries' shura council and the forces of retired Maj-Gen Khalifah Haftar.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Clashes in the Al-Sabiri area of Benghazi between the Benghazi Revolutionaries' Shura Council and forces of Maj-Gen. Khalifah Haftar left two dead.
Libya National Army [LNA] planes attacked targets at Al-Agarbiya near Al-Jmail [Al-Jumayil] in the west of the country.

column22: Libya (Al-Ahrar) TV; Libya Herald; Agence France Presse
column23: A Libyan National Army warplane bombed an oil tanker opposite Darnah Port carrying heavy oils. The bombing caused two deaths including a member of the tanker crew of Greek nationality and the injury of two others.
Libya National Army [LNA] planes attacked Misrata. Conflicting reports: General Staff reported an oil tank was hit, pro-Libya Dawn media reported no damage.
An Iraqi professor at the University of Sirte was kidnapped along with his three sons from their home.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Sporadic clashes continued in Benghazi's Laythi district as the Libyan National Army claimed to almost have full control of the Ansar al-Sharia stronghold. Ansar al-Shariah are reported now to control just two streets.
The Libyan air force on Tuesday bombed Al-Jufrah military base where Libya Dawn militias are located. There were no human casualties.
The Libyan army used helicopters in fierce fighting over the last 48 hours around Ben Jawad and claims to have inflicted heavy casualties on Libya Dawn forces.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: An armed group attacked the home in Zawia [Al-Zawiyah] of the first deputy president of the House of Representatives (HoR), and set fire to it. No casualties reported.
The Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant [Islamic State, IS, ISIS/ISIL] known by its [Arabic] acronym Da'ish, has officially announced the establishment of its branch in Libya.
Ten Egyptians were claimed to have been kidnapped in Libya near the city of Beni Walid on 7 January.
Heavy fighting was reported south west of Ajelat between Zintani-led Libyan National Army units and Libya Dawn forces from Zawia.
The Libyan branch of the Islamic State (IS) on Thursday claimed to have executed two Tunisian journalists who had been abducted in Ajdabiya.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: At least six people were killed and 20 others wounded in clashes between the Libyan military and the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council that took place in Al-Laythi, Al-Hada'iq and Al-Sabri districts of Benghazi, on Friday [9 January].

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: At least six people were killed and 20 others wounded in clashes between the Libyan military and the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council that took place in Al-Laythi, Al-Hada'iq and Al-Sabri districts of Benghazi, on Friday [9 January].

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: At least six people were killed and 20 others wounded in clashes between the Libyan military and the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council that took place in Al-Laythi, Al-Hada'iq and Al-Sabri districts of Benghazi, on Friday [9 January].

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: The Tripoli office of Al-Naba TV has hit by at least one RPG missile, which blew out part of the front of the building. No casualties were reported.
Large demonstrations were staged on Friday evening [9 January] in the towns of Tripoli, Misratah, Al-Zawiyah, and Gharyan calling for severing the relations with Egypt and the Emirates.
Large demonstrations were staged on Friday evening [9 January] in the towns of Tripoli, Misratah, Al-Zawiyah, and Gharyan calling for severing the relations with Egypt and the Emirates.

column23: Large demonstrations were staged on Friday evening [9 January] in the towns of Tripoli, Misratah, Al-Zawiyah, and Gharyan calling for severing the relations with Egypt and the Emirates.

Ghat residents and local forces repelled an attempt by Libya Dawn to take over the Ghat airport. Some 25 armoured vehicles carrying Libya Dawn forces were reported to have stormed the Ghat Airport on Friday night.
Five soldiers and eight militants were killed on Saturday in clashes between the Libyan army and the Muhjahideen Shura Council militant group in the Ain Mara area near the eastern city of Darna.
Three Libyan soldiers were killed and four others wounded Tuesday in a suicide car bomb attack on a checkpoint, located about 100 kilometres (60 miles) west of Benghazi on the road to Ajdabiya.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: The Libyan army claimed to have shot down a helicopter drone which was on a reconnaissance mission near the Zintani airbase at Al-Wattiya.
The Libyan National Army (LNA) bombed a tanker it says was attempting to make a delivery of petrol to [Islamist militia] Ansar Al-Shari'ah. Further details of damage and injuries were not available.
The cities of Tripoli and Zawia witnessed Thursday evening solidarity rallies with the people of Benghazi and daily attacks they are subjected to at the hands of Haftar's forces.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: The cities of Tripoli and Zawia witnessed Thursday evening solidarity rallies with the people of Benghazi and daily attacks they are subjected to at the hands of Haftar's forces.

column22: Libya Herald; Xinhua General News Service
column23: In January, Islamic State militants in Libya killed two Tunisian journalists kidnapped last year. They were reportedly buried in Derna.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: An executive from Libya's National Oil Corporation (NOC), who represents his country in the OPEC cartel is believed to have been abducted in the militia-held capital Tripoli.
Armed militants attacked a farm belonging to Qaddafi regime figures near Zawia, kidnapping and firing at several members of one family.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: An Islamist-backed militia alliance on Friday announced a ceasefire in conflict-strewn Libya, following an agreement at UN-brokered peace talks between warring factions.

Libya Dawn forces, in a clear rejection of a ceasefire, continued to try and attack LNA forces near Ajilat and Al-Jmail. The result, according to Zintani sources, was that there were further airstrikes on the Dawn forces who, they said, were obliged to retreat.

Libya Dawn forces, in a clear rejection of a ceasefire, continued to try and attack LNA forces near Ajilat and Al-Jmail. The result, according to Zintani sources, was that there were further airstrikes on the Dawn forces who, they said, were obliged to retreat.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Members of the IS Libya branch threw explosives at a police car outside Algeria's embassy in the Libyan capital Saturday, wounding three people.
A number of residents in Misrata took part in a protest demanding an end to violence and bloodshed in Libya.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: The commander of the pro-Haftar 146 infantry brigade succumbed to his wounds after being hurt in fighting in Benghazi's Al-Sabri district on 17 January.
The Tibesti hotel in central Benghazi was struck by a shell. There were no reports of any casualties.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Heavy fighting broke out between a coalition of [Islamist] armed groups and forces loyal to retired Maj-Gen Khalifah Haftar in Layti, Buatni and Shibna districts of Benghazi.

column23: The Libyan military announced a ceasefire with Islamist-backed militias after UN-brokered peace talks in Geneva.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for setting fire to Tripoli's largest supermarket. One man was injured.
Heavy fighting was reported some 10 kilomtres south of Sabratha between local fighters allied to Libya Dawn and Libya National Army forces from Zintan and the Warshefana.

In western Libya, near Al-Watiyah airbase, two soldiers were killed and others injured in clashes between the Libya Dawn coalition of [Islamist] armed groups and the rival Al-Qa'qa and Al-Sawa'iq brigades (Zintan militia) backed by forces of the so-called Tribes Army.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Fighting erupted in Garyounis area of Benghazi, between forces of retired Maj-Gen Khalifah Haftar and the [Islamist] Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council, leaving seven soldiers dead and others injured.
A local administration official escaped unhurt after gunmen opened fire at him in Sirte.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column22: Xinhua General News Service; Al-Jazeera TV; Libya Herald
column23: Libyan army forces, backed by armed men in plainclothes stormed and robbed the Benghazi branch of the Central Bank of Libya. Claims that the Central Bank of Libya branch in Benghazi was attacked and looted by the Libyan National Army (LNA) have been denied by both the Libyan government in Beida and LNA itself.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: On Jan. 22, dozens of Libyan oil workers mounted a protest in the capital city, demanding the release of a kidnapped OPEC executive.

Ansar al-Shari'ah claims to have set up a Shura Council of Revolutionaries in Al-Bayda, the seat of both the government of Prime Minister Abdallah al-Thinni and the Constitutional Drafting Assembly (CDA). The aim, it says, is to break local support for Khalifah Haftar's Operation Dignity and establish its own control over the town.
Armed men shot dead the head of security in the Islamist-held coastal city of Sirte.

column8: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: An official from Libya's Health Ministry was abducted in the capital city of Tripoli.

A peaceful protest in Zawia was attacked by gunmen, apparently associated with Libya Dawn, who began to beat protesters who were holding a peaceful demonstration against bloodshed and fighting in the country.

The Zintanis claimed to have gained ground in a surprise attack at Suweniya south west of Ajilat. They claim that ten Libya Dawn fighters from Zawia were killed in the operation and three wounded. The Zintanis now claim to control Suweniya and the nearby area of Aghrabiya.

There were reports from Libyan National Army sources of Scud missiles landing near Ras Lanuf. The source claimed that they had been fired by Misratans, but said they fell on open ground and that no damage had been done. There has been no independent verification of the claim.

Since late Saturday, Libya's National Army started new assaults against the armed Islamist groups around the oil ports in eastern Libya, using long-range missiles and heavy weaponry. Local witnesses said that both Sidra and Ras Lanuf oil ports were under attack.

Since late Saturday, Libya's National Army started new assaults against the armed Islamist groups around the oil ports in eastern Libya, using long-range missiles and heavy weaponry. Local witnesses said that both Sidra and Ras Lanuf oil ports were under attack.
Light clashes between Zintan militia and Zawia forces supporting Operation Libya Dawn were reported at Suweniya south west of Ajilat.

According to a source close to Operation Sunrise, clashes took place on the front line 25 kilometres west of Sidra as Operation Sunrise continues to try moving east to the oil port and to Ras Lanuf beyond it. They in turn are being bombed by LNA aircraft.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column22: Xinhua General News Service; Libya Herald
column23: A policeman was killed today when gunmen shot at members of the diplomatic police protecting the Libya headquarters of the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) in Tripoli’s Nufleen district.

At least seven and maybe as many as 25 drivers have been seized driving fuel toward Ajdabiya in the last 48 hours. All were taken on the B11, the  direct inland road between Tobruk and Ajdabiya. Tobruk fuel delivery drivers have gone on strike in protest.

Two soldiers and three civilians were killed, and 18 others were wounded in al-Laithi district of Benghazi as Ansar al-Sharia launched attacks after the death of their leader, al-Zahawi, was announced Sunday (January 25th). Two journalists were also wounded.
At least a dozen people were killed including three civilians, as the Libyan National Army clashes with Ansar al-Sharia in Buhdeima district of Benghazi.

column8: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
column22: Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Gunmen beat and kidnapped the deputy foreign minister of Libya's internationally-recognized government in the eastern city of Bayda. He was released a day later.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: 4 people were killed in fighting in Benghazi.
General Hafter's forces carried out bombing raids against the Al Jufra air base and the area of Bir Al Ghanam wounding two 'soldiers'.
General Hafter's forces carried out bombing raids against the Al Jufra air base and the area of Bir Al Ghanam wounding two 'soldiers'.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: At least 18 people were killed and 44 others wounded in fierce clashes in Libya's second largest city of Benghazi. Army warplanes were also seen bombing the Islamist-occupied areas in Benghazi.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column22: Xinhua General News Service; Agence France Presse; Deutsche Welle (Bonn); Al-Jazeera TV
column23: Assailants affiliated with Islamic State of Tripoli attacked Libya's biggest hotel in Tripoli, killing nine and injuring several others. The attackers set off a booby-trap car bomb and two of them were killed in clashes with the "Special Deterrence Force" in the hotel. Conflicting report: the government in Tripoli [GNC] said the the attack was an attempt by Qaddafi supporters to assassinate its chief; and experts belief the threat was local.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: A grenade was thrown into the grounds of the International School of Martyrs (ISM) in Hayy al Andalus district of Tripoli, but failed to explode.
Protesters stormed government offices in Beida demanding that more be done to help those displaced internally by the fighting.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: A large explosion was heard in Ben Ashour in Tripoli. Cause of the fighting unclear, with speculation ranging from the Islamic State exacting revenge on the Nawasi Brigade, an arrest raid by the Nawasi Brigade, or residents blocking the roads.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Gunfire was reported on the coast road in Fashloum, Drebi, Abu Selim and  at Camp 77 near Bab Al Aziziya. Cause of the fighting unclear, with speculation ranging from the Islamic State exacting revenge on the Nawasi Brigade, an arrest raid by the Nawasi Brigade, or residents blocking the roads.

In continued fighting in western Libya between Libya Dawn and Zintani and Warshefani forces allied to the Libyan National Army (LNA), a war plane hit the Zintani position in Bir Ghanem area. No damages and no casualties reported.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: There were roadblocks of vehicles, burning tyres and rubbish at various point including Dahra and Al-Zawia Street of Tripoli.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: A military officer was murdered in the Al-Andalus district.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Libyan National Army aircraft continued to strike Ansar Al-Sharia targets in Leithi district. Explosions could also be heard in Garyounis district and the downtown. Random shells are also said to have landed in Hay Dollar district near Leithi.
Protesters gathered outside the old Qaddafi katiba headquarters in the Birka area to express support to the army and police and anger at the Turkish, American and British response to violence.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: A number of young men were captured from Tajoura by Libya Dawn forces and imprisoned in Misrata.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Benghazi’s downtown and port areas as well as some other parts of the city continued to be hit by random missiles in clashes between Ansar al-Sharia and the Libyan National Army.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column22: Xinhua General News Service; Ammun News
column23: Unidentified gunmen on Saturday robbed the Jordanian embassy in the Libyan capital Tripoli and kidnapped a security guard. The spokesman for the ministry denied the reports.
Libya Dawn fighters inflicted "heavy losses and casualties" in clashes with the rival Tribes Army, forcing it to retreat into Al-Watiyah airbase.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Six people died and others were injured in clashes in the Wasat al-Bilad area in Benghazi between Shura Council forces and forces of the so-called Operation Dignity.

column22: Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service; Libya Herald
column23: Eleven Libyan soldiers were killed and 38 wounded in clashes with Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin after an army offensive launched on Monday at Ain Mara, near the town of Derna. The Islamist forces lost roughly 30 men, with dozens more wounded.

Fajr Dawn militia launched an offensive against troops loyal to Libya's internationally recognised government around the key oil hub of Al-Sidra. Five soldiers died in the violence and another 13 were wounded.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: A car bomb exploded Monday near the Tripoli headquarters of the Libya militia 'Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade' which controls the capital, killing one person and wounding two others. Libya Herald reported that the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
The mayor of Khoms was kidnapped by unidentified gunmen. The group are said to have gone to the Muncipal headquarters and seized him and then driven off.

Fierce clashes continued in the Sidrah oil field area. 18 Misratan fighters on Operation Sunrise's side and 6 members of the Central Petroleum Facilities Guard were killed. A spokesman for the chief of staff said that Operation Dignity also launched a three-pronged attack on Sidra, claiming its forces suffered 34 dead and 48 wounded.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column22: Associated Press International; Agence France Presse; Radio France Internationale (Paris); UN News Service (New York)
column23: Clashes between pro-government forces and Islamist rebels left 18 dead Tuesday in the port city of Benghazi.

column22: Associated Press International; Agence France Presse; Radio France Internationale (Paris); UN News Service (New York); Xinhua General News Service; Libya Herald
column23: An armed group attacked the oilfield at Mabrouk, 100 km south of Sirte leaving 13 people dead. Victims include 4 Petroleum Facilities Guards, four other guards, and 5 workers. The attackers claimed to be members of the Islamic State (IS).

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column22: SUNA news agency; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Sudan's embassy in Tripoli, Libya, was targeted with a hand-made bomb on Tuesday [3 February]. The bomb did not detonate and was dismantled by security forces.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: A second attack was reported on a building being used by the Tripoli Revolutionaries’ Brigade, this time near Fornaj on the road heading to Suq Al-Juma. Libya Herald reported that the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

Fighting continued at Sidra between forces from Libya Dawn's Operation Sunrise, who are trying to seize the oil terminal, and the Central petroleum Facilities Guard (PFG) backed by Libyan National army's air power. Five Misratans were killed in the clashes.

An armed group mounted an attack on Libya's Mabrouk oilfield Wednesday. The armed group, consisting of around 20 armed vehicles, stormed the field and kidnapped a number of local guards. The official said the gunmen are suspected to be affiliated with the Islamic State (IS).

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Assailants tried to burn down the home in central Tripoli of a former policeman, with him and his family inside. They were rescued by neighbours but the assailants managed to burn the former officers’ car outside.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Operation Dignity and the Libyan National Army (LNA) claim to have taken control of the central Bengahzi’s port area as well as taken part of the neighbouring Suq Al-Hout district following heavy fighting. Seven soldiers were killed and 25 injured in the port area fighting. Two council fighters were killed and three injured in the clashes.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: There were fierce clashes in Sabri and in Laithi districts of Benghazi as the army pushed in to try and dislodge Ansar Al-Sharia and its allies, with heavy weaponry including tanks and missiles being used.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: There were fierce clashes in Sabri and in Laithi districts of Benghazi as the army pushed in to try and dislodge Ansar Al-Sharia and its allies, with heavy weaponry including tanks and missiles being used.
In West Salmani, four civilians were injured when a missile, believed to have been fired randomly, hit a house. Their injuries are said not to be life-threatening.
In the eastern city of Darnah, a Mig-23 jet fighter bombed positions of the Revolutionaries Council of Darnah and its Districts (an alliance of militant groups).

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Gunmen in Tajoura detained a contingent of fighters from Libya Dawn, along with the weapons, armoured vehicles and ammunition they were carrying, all of which was said to be destined to support the western front of Libya Dawn’s armed conflicts. It was claimed the detention was in retaliation for the capture of a number of young men from Tajoura last week. They were reportedly seized by Libya Dawn forces and imprisoned in Misrata.

Three people were killed and 20 injured – all civilians – when a suicide bomber blew himself and his car up near an army checkpoint next to Benghazi’s Leithi district. the bomber, who also died, was seen driving at speed towards the checkpoint and managed to detonate his explosives when shot by soldiers.
Heavy clashes were reported at Ain Mara, west of Derna, between Islamic State/Ansar Al-Sharia forces and LNA forces.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: After earlier reports indicated that the Libya National Army overtook the Suq-al Hout district on the 5th February, it was later reported that the army withdrew from the area after being unable to hold the area.
Heavy clashes at Ain Mara, west of Derna, between Islamic State/Ansar Al-Sharia forces and LNA forces continued.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: A total of 40 fighters were reported to have been killed in clashes across Benghazi as Operation Dignity forces launched a fresh, massive assault against Ansar al-Shari'ah and its allies.

column23: The military took control of large portions of al-Leiti, a Benghazi neighborhood in an offensive to seize Benghazi from the Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries. A total of 10 people were reported killed in two days of fighting.
Heavy clashes at Ain Mara, west of Derna, between Islamic State/Ansar Al-Sharia forces and Libya National Army forces continued.

Supporters of the Islamic State (IS) claim to have taken over the small town of Nawfaliya, some 30 kilometres west of Ben Jawad which is currently being used by Libya Dawn’s Operation Sunrise forces as their base in the offensive to take Sidra oil terminal.  Dawn of Libya militiamen engaged in deadly clashes with the IS militants.
Renegade general Khalifa Haftar's warplanes carried out airstrikes in Ras al-Hilal region in Derna.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Libyan special forces retook the main military base in Buatni, Benghazi from Islamist fighters. Forty severed heads were found in the training camp in Buatni area of Benghazi.

Heavy clashes at Ain Mara, west of Derna, between Islamic State/Ansar Al-Sharia forces and LNA forces have continued today for the fourth consecutive day. At least 11 fighters have been killed in the fighting over the past four days.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Operation Dignity planes and artillery intensified strikes on BRSC positions, especially in the Al-Laythi and Suq al-Hut areas. A number of the BRSC militia and army were reported to have been killed and injured.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Libyan army warplanes and warships bombed BRSC positions in the Suq al-Hut and Benghazi port areas.

Renegade general Khalifa Haftar's warplanes carried out airstrikes in Ras al-Hilal region in Derna.
The decapitated bodies of first three, then another four members of Misratah's Third Force were found west of Sirte. IS has been blamed.
Islamic State militants took control of Sirte immigration centre, without any opposition.
Gunmen claiming to be members of the Islamic State militant group seized control of a state-run radio station in Libya's coastal city of Sirte.

Libya Natoinal Army fighter jets carried out numerous raids on Shuruq (Operation Sunrise) positions in and around the central Libyan region of Sirte, Ben Jawad and beyond. The Air Force hit the Gardabia airbase of Sirte scoring direct hits on two tanks belonging to the Libya Dawn militias near Ben Jawad.

Libya National Army fighter jets carried out numerous raids on Shuruq (Operation Sunrise) positions in and around the central Libyan region of Sirte, Ben Jawad and beyond. The Air Force hit the Gardabia airbase of Sirte scoring direct hits on two tanks belonging to the Libya Dawn militias near Ben Jawad.

In the evening of the 12th February Islamic State gunmen launched attacks on the Bahi and Dahrah oilfields, both operated by Waha Oil where they were reported to be fighting with Petroleum Facilities Guards protecting the fields.

In the evening of the 12th February Islamic State gunmen launched attacks on the Bahi and Dahrah oilfields, both operated by Waha Oil where they were reported to be fighting with Petroleum Facilities Guards protecting the fields.

A military convoy carrying IS flags reportedly surrounded the hospital in Sirte on [13 February] and ordered Misratah-based Central Libya Shield which has been providing security there to leave. They told them to take all the patients in the hospital with them.
Fighting continued in Bahi and Dahra oil fields with reports that Libyan National Army aircraft started bombing IS vehicles.

Demonstrations were held in Beida [Al-Bayda] and Tobruk [Tubruq] demanding the creation of a military council to be headed by [Major-]General Khalifah Haftar.

The cities of Tripoli , Misrata , Gharyan , Zawiya , Sabha and Zlitin witnessed mass demonstrations , demanding "all Libyan revolutionaries to face traitors who are conspiring against the 17th Feb. revolution".

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Two members of the National Commission for Human Rights-Libya, a non-governmental organization, were abducted on 13 and 14 February in central Tripoli. Both were later released.
On Saturday, the Islamic State loyalists launched attacjs on Bahi and Dahra oil fields near Libya's western city of Sirte.
On Saturday, the Islamic State loyalists launched attacks on Bahi and Dahra oil fields near Libya's western city of Sirte.
On Saturday, a bomb hit a pipeline leading to the country's largest oil field, al-Sarir, disrupting the flow of oil to ships at a coastal terminal. No group claimed responsibility.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Two members of the National Commission for Human Rights-Libya, a non-governmental organization, were abducted on 13 and 14 February in central Tripoli. Both were later released.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Tripoli’s Fashloum district was rocked by fighting  as residents fought back against the Nawasi Brigade who had reportedly seized a local man.
Al-Qardabiyah military airbase was subject to aerial bombardment by Haftar's forces on Sunday [15 February], without sustaining any human losses.
The Libyan military shelled sites in Sirte and Bin Jawad in a coordinated campaign against Islamic State militants.

column22: Aswat Masriya (Cairo); Tunis Afrique Presse (Tunis); Al-Jazeera; Daily News Egypt
column23: 64 militants affiliated with the Islamic State were killed when the Egyptian military bombed training points and weapons and ammunition storage sites belonging to the ISIS fighters in Derna. Al-Jazeera reported that the dead included seven civilians killed in the strikes.
The Libyan military shelled sites in Sirte and Bin Jawad in a coordinated campaign against Islamic State militants.
It was reported that at least 35 Egyptians were kidnapped in a round-up at various locations in areas controlled by Ansar Al-Shari'ah and IS.
A fighter jet affiliated to Fajr Libya bombed pro-Haftar forces western Libya.
Airstrikes were launched on the Libyan city of Zintan and its airport by Libya Dawn militias in response to the Egyptian airstrikes on the city of Derna. No casualties reported.
An airstrike occurred on Tuesday in Derna. Libyan warplanes also participated in the airstrikes targeting IS training camps in and around the city.
The fourth anniversary of the Libyan uprising was celebrated in Misrata with protests against Egyptian warplanes striking "civilian residential areas" of Darnah.
A commander in the Ajdabiya Martyrs Brigade was assassinated in Ajdabiya when unidentified gunmen shot him in a drive-by shooting.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Fajr Libya (Libya Dawn) sent Misrata Brigade 166 units to "restore security in the city" of Sirte.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Islamist militants claiming affiliation with the Islamic State group took over the university in the Libyan city of Sirte on Thursday.

column22: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International
column23: Islamic State suicide bombers targeted security forces of General Khalifa Haftar in Libya, killing a total of 45 people in two attacks in the town of Al-Qubbah.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: A second attempt to blow up the Sarir Oil pipeline was foiled when a member of the Petroleum Facilities Guard spotted an explosive device.
Two shops in East Salmani of Benghazi belonging to families whose sons had joined Ansar were set on fire and destroyed.
The cities of Tripoli , Misrata , Zawya, Gharyan , Zlitin and Sabha witnessed mass demonstrations, demanding punishment to those who participated in the assault by 'al-Sisi' on Derna city.

Demonstrators in Benghazi’s Kish Square demanded the House of Representatives (HoR) appoint a military council headed by Khalifa Hafter, sack the government of Abdullah Al-Thinni and list the Muslim Brotherhood as a 'terrorist organisation'.

column23: Islamic State suicide bombers targeted a petrol station in the town of Al-Qubbah,  Libya. A total of 45 people dead, including six Egyptians, in the two attacks.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Pro-dignity operation gunmen set the house of the political advisor of Prime Minister Omer al-Hasi, on fire in Benghazi.
Zintani forces and those of Libya Dawn, backed by Misrata, were involved in further heavy fighting south of Ajilat.

column22: Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Islamic State militants fired four rockets at the international airport just outside Labraq, from which General Khalifa Haftar's forces launch raids against Islamist positions in the east. No casualties or damages.
Benghazi Medical Centre (BMC) was hit by a mortar shell that exploded near its third tower.
An attack was reported on Derna by helicopter gunships. It is unclear what IS targets were assaulted by several aircraft.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: The Islamic State group said it carried out a double bombing that targeted the empty residence of Iran's ambassador to Libya in Tripoli. Bomb disposal team discovered and defused two more explosive packs at the location. No one was hurt in the attack.
A vehicle belonging to the Finance Minister, Kamal Al-Hassi, was set on fire in Beida. Motive for the attack may have been either a personal attack or in revenge for a decision taken by the minister.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column22: Agence France Presse; UN News Service (New York)
column23: The bodies of a female civil society activist and another family member were found stuffed in the boot of a car in the Libyan capital. They had been shot dead.

A warplane bombed al-Khalij steam power plant in Sirte. No causalities were reported in the airstrike. The airstrike is believed to be carried out by rogue general Khalifa Haftar's dignity operation as the plant is guarded by the GNC's forces.

column8: Government of Libya (2014-) General National Congress
column10: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Border Guards
column23: The Labour Minister in the Tripoli-based “National Salvation Government”, Mohamed Balkhair, was assaulted by checkpoint guards in his hometown of Ghariyan.
In Benghazi, a university member died when his home was hit by a shell in the fighting there.
A university professor in Sabha town died when he was hit by a stray bullet. He was reported to have been killed on Thursday [26 February].

A crowd of several hundred demonstrators in Benghazi's Kish Square ignored a mortar attack and carried on with their protest in support of the Libyan Army. Two mortars landed in the square away from the main concentration of protestors. Some people sustained minor injuries.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: The Al-Wataniya TV and Radio stations in Sabha were attacked. No one was reported injured.

column23: The sound of explosions were reported from Al-Sabri area, where Shura Council fighters engaged in "heavy fighting" with Haftar's forces.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: At least four people were killed and more than six injured in a mortar attack on a residential area in the Libyan city of Benghazi. The fatalities included a Palestinian woman who was with her family when a mortar shell fell on their home in Sidi Husayn.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: In Benghazi's Al-Sabri neighbourhood, Haftar's forces clashed with the Benghazi Shura Council's fighters who made small advances towards their rivals' positions near Al-Salmani area.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Fighters of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council, [an alliance of Islamist armed groups] and the Marines Battalion loyal to Lt-Gen Khalifah Haftar were engaged in "heavy fighting" on the streets leading to the Suq al-Hut area in the centre of Benghazi.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: The UN Support Mission in Libya UNSMIL has announced an agreement for ceasefire and engagement in the dialogue with field commanders of 'Libya Dawn' and 'Al Shrouq' operations in Zwara.
Tebu militias raided some homes and attacked locals in _Murzuq. Reports of a women killed.

A retired military man was abducted on 3 March 2015. His home in the al-Akwass area of Sirte was raided, and the 166 Brigade – a militia affiliated with the Libya Dawn coalition - took him. His son, who had fought back, was shot in the leg by the group during an altercation.

column22: Agence France Presse; BBC News; The Daily Telegraph
column23: Islamic State militants seized control of the Al-Bahi oil field in central Libya. Forces guarding the Bahi and Mabruk sites retreated after running out of ammunition.The attack prompted the National Oil Corporation to declare "force majeure" at all 11 oilfields in the North African nation.

column22: Agence France Presse; BBC News; The Daily Telegraph
column23: Islamic State militants seized control of the Al-Mabrouk oil field in central Libya. Forces guarding the Bahi and Mabruk sites retreated after running out of ammunition. The attack prompted the National Oil Corporation to declare "force majeure" at all 11 oilfields in the North African nation.

column22: Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Libya Dawn militia warplanes attacked the major export terminal at Al-Sidra, guarded by the Petroleum Facilities Guard (PFG), but were driven off by anti-aircraft fire without hitting their targets. Two MiG airplanes took off from Sirte airport and tried to bomb Al-Sidra, but anti-aircraft defences forced them to drop their bombs on waste land without causing any casualties or damage.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column22: Agence France Presse; WAL news agency
column23: A military planes belonging to Lt-Gen Khalifah Haftar's Operation Dignity forces bombarded parts of Libya's Mitiga (also known as Mu'aytiqah) International Airport near the capital Tripoli without causing any casualties.  They targeted Fajr Libya units inside the facility and "also hit other militia positions in Tripoli".
Libya Dawn militia warplanes attacked the major export terminal at Ras Lanuf, guarded by the Petroleum Facilities Guard (PFG) causing no casualties.
There were reports of Misrata militias firing on civilians in Gira _in _Al shati after an argument.
There are reports of 1 dead from _Misrata militias, 3 injured & 7 held captive by locals in _Brak Alshati.

Militants posted a video of  the execution of two captured government soldiers in Derna. The video holds none of the typical branding of IS, it is possible that the executions were carried out by the Abu Salim Martyrs Brigade, though this has not been confirmed.
A double suicide bombing at a military checkpoint near Benghazi port misfired when marines opened fire on the car. Both suicide bombers died without inflicting any other casualties.

column22: Associated Press International; Al-Jazeera TV; ANSAmed
column23: Militants purportedly from the Islamic State group attacked and overtook the al-Dhahra oil field, trading fire with guards and blowing up residential and administrative buildings.
Islamic State (IS) fighters pulled out of the Bahi and Dahra oilfields less than 24 hours after capturing them and forces tasked with guarding the oilfields regained control.

On 4 March, Libya Dawn forces bombed the airport at Zintan, a stronghold of militias allied to the internationally-recognised Libyan government of Prime Minister Abdallah al-Thinni.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Helicopters belonging to Haftar's forces targeted the surrounding of the camp of the rival 17 February battalion in Kar Yunis in the eastern city of Benghazi. No casualties were reported from the attack on the camp which belongs to the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council, an alliance of Islamist armed groups.

Haftar's warplanes bombed a position of the Misrata 166 battalion in the town of Sirte. The battalion operates under the General Staff Command backed by the defunct Tripoli-based General National Congress (GNC).
The headless body of an Egyptian Christian was found by Libyan security forces on the outskirts of the town of Mechili, in eastern Libya.

column11: Government of Libya (2014-) General National Congress
column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Unknown gunmen kidnapped the head of Hajj & Umrah department at the ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs from his office in Tripoli on Wednesday. He was released two days later.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Warplanes taking part in Operation Dignity, under the command of Lt-Gen Khalifah Haftar, carried out an airstrike on Mitiga Airport near Tripoli on the morning of 5 March. No major damage was caused.
Heavy clashes were reported between _Misrata militias and the Libyan National Army (LNA) aligned with Gen-Lt Khalifah Haftar in _Brak Al shati. Several gang members were reportedly killed.

column22: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International; Libya Herald
column23: Islamic State group militants killed eight Petroleum Facilities Guards on Friday in an attack on the southern Libyan oilfield of Al-Ghani. 9 foreign workers were unaccounted for after the attack.

The towns of Tripoli, Misratah, Al-Zawiyah, Gharyan, Zlitin and Sabha witnessed large demonstrations which called for stopping corruption in its different forms and denouncing the aerial bombardment by Haftar's forces.

Following the attack on al-Ghani by Islamic State militants, fighter jets took off from the Ras Lanouf port on Libya central coastline and targeted the militants.
Nine foreign workers were kidnapped from the al-Ghani oil field after an attack by Islamic State militants.

column22: Xinhua General News Service; Libya Herald
column23: Militants loyal to the Islamic State (IS) group continued their assaults on Libya's southern oil field al-Ghani on Saturday, killing at least 11 Petroleum Facilities Guards.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column23: Army experts defused a car-bomb in Tobruk and arrested the two occupants of the vehicle.

A Zwai man was killed at a petrol station, allegedly by a member of the Tebu community. The Zwai-Tebu crisis committee comprising elders from the two communities immediately convened to try and calm the situation.
The southern town of Brak Ashatti was the scene of fighting on Saturday between Libya Dawn forces and the Libyan National Army (LNA).

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Gunfire was exchanged in a raid on illegal weapons traders in Al-Rashid Street and the old fish market in central Tripoli carried out by the Al-Nawasi Eight Force (which has re-branded itself as the North Tripoli branch of the Central Security Directory) in cooperation with other agencies.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Five Tunisian nationals were kidnapped and held in Janzour. They were released three days later. The identity of the perpetrators is unknown.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: A sailor and a soldier were killed in exchanges in Benghazi between military forces and Ansar al-Sharia which also saw 11 government troops injured. Two missiles, apparently fired at random also killed one civilian and injured five others.
A prominent Tarhouna elder, of the Al-Furjan tribe was reportedly seized by an armed group after making a call to General Khalifa Hafter.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Fighting continued in Leithi district of Benghazi between forces of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council and the Libyan army. A total of 25 Libyan National Army (LNA) troops were killed and 170 wounded in two weeks of fighting with Benghazi Revolutionary Shoura Council (BRSC).

Fighting continued in Sabri district of Benghazi between forces of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council and the Libyan army. A total of 25 Libyan National Army (LNA) troops were killed and 170 wounded in two weeks of fighting with Benghazi Revolutionary Shoura Council (BRSC).
There were reports of continued fighting at the Brak Al-Shati civilian and military airport between the Misratan Third Force and the Libyan National Army.
Zintan was hit three times by a Libya Dawn jet fighter, according to an LNA Western Region military source. No one was injured in the first two raids, but there was damage to some buildings.

Fierce fighting was reported between the Libya Dawn alliance and the rival tribes' army and Al-Sawa'iq and Al-Qa'qa brigades loyal to Lt-Gen Khalifah Haftar. Libya Dawn took full control of Um Shwayshah camp near Al-Watiyah airbase.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: Government of Libya (2014-) General National Congress
column23: Nineteen prisoners were released from the Jawiya prison in the city of Misrata. The 2011 revolution-war prisoners were supporters of the former Qaddafi regime and originated from different cities, but did not name the cities.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: A policeman was injured Thursday in an attack against a police station in Tripoli. The Islamic State Group (IS) claimed the attack. The bombing targeted the police station in the district of Zaouiyet Dahmani in Tripoli.

column11: Government of Libya (2014-) General National Congress
column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: An armed group raided the home of the Omer Al-Hassi’s information minister, Ali Al-Huni and arrested him along with all his dinner party guests.
Under the slogan ' Steadfastness Friday ', the cities of Tripoli , Misrata , Zawia , Gharian , Zlitin and Sebha witnessed mass demonstrations asking all Revolutionists of Libya to unite.
Under the slogan ' Steadfastness Friday ', the cities of Tripoli , Misrata , Zawia , Gharian , Zlitin and Sebha witnessed mass demonstrations asking all Revolutionists of Libya to unite.

column22: Agence France Presse; Xinhua General News Service; Libya Herald; Al-Jazeera TV; Al-Sharq al-Awsat
column23: Clashes broke out between fighters from the Islamic State group and the Misratan-based 166 Brigade of Fajr Libya militia coalition on Saturday in Hawrawah, 70km east of Sirte. Misratan Libya Dawn forces claim to have killed 16 Islamic State [IS] fighters and lost 6 of their own in the fierce battles in Sirte. A high-ranking Islamic State (IS) leader from Tunisia, Ahmed Rouissi, was killed in the clashes.
Air forces loyal to the elected government carried out strikes on Fajr Libya warehouses and positions in the port of Zuwara, west of Tripoli. There were no reports of casualties.
Zintan [Al-Zintan] airport was bombed by Libya Dawn aircraft on Saturday [14 March]. No damage reported.
At least four people were killed and five were seriously wounded in communal violence in Kufra in tit-for-tat violence between Tebu-Zwai populations.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: A total of 25 Libyan National Army (LNA) troops were killed and 170 wounded in two weeks of fighting with Benghazi Revolutionary Shoura Council (BRSC).
Islamic State group clashed with fighters from the Fajr Libya militia alliance in the central city of Sirte on Sunday. 2 men from Misratan Battalion 166 killed.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Two people including a policeman were killed and five were injured after an explosive device was detonated at the Ghiran checkpoint in the western region of Tripoli (near Janzour). IS later said it orchestrated the Tripoli bomb attack.

column22: Associated Press International; Libya Herald; Libya Observer
column23: A car bomb struck the base of the 166th Misratan Battalion killing one and wounding another person. Islamic State later claimed responsibility in retaliation for Misratan militias activities in Sirte.
A warplane of Libya dawn on Sunday carried out an airstrike against a site of Islamic State (IS) militants in Libya's western city of Sirte. Their losses could not be assessed.
A detainee at Bersis prison was tortured to confess to crimes since being detained in March.

Fajr Libya militia fighters continue to fight Islamic State group militants in Sirte. Six IS militants were killed in a sudden attack by the 166 battalion of the General Staff on an IS checkpoint in Abu Hadi district in southern Sirte.
Libya Dawn aircraft bombed sites for [Gen Khalifah] Haftar near Al-Zintan.

column22: Associated Press International; Agence France Presse
column23: 2 Misratan Libya Dawn fighters were killed in an attack by Islamic State militants near the town of Nofaliya.
10 Misratan Libya Dawn fighters were killed in an attack by Islamic State militants near the town of Ben Jawad.

column6: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Special Forces
column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Bomb disposal experts defused two six kilogram explosive devices in in Laithi.
Operation Dignity forces from __Brak claim they have taken nothern checkpoint of_ Sebha from _Misrata militias and captured their tanks.

Misratan forces, principally from 166 Battalion, re-entered Nawafliya. Troops made considerable gains but did not completely secure the area. Two buildings in Nawafliya were destroyed in the assault with unconfirmed reports that Misratan forces were able to take a number of militants captive during the fighting.
Fierce fighting was reported south of Zawia with the Libyan National Army (LNA) and members of the Libya Dawn alliance.
Clashes between Libya Dawn and Zintan forces in the town of Bir al-Ghanam left 26 dead. 9 Libya Dawn fighters were killed and 17 members of the Zintan forces were killed.
The Misratan 166 battalion of the General Staff clashes with IS militants in Harawa district in eastern Sirte.

On Thursday, warplanes from the Islamist-backed government, who occupied capital Tripoli, bombed the southern town of Zintan, a stronghold for the secular internationally-recognized government now exiled in Tobruk.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: A warplane from Libyan internationally recognized government's air force on Thursday attacked Mitiga airport in the capital of Tripoli in retaliation for an earlier bombing in Zintan. No casualties reported.
In Sebha’s Al-Jadeed district, members of the Awld Hudair and Megharah tribes protested in solidarity with their people in Brak Chatti.

column22: Agence France Presse; WAL news agency; The Libya Observer
column23: Clashes erupted in Al-Aziziya region, 45 kilometres southwest of the capital Tripoli, between Libya Dawn forces and armed groups from the so-called tribes' army backed with Zintani militias after they managed to infiltrate the region. A top dignity operation commander was killed.

Al-Shurooq forces (Operation Sunrise) of the General Staff gained full control of Al-Nawfaliyah town in eastern Sirte following fierce battles against IS militants who used the town as a base to launch attacks on oil fields in the region. The IS militants have now fled inside Sirte.

10 pro-Dawn Tuareg fighters and a leading Tuareg commander in Obari [Ubari] were killed in renewed fighting in the town between the pro-Libya Dawn Tuaregs and Tebu [Tabu] fighters loyal to the House of Representatives. Tuareg militants were  forced out of the camp.

The towns of Tripoli, Misratah, Al-Zawiyah, Gharyan, Zlitin, and Sabha witnessed this Friday evening [20 March] huge demonstrations which stressed the need to fight the remnants of the previous regime's supporters who had become a source of concern for the security and stability of Libya.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: An LNA soldier was killed in Sabri in on-going fighting between the forces of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council (BRSC) and the Libyan army (LNA). Five others were injured.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: A 15-year old boy died when a missile hit his family’s apartment in Fuwayhat in on-going fighting between the forces of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council (BRSC) and the Libyan army (LNA). Another missile hit a parked car, but no one was reported hurt.

column22: Associated Press International; Al Jazeera TV
column23: The tribes' army and fighters of Al-Sawa'iq and Al-Qa'qa battled Libya Dawn militias outside the capital. Both sides claimed control of al-Kasarat in Aziziya, south of Tripoli but confirmation not available. A senior Libya Dawn Operation commander Salah Al-Burki was killed.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Army airstrikes on Saturday targeted Matiga base - Tripoli's only functioning airport - focusing on gunmen and munitions warehouses belonging to Libya Dawn. Warplanes also struck two other encampments used by forces loyal to the Islamist Tripoli government.
Aircraft belonging to the Libya National Army (LNA) carried out airstrikes against Zuwara airport.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Fighting was reported between the forces of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council (BRSC) and the Libyan army (LNA) in Leithi, Hawari and the centre of Bengahzi.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Fighting was reported between the forces of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council (BRSC) and the Libyan army (LNA) in Leithi, Hawari and the centre of Bengahzi.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: A soldier was killed in Sabri district of Benghazi. Sixteen other soldiers were injured in fighting in the same area.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Fighting was reported between the forces of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council (BRSC) and the Libyan army (LNA) in Leithi, Hawari and the centre of Bengahzi.
A 29-year old student with no record of fighting in any revolutionary group was arrested and tortured to death by severe beating by General Haftar's militias.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: A 21-year-old civilian was killed when a missile hit his home in Benghazi in on-going fighting between the forces of the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council (BRSC) and the Libyan army (LNA).
A transport aircraft was hit in an air strike using cluster bombs by the Tobruk government on Al-Jufrah airbase southeast Libya, targeting Libya Dawn militia.

A car bomb was set off outside a security headquarter in Zaruk area in the centre of Misratah, injuring a man and his daughter. The Islamic State (IS) claimed responsibility for Sunday’s car bomb explosion outside the security administration building in Misrata.

During the last few days, Libyan army forces belonging to the country's internationally recognized government were tightening up the siege on Tripoli by taking Rishvana, Nasiriyah, Tarhouna and al-Zahra, towns adjacent to southern and western part of Tripoli.

column23: Heavy clashes were reported in a number of districts in Benghazi, including Kish, Fuwayhat, Hawari, Leithi and the downtown area.  The sound of mortar fire could be heard in much of the city. LNA aircraft were also used.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: The Brega Martyrs Brigade militant leader Mohamed Al-Araibi, more commonly known as Bouka, was killed in fighting in Benghazi's Gwarsha district.

column22: Associated Press International; Agence France Presse
column23: Soldiers loyal to Libya's internationally recognized government shot down a Libya Dawn MiG 23 warplane at Ar-Rajban, some 170 kilometres (105 miles) southwest of Tripoli after it bombed the town of Zintan. The Libya TV channel reported that pro-government forces had captured one of the pilots and another had died at the scene.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Heavy clashes were reported in a number of districts in Benghazi, including Kish, Fuwayhat, Hawari, Leithi and the downtown area.  The sound of mortar fire could be heard in much of the city. LNA aircraft were also used.

column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Special Forces
column22: Agence France Presse; Jamahiriya News Agency (JANA); Libya Herald
column23: The Libyan National Army (LNA) bombed Libya Dawn's operations room in Tarhouna, 90 kilometres south east of the Tripoli. An ammunition store and training base for Libya Dawn were targeted. AFP reported eight Libyan civilians killed in the strike.

column10: UNSMIL: United Nations Support Mission in Libya
column23: UN special envoy Bernardino Leon was prevented from leaving Tobruk airport by protesters in order to hold talks with members of the Libyan House of Representative.

A Tarhouna family were reported murdered and their home set ablaze in an apparent act of revenge for airstrikes by the Libyan National Army (LNA) on Tarhouna. The town’s Marghani family, led by Salah Marghani and supporters of Libya Dawn, are accused of the Habshi massacre.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column10: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Special Forces
column22: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International; Libya Herald; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Three suicide bombings took place in Laythi district of Benghazi, killing between 7 and 12 (including bomber) and wounding 25. The Islamic State group's affiliate in Libya as well as militants affiliated to the Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries were responsible for the car bombings that targeted Libya's elected government and allied fighters.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Benghazi witnessed some of its heaviest clashes in recent weeks when the LNA launched a fierce offensive on Ansar Al-Sharia, IS and their allies in a number of locations throughout the city

column8: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Two brothers of the member of the House of Representatives (HoR) for Tarhouna were kidnapped when gunmen burst into the family home in Tripoli’s Salahaddin district, spraying it with gunfire.

column22: Agence France Presse; Libya Herald; Xinhua General News Service
column23: A suicide bomb hit Libya's central city of Sirte. The Islamic State group killed five Islamist-backed militiamen from Misrata's Brigade 166 (Operation Sunrise) and the attacker in an attack on a checkpoint Wednesday in the Libyan coastal city of Sirte.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: The economic attaché at the Sudanese embassy in Tripoli was abducted and then later freed. The identity and motives of abductors was not disclosed.
Renewed clashes between Tuareg and Tabu tribes were reported in Ubari. No details on fatalities reported.

column23: Operation Sunrise, set up three months ago by Libya Dawn to take the eastern oil fields and terminals, is reported to have pulled its forces from near Sidra and at Ben Jawad and is now based west of Sirte .
A 30-year old man from Gharyounis died under torture at the Criminal Investigation Department in Benghazi at the end of March.

Residents of Sirte held a sit-in on Friday to demand reactivation of government institutions and declare Sirte a city of peace.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: The Libyan National Army (LNA) in Benghazi claimed that that there are no longer any militants in the city’s Leithi district. The Benghazi Revolutionaries Shoura Council [fighters] retreated to Gwarsha after the military hit positions in Leithi with heavy artillery.

column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Special Forces
column23: Soldiers belonging to the Libyan military managed to free three Egyptian workers who were held by armed groups in the city of Benghazi.

Al-Shurooq (Sunrise) forces withdrew from the outskirts of Al-Sidra port and Ben Jawad to Sirte. The withdrawal signals a tactical shift to focus the fight on IS militants in Sirte and on-going negotiations with UNSMIL.

Al-Shurooq (Sunrise) forces withdrew from the outskirts of Al-Sidra port and Ben Jawad to Sirte. The withdrawal signals a tactical shift to focus the fight on IS militants in Sirte and on-going negotiations with UNSMIL.

column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Special Forces
column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Clashes were reported in Benghazi between military forces and the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council.
A Filipino oil worker was killed and five others wounded in a rocket attack in Zawiya. Neither the Libyan National Army nor Libya Dawn militias has admitted to launching the missiles.
An explosive device went off inside the Higher Institute for Professions in Derna leaving two people injured and causing massive damage to the buildings.
Renegade general Khalifa Haftar’s fighter jets launched air strikes in Abu-Rashada district 15 Km west of Gharyan causing only material damage.

Renegade general Khalifa Haftar’s fighter jets launched air strikes on Sooq Al-Arbiaa in Al-Qalaa town in Nafousa mountain. The air raids on Al-Qalaa and Gharyan were two in a series of others conducted by Haftar’s jets on different western districts like Zuwara.
Renegade general Khalifa Haftar's air force launched fresh airstrikes in Zuwara. Two people were reported injured.
Following a rocket attack on the town, there were protests in Zawiya’s Martyrs’ Square with calls for a jihad against the Warshefana, who were blamed for the attack (although unconfirmed).
Two young Tebu men were been killed near Obari in what was described as a racially-motivated attack.

column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Special Forces
column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: A soldier was killed in Sabri district of Benghazi and fourteen wounded from the Libyan army.
Five militants were killed on Monday in an armed clashes between pro-government forces and Libya Dawn.
Libya Dawn jet fighters launched fresh airstrikes against targets in Zintan, Kikla, Bir Ghanem and around Watiya airbase.
Libya Dawn jet fighters launched fresh airstrikes against targets in Zintan, Kikla, Bir Ghanem and around Watiya airbase.
Libya Dawn jet fighters launched fresh airstrikes against targets in Zintan, Kikla, Bir Ghanem and around Watiya airbase.
Renegade general Hafter's fighter jets bombarded the eastern entrance to the city of Derna. The Shura Council of Mujahidin are protecting the city.
Operation Dignity jet fighters carried out an airstrike on the ex-tanks camp in Gharyan. No casualties reported in the airstrikes.
Libya Dawn jet fighters launched fresh airstrikes against targets in Zintan, Kikla, Bir Ghanem and around Watiya airbase.
Hafter’s fighter jets raided, with three missiles, the Indian construction firm (Smilicks), which lies next to the satellite station in Sooq Al-Khamis (Imsahil) district western Tripoli.
Heavy clashes continued near __Brak military base as Dignity Forces try to take it from M_israta militias. Dignity Forces claim they've taken down a fighter jet near _Temenhint base.
Renegade Hafter's fighter jets bombarded Ragdalin and Al-Essa regions causing only material damage.
Sirte Oil company operations have been disrupted by demonstrators demanding the co gives them work.

column22: Agence France Presse; The Libya Observer
column23: Islamic State gunmen attacked the southern gate of Misrata known as "Dofan Checkpoint", leaving seven Misratan members of the Libya Shield Force killed and others injured.
Libya Dawn aircraft today bombed Zintan airport causing some damage

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: The local council of Janzour announced that a sit in would be conducted in front of the UN Support Mission in Libya on Wednesday in protest against the aerial bombardment of civilians of different Libyan cities. The council said in a statement civil society activists from Al Zawiya, Zwara, and Gharyan which were recently targets of aerial bombing will be taking part in the sit in at UNSMIL offices in Palm Trees village west of Tripoli.
Sirte Oil company operations have been disrupted by demonstrators demanding the co gives them work.

column22: Jamahiriya News Agency (JANA); WAL news agency
column23: Misrata's Battalion 166 struck the Islamic state in Nuflya area.  Six IS fighters were reported killed after clashing with brigade forces after a Misratan patrol was hit by a booby-trapped device.
Sirte Oil company operations have been disrupted by demonstrators demanding the co gives them work.

column11: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: On Thursday [2 April], three civilians were killed as a result of indiscriminate shelling and shooting almost all of which is being blamed on [Islamist militia] Ansar al-Shari'ah and its allies in Benghazi.
Libya's Brega oil port has been closed by protesters over the past week.

column22: Agence France Presse; Libya Herald; WAL news agency; Xinhua General News Service
column23: Fighting beween Wersheffana and Zintan militias (The Tribes Army) and Libya Dawn broke out when armed men launched an assault on the edges of Aziziya, a town just 35 kilometres (22 miles) south of Tripoli. 18 people were killed and the Zintan militia announced it had retaken Aziziya.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Eight people, including children, were injured in a random rocket attack the Sidi Abeid area (between Sabri and Salmani district) of Benghazi. The attack was blamed on Ansar al-Sharia.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column23: Two Egyptian workers were reported killed in a random rocket attack the Benghazi’s central district of Juliana. The attack was blamed on Ansar al-Sharia.

column15: Tajura' wa an Nawahi al Arba
column23: Tripoli's Mitiga airport was hit by a mortar round that killed an airport employee. It was not known who fire
